Le contenu du poste est libell√© en anglais car il n√©cessite de nombreuses interactions avec nos filiales √† l‚Äôinternational, l'anglais √©tant la langue de travail.

Accelerator ‚Äì Digital Data Analyst ‚Äì All Gender

Location: Paris

Remote working : 2 days remote working, 3 days on site

About the job

At Sanofi, we‚Äôre committed to providing the next-gen healthcare that patients and customers need. It‚Äôs about harnessing data insights and leveraging AI responsibly to search deeper and solve sooner than ever before. Join our Accelerator R&D as Digital Data Analyst and you can help make it happen. Your job? As a Data Analyst, you will have a direct impact on the business by deriving insights from Data and ensuring the quality, usability, and security of Sanofi‚Äôs data.

Sanofi currently has great opportunities to join our R&D Accelerator. You will have a chance to help build our Digital R&D products by developing outstanding capabilities that will participate in new drug discovery together with scientists, in trial efficiency and cycle time reduction, leveraging Data Analytics and Artificial Intelligence. This is a great role for someone who is analytical, creative, curious, with strong attention to detail. In return we offer you the opportunity of working in an innovative environment helping Sanofi build better solution.

Main responsibilities:

  • Perform data analysis and provide input to solution design and architecture to ensure the solution meets requirements.
  • Performs exploratory data analysis and feature generation
  • Drive alignment across stakeholders on enterprise data models and definitions
  • Partner with stakeholders to get buy-in on, develop, and implement Sanofi‚Äôs data management standards, policies, and best practices
  • Gather requirements needed to sustainably implement data management standards

About you

Experience:

  • Demonstrate strong understanding of databases and data structures, and
  • Previous experience working with tools used to support data management, specifically business glossary and metadata management, data cataloging, and data quality
  • Experience developing best Lean & Agile practices, policies, and/or procedures
  • Have worked in an environment with stringent privacy laws and regulations
  • Experience in a healthcare company while not essential would be a strong plus

Soft skills:

  • Experience working with multiple teams to drive alignment and results
  • Self-motivated, takes initiative
  • Problem solving & critical thinking

Technical Skills

  • Strong experience in SQL writing and profiling of Data & Python
  • Good knowledge of cloud computing and data storages. Knowing AWS is a plus
  • One or multiple of the following visualization skills: Tableau, PowerBI, seaborn, matplolib, plotly, ggplot, bokeh
  • Project management & support: JIRA projects & service desk, Confluence, Teams
  • Knowledge of Informatica Suite of Tools

Education:

  • Master‚Äôs Degree in Data Analytics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics

Languages: English

Why choose us?

We provide a highly collaborative environment, with an opportunity to work with a world class team. You will be able to:¬†

  • Engage in meaningful work that combines the challenges of the medical, pharma, and technical fields, offering abundant opportunities for professional growth and impact
  • Contribute to a company that is not only a leader in healthcare but also a pioneer in digital transformation, shaping the future of global health.¬†
  • Be part of an organization that values diversity, inclusion, and the richness of different backgrounds and experiences.¬†

Pursue Progress. Discover Extraordinary.

Progress doesn‚Äôt happen without people ‚Äì people from different backgrounds, in different locations, doing different roles, all united by one thing: a desire to make miracles happen. You can be one of those people. Chasing change, embracing new ideas and exploring all the opportunities we have to offer. Let‚Äôs pursue progress. And let‚Äôs discover extraordinary together.

At Sanofi, we provide equal opportunities to all regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or gender identity.¬†

Watch our ALL IN video and check out our Diversity Equity and Inclusion actions at sanofi.com!
column38:
At Sanofi, we pursue the miracles of science to improve people‚Äôs lives. In France, more than 20,000 passionate men and women tirelessly push their limits to transform the practice of medicine and improve patient health with drugs and vaccines.

The desire to advance science is our strength. We want to improve the health of populations and find new solutions for patients by combining scientific progress and advanced technologies.

In France, we provide more than 400 drugs, vaccines and health products, including 18 vaccines and more than 200 drugs of major therapeutic interest.

Sanofi‚Äôs roots are anchored in France where most of the Research and Development is located. In the French medical research landscape, we hold a central role and actively participate in the construction of a dynamic health sector.

To contribute to the world of tomorrow, three commitments guide our actions: access to care for the most vulnerable, inclusion of all through work and preservation of the planet. Nothing would be possible without the remarkable mobilization of our employees and partners.

We believe that information is the key to change, especially when it comes from true data.

Using this personal data, fully anonymized, our SaaS platform foxintelligence.io had become the reference in the European digital market intelligence community, with dozens of famous brands as clients. üìà
The common thread between Deliveroo, Backmarket, JustEat, and The Boston Consulting Group? They‚Äôre going fast and they put their trust in Foxintelligence.

Supported by investors since the very beginning (17M from Daphni, Partech, GFC, and eFounders) and being recently incorporated into the NielsenIQ group, we are well on our way to conquering our space üèòÔ∏è

Our HQ is in Paris, but we are openly remote-friendly. Our team of 120 multidisciplinary talents (tech, data, business) works from all over France. We are convinced that the key to our collective success comes from our caring culture, our remote policy, and our continuous innovation through the way we work üë©‚Äçüíª

We have a transparent salary grid accessible to everyone, we provide training on climate issues and possible actions, and we try our best to communicate clearly and frequently on Foxintelligence‚Äôs strategies and decisions üòä

column13: Data Product Owner / Data Intelligence - Associate Manager
column15:
Tu feras partie de l‚Äô√©quipe Data Intelligence, dont l‚Äôobjectif est d‚Äôaccompagner nos clients sur la transformation de leur business √† travers la data et les technologies permettant une meilleure exploitation des donn√©es et l‚Äôidentification de nouvelles sources de revenu.¬†

En tant de Data Product Owner, ton r√¥le principal sera de concevoir, construire et fournir une expertise afin de‚ÄØ:¬†¬†

  • D√©finir des nouveaux Data products en aidant nos clients √† identifier les besoins et les opportunit√©s de collecte et d‚Äôexploitation des donn√©es √† des fins d‚Äôoptimisation commerciales ou op√©rationnel, en imaginant les cas d‚Äôusage les plus pertinents et en cr√©ant des produits innovants.¬†¬†

  • D√©velopper des Data products, de la sp√©cification au d√©ploiement jusqu‚Äô√† leur adoption en agissant en tant que coordinateur et superviseur entre les utilisateurs m√©tiers, les data engineers et les d√©veloppeurs en traduisant les besoins des utilisateurs en fonctionnalit√©s.¬†¬†

Voici des exemples de type de Data Products‚ÄØ: Dashboards, Data Warehouses, Data Marketplace, site web & applications, Int√©gration de plateforme marketing (CRM, Web-analyse,E-commerce‚Ä¶), mod√©lisation et analyse de donn√©es prescriptive et pr√©dictive (segmentation, pr√©visions‚Ä¶).¬†

  • Comprendre les besoins m√©tiers et identifier les sources de donn√©es et les ressources techniques disponibles¬†

  • Prioriser et nourrir une roadmap produit¬†

  • Travailler la prise en main et l‚Äôadoption des data products aupr√®s des utilisateurs¬†

  • Mesurer la valeur d√©livr√©e (qualit√©, utilisation, adoption, ROI, CA g√©n√©r√©‚Ä¶)¬†

En plus de ces responsabilit√©s, tu aideras le Manager¬†Data Intelligence dans‚ÄØ:¬†¬†

  • L‚Äôam√©lioration de‚ÄØl‚Äôoffre de servies et le portefeuille client en favorisant le upsell, le cross-sell et √† l‚Äôexploration de nouvelles opportunit√©s client et partnaire.¬†

Tu contribueras activement √† renforcer la reconnaissance de Jakala en tant qu‚Äôexpert dans le domaine du d√©veloppement de data products et de la transformation‚ÄØ:¬†

  • Tu apprendras des membres de l‚Äô√©quipe, tu les formeras et tu anticiperas les prochaines innovations et tendances¬†

  • Tu es essentiel.le pour instaurer la culture de Jakala en France afin que les prochaines g√©n√©rations de #Jakalers ressentent nos valeurs lorsqu‚Äôils entrent en contact avec n‚Äôimporte quel membre de l‚Äô√©quipe¬†

Tu seras dans une position unique pour b√©n√©ficier et partager avec tous les #Jakalers √† travers le monde, que tu souhaites concevoir des solutions globales avec nos clients ou tirer.

column15:
Le Wagon is a global leader in immersive tech training. Our mission is to train people from all backgrounds in coding, data and product skills, give them the best learning experience of their life, and help them accelerate in their career. We also help companies become more data-driven by leveraging their data and unlocking their employees‚Äô potential through corporate training.

Founded in Paris in 2013, Le Wagon now has campuses in +40 cities across 25 countries, including global tech hubs such as Berlin, London, Tokyo, Shanghai, Singapore, and S√£o Paulo. Most importantly, Le Wagon is a community of 26,000+ graduates from all walks of life, including career changers, digital nomads and many entrepreneurs - who‚Äôve created 220+ tech startups and raised $1B+ and counting!

About the role

We are seeking a Data Product Manager with a passion for creating and continuously improving technical training content. This role involves overseeing the development of training modules in Data Analytics and Data Science, managing updates to our existing courses, and ensuring the technical excellence of our offerings.

With such a wide variety of content types, we are looking for a data product manager to manage several content development projects, create and write new technical content on data analytics and data science, propose ideas of content development and improvement roadmap, improve and maintain our technical products and setups (Wott, etc), manages product data analysis projects to define what works, student feedback, satisfaction with content, etc.

Your Mission

Technical Content Oversight

  • Take full ownership of data training products, serving as the primary point of contact for all content updates across various departments (B2B, B2C, B2U).

  • Act as the content gatekeeper, setting and overseeing the global development roadmap and budget for training products.

  • Conduct ongoing technology and industry research to stay ahead of trends in data analytics and data science.

  • Coordinate and define the roles and missions of freelancers engaged in our bootcamps.

  • Lead content creation and updates, manage the backlog of content suggestions, and participate in pedagogical committees to prioritize updates.

Training Course Production Management

  • Handle incoming briefs from the Product team, effectively estimating project needs, target audiences, budgets, and technical requirements.

  • Develop and implement detailed roadmaps for new training initiatives, including planning kickoff meetings and setting critical milestones and deadlines.

  • Provide regular updates to stakeholders on production status, challenges, and technical issues, ensuring all materials meet the highest standards of quality.

Freelancer Collaboration

  • Ensure freelancers have access to necessary resources, including content, templates, and technical support, while facilitating content validation by technical leads.

  • Manage contractual and legal relationships with freelancers, including NDAs, project deadlines, and budget allocations.

Data Process and Technical Product Management

  • Oversee data analysis projects to gauge content effectiveness, gather student feedback, and measure overall satisfaction.

  • Maintain and enhance our technical platforms and data tools (Wott, etc), collaborating with the engineering & data team to advocate for and implement feature improvements.

Create Data Models & answer business needs

  • Collect, clean, and analyze large and complex data sets from multiple sources

  • Write complex SQL queries and create DBT models

  • Produce and maintain data models documentation

  • Identify and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the success of data-driven initiatives

  • Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to provide real-time insights to key stakeholders

column15:
At AXA IM our purpose, to act for human progress by investing for what matters, is central to every action we take as a business. As a responsible asset manager, we actively invest for the long-term to help our clients, our people and the world to prosper.

¬†

As a future Senior Market Data Analyst, you will report to our Head of Market Data services and you will be part of the Data & Analytics Management team.

¬†

DISCOVER your opportunity

¬†

Within the Data & Analytics Management department, the Market Data team has a transversal role, in charge of the Procure to Pay process for AXA IM globally (offices located in Europe, Asia, US): this covers analysis of the needs, identification of providers, costs negotiation, contracts set-up (inc. legal review), invoices management, finance controlling and reporting.

The Market Data team is operating in an international and multi-cultural context in relation with various people among others AXA IM users, Providers, Finance teams, AXA Insurance entities, .‚Ä¶

¬†

AXA IM is looking for a Senior Market Data Analyst (alternatively a Senior Market Data Finance Specialist) to reinforce its team in a challenging environment.

The candidate (profile Market Data Analyst) will primarily be in charge of:

  • Analyze the needs, propose solutions/alternatives
  • Negotiate with Market Data providers (new contracts, renewals, divestments, ‚Ä¶) incl. costs and legal terms
  • Perform analysis (optimization plans/mergers & acquisitions, ‚Ä¶.)
  • Communicate internally on rights & obligations to make sure services are used in a compliant manner
  • Participate to the Budget creation and follow-up

A Market Data Finance Specialist profile will be more focused on:

  • Management of the INFOmatch database
  • Analysis of the Actuals compared to Budget / INFOmatch figures
  • Supervision of the invoice monitoring, inc. accruals and reversed accruals processes
  • Budget creation and follow-up
  • Reporting

Personnalisez votre mani√®re de travailler‚ÄØ: Travailler pour une entreprise qui s'engage √† garantir flexibilit√© et √©quilibre √† ses employ√©s, en vous offrant une large gamme d'avantages (int√©ressement, t√©l√©travail, avantages sociaux comp√©titifs, etc.).

Epanouissez-vous par la diversit√© de notre communaut√©‚ÄØ: Jouer un r√¥le au sein d'une entreprise inclusive qui reconna√Æt et valorise activement les diff√©rences individuelles dans un environnement de travail diversifi√© et inclusif.

Faites avancer le monde‚ÄØ: Rejoindre un employeur responsable qui agit en faveur des causes soci√©tales et environnementales en tant qu'investisseur, assureur et entreprise, notamment au travers de l'association AXA Atout C≈ìur. Dans le cadre de notre engagement en faveur de la durabilit√© et de la responsabilit√© environnemental, nous c√©l√®brerons votre arriv√©e en plantant un arbre.

column15:
Description de l‚Äôemploi

Op√©rant sur 62 march√©s, le Groupe HSBC est l‚Äôun des plus grands groupes de services bancaires et financiers dans le monde. Nous sommes plus de 219 000 collaborateurs √† accompagner chaque jour plus de 39 millions de clients. Notre strat√©gie repose sur quatre piliers : capitaliser sur nos succ√®s, accro√Ætre la digitalisation, adapter notre mod√®le op√©rationnel pour plus d‚Äôagilit√© et simplicit√©, et mener la transition √©cologique. Notre mission est de ‚Äú cr√©er un monde d‚Äôopportunit√©s ‚Äú en responsabilisant nos collaborateurs et en cr√©ant et cultivant un environnement inclusif, o√π chacun peut s‚Äô√©panouir et se sentir √† sa place.

Cr√©er un environnement inclusif pour nos collaborateurs, c‚Äôest aussi favoriser un bon √©quilibre entre vie personnelle et professionnelle. Nous avons r√©cemment sign√© un nouvel accord sur le t√©l√©travail, permettant √† nos collaborateurs de travailler en pr√©sentiel et √† distance de fa√ßon r√©guli√®re et flexible. En France, Paris est devenu fin 2020 le nouveau si√®ge d‚ÄôHSBC Continental Europe. Ce changement renforce le r√¥le de la France en Europe et permet d‚Äôaccompagner au mieux nos clients au sein du march√© national et des march√©s internationaux.

HSBC a √©t√© certifi√© ‚Äú Top Employer 2024 ‚Äú en Europe !

Cette reconnaissance du ‚Äú Top Employers Institute ‚Äú r√©compense nos pratiques RH et reconna√Æt HSBC comme leader RH en France, en Allemagne, en Italie, au Luxembourg, en Pologne et en Espagne. Venez visiter notre site carri√®re pour en savoir plus !

Equipe :
L‚Äô√©quipe Data and Analytics Office (DAO) est rattach√©e √† la fonction Digital Business Services dirig√©e par la Direction Chief Operating Officer.

Le poste est situ√© dans les locaux HSBC au sein du quartier de la D√©fense.

L‚Äô√©quipe Data and Analytics Office (DAO) est en charge de promouvoir au sein de HSBC une strat√©gie et une culture ax√©e sur la donn√©e √† travers les 3 pilliers ci-dessous :

  • Protect : Prot√©ger nos donn√©es gr√¢ce √† des proc√©dures robustes de gestin des donn√©es et d‚Äôam√©lioration de leur gouvernance (ex : s‚Äôassurer que les donn√©es utilis√©es proviennent de sources fiables, r√©pondent √† des exigences de qualit√© de donn√©es et nous permettent de r√©pondent √† nos obligations r√©glementaires).
  • Connect : Promouvoir une culture Data √† travers des communications de sensibilisation et de formation. Cette connection permet de prot√©ger nos donn√©es tout en les utilisant pour apporter de la valeur √† nos clients (internes et externes).
  • Unlock : Permettre une plus ample ouverture de la valeur des donn√©es afin de mieux servir nos clients (ex : accro√Ætre l‚Äôexp√©rience des clients et salari√©s ainsi que les revenus, optimiser le capital, commercialiser la donn√©e √† utiliser en interne, am√©liorer la gestion du risque et r√©duire les co√∏t etc.

Mission :

Vous aurez comme principales missions de seconder le Legal Entity Record Officer (LERO) afin de l‚Äôaider sur la gestion du cycle de vie des donn√©es d√©tenues par la banque, en veillant √† ce que les donn√©es stock√©es dans nos syst√®mes, r√©pertoires et archives physiques soient bien conserv√©es pendant la dur√©e de conservation requise l√©galement et bien d√©truites une fois ce d√©lai expir√©.

Pour cela, les principales activit√©s sont les suivantes:
  • S‚Äôassurer que les nouvelles proc√©dures ‚Äú Data Storage ‚Äú soient comprises et appliqu√©es dans tous les d√©partements
  • Coordonner les formations avec l‚Äô√©quipe Information Lifecycle Management (ILM) et s‚Äôassurer que les d√©partements les suivent
  • Coordonner avec le groupe (ILM), les m√©tiers et fonctions (yc √©quipes informatiques)
  • Revoir les p√©riodes de conservation avec les √©quipes juridiques et de conformit√© et s‚Äôassurer qu‚Äôelles soient suivies par les m√©tiers et fonctions
  • Participer √† la revue annuelle des registres des donn√©es (Record Retention Schedules)
  • S‚Äôassurer de la conservation des donn√©es et de leur destruction au-del√† des dur√©es l√©gales maximales de conservation
  • Maintenir les inventaires et produire les diff√©rents indicateurs/metrics pour les updates aux comit√©s de gouvernance
  • Participer aux travaux de revue des DRRS avec les records owners des d√©partements dans le nouvel outil groupe.

#DATA

Conditions

                                                                                        <ul> <li>BAC + 2/3 formation en √©cole d'ing√©nieur, de commerce ou universit√© avec une sp√©cialit√© en Gestion de donn√©es/Data Management, Syst√®me d'information/organisation.</li> <li>Vous savez faire preuve d'organisation, d'esprit d'analyse, d'autonomie et de curiosit√©.</li> <li>Vous avez un tr√®s bon niveau Excel, Word et Powerpoint.</li> <li>Vous ma√Ætrisez le fran√ßais et avez un bon niveau en anglais.</li> <li>Un premier stage au sein d'un service bancaire ou informatique bancaire serait un plus pour une meilleure compr√©hension des donn√©es √† analyser</li> </ul>

Sa volont√© est de rassembler les gens, les id√©es et les capitaux qui stimulent le progr√®s et la croissance, contribuant √† cr√©er un monde meilleur - pour ses clients, ses collaborateurs, ses investisseurs, ses communaut√©s. Sa raison d‚Äô√™tre : Ouvrir un monde d‚Äôopportunit√©s !

column15:
Aircall is a place where voices are valued.

Backed by over $220 million of investment since 2015, we create technology that fuels accessible, transparent and collaborative communication to empower our base of 18,000+ customers (and growing) to make authentic, human connections.

Conversation is a cornerstone of our culture. Wherever our people find themselves in the Aircall world ‚Äì Paris, New York, San Francisco, Sydney, Madrid, London, Berlin, or at home ‚Äì everyone has a voice that is valued.

Whatever your background, wherever you‚Äôre from ‚Äì we want you to join the conversation. Let‚Äôs talk.

About the team

Our data team is the backbone of Aircall‚Äôs decision-making process, driving product development and business growth with cutting-edge data products, tools, and actionable insights

About the role

As a senior to Principal Growth Data Analyst, you'll provide invaluable insights to our growth organization in the Bay Area, acting as the data lead for the Growth team and working closely with our CTO, CPO, and other C-level executives. You'll support impactful initiatives, including pricing, packaging, multi-product strategies, and self-service approaches.

On top of the growth team, you‚Äôll collaborate cross-functionally with Sales, Finance, Marketing, and Customer Relations to translate data needs into powerful solutions. You'll also establish best practices in analytics and mentor team members, ensuring high standards in data governance and insight generation.

This position can be based in the Bay Area (preferred) or in our NYC HQ.

Your mission @ Aircall:

  • Partner with marketing, growth, and business leaders to define the growth strategy and deliver key projects in customer acquisition, engagement, and retention
  • Provide actionable insights and compelling narratives to influence major decisions at the C-level
  • Build a culture of experimentation by designing and executing rigorous AB tests to measure business impact¬†
  • Enhance team processes and leverage self-service analytics to better serve business leaders
  • Work with data engineers and become their relay to continuously improve the data stack, governance practices, and analysis quality
  • Develop the data-driven culture at Aircall

    • A little more about you:

  • 6+ years of analytical experience in a tech savvy environment with high standard outcome
  • Proficiency in SQL and Python for deriving insights
  • Data-driven, structured and solution oriented with extensive experience in building rigorous experiments
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to explain complex data clearly to stakeholders at all levels
  • You have an insatiable curiosity and are biased toward action
  • Previous experience contributing to growth initiatives is a plus

    • Key traits we look for:

    You are coachable, you are resilient, you are solution oriented coming to the table with great ideas, and you find the fun in a good challenge!¬†

    We will invest in you, as you invest in us. We believe that owning your growth and owning your success starts with you, but it's up to us to help provide the platform for learning, growing and building your career!

    Aircall is constantly moving forward. We‚Äôre building new roads to complete our journey, and we‚Äôre taking people with us who have the same builder mentality.

    Let‚Äôs grow together: Aircall is a place for those who dare to be bold and seek responsibility, excellence, and the opportunity to push themselves to new heights.

    We‚Äôre creating a place where great people trust one another and thrive together.

    People flourish at Aircall and now is the time to be part of the team and the journey we‚Äôre on.

    Why join us?

    üöÄ Key moment to join Aircall in terms of growth and opportunities

    üíÜ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è Our people matter, work-life balance is important at Aircall

    üìö Fast-learning environment, entrepreneurial and strong team spirit

    üåç 45+ Nationalities: cosmopolite & multi-cultural mindset

    üíµ Competitive salary package & equity

    üè® Medical, dental, and vision insurance is 100% covered

    üìà¬†401k plan with company matching!

    ‚úàÔ∏è¬†Unlimited PTO ‚Äî take the time you need to come to work feeling great!

    ‚≠êÔ∏è¬†Wellness, internet, and childcare reimbursements

    üíö¬†Generous parental leave policy

    DE&I Statement:¬†

    At Aircall, we believe diversity, equity and inclusion ‚Äì irrespective of origins, identity, background and orientations ‚Äì are core to our journey.¬†

    We pride ourselves on promoting active inclusion within our business to foster a strong sense of belonging for all. We‚Äôre working to create a place filled with diverse people who can enrich and learn from one another. We‚Äôre committed to ensuring that everyone not only has a seat at the table but is valued and respected at it by providing equal opportunities to develop and thrive.¬†¬†

    We will constantly challenge ourselves to make sure that we live up to our ambitions around diversity, equity and inclusion, and keep this conversation open. Above all else, we understand and acknowledge that we have work to do and much to learn.

    Want to know more about candidate privacy? Find our Candidate Privacy Notice here.

Aircall is on a mission to revolutionize the business phone industry!

We exist to empower every professional to have richer conversations. We provide an entirely cloud-based voice solution, which seamlessly integrates with popular productivity and helpdesk tools. We have raised more than $220 million since 2015, and our base of 8000+ customers (and growing) is at our forefront.

Behind our product are the amazing teams driving it, split between Paris, New York, Sydney, Madrid, London, Berlin and remote locations. Despite our distance, we all work together to drive our product!

column15:
About us¬†

We are in business to save independent retail in Europe!

Across our towns and city centres, unique neighbourhood shops have been overshadowed by large chains and e-commerce giants. To combat this, we‚Äôve created a BtoB wholesale marketplace designed to help independent retailers to compete against larger competitors and thus maintain a connected community of stores, brands and shoppers in the places we live.

Established in 2019 in France, we‚Äôve since expanded to other European countries, including Spain, Germany, UK and the Netherlands. Driven by our commitment to customer satisfaction, we constantly innovate to develop cutting-edge tools and services that set new standards in the market.

Get in touch if you are looking to join a purpose-driven, international team that revolutionizes an old-fashioned industry!

Together Let‚Äôs Rewild Retail!¬†

About your role¬†

Logistics is a pain for both retailers and brands. Independent retailers struggle with inventory management and reliable delivery while brands prefer to focus on marketing and product. Our mission is to delight our customers by creating an amazing product and delivery experience. We want to set new standards for businesses and brands.

We help brands ship their orders seamlessly and everywhere by partnering with the most relevant logistics partners. We help retailers by respecting the promised delivery date, decreasing click-to-order lead times, securing inventory and making sure the product comes in perfect condition. The logistics department was created in June 2021. This is a unique opportunity to have a meaningful impact on our customers and to get a 360 view on the e-commerce BtoB supply chain (transportation, fulfillment, cross-border shipping).

We believe interns can and should have responsibilities (we all started somewhere). This role will therefore bear true responsibilities. You will:¬†

  • Own programs aimed to improve service level, decrease costs or enhance our value proposition

  • Work closely with stakeholders from customer service, brand support, BI team, Ops strat, external logistics partners, finance¬†

  • Align and present tech asks to the product and tech teams

  • Track progress: develop KPIs and own ongoing performance tracking of logistic performance

  • Setup support: assess technical feasibility with data science team to set up dashboards

  • Report of the team activity & performances

What We Are Looking For

  • Analytical, curious, creativity & proactivity¬†

  • Ability to work closely with teams¬†

  • You enjoy and are used to working in a fast-paced & ever-changing environment¬†

  • Experienced in a similar role (within a startup is a plus)¬†

  • Fluent in English¬†

  • You have experience in data analysis and data visualization¬†

  • You have basic knowledge of supply chain

Benefits/Perks¬†

At Ankorstore, we offer a versatile range of benefits to support employees' well-being and work-life balance, fostering personal growth within an innovative and adaptable work environment.

  • We pay our interns and apprentices competitive salaries based on their year of study

  • You will have a hybrid contract, allowing you to work remotely from home as well as from our vibrant and inspiring WeWork offices located in the Opera neighbourhood in Paris

  • You‚Äôll get 10‚Ç¨ per work day (5‚Ç¨ funded by Ankorstore) to purchase food at restaurants, grocery stores, or delivery platforms through Swile

  • We reimburse 50% of your public transportation annual / monthly / weekly pass

  • Enjoy health benefits through Class Pass, offering you the flexibility to attend in-person classes, digital sessions, or wellness workshops, keeping you active and engaged

  • Paid leaves depending on the length of your internship/apprenticeship

Learn more about Ankorstore

  • Look around and visit our website, LinkedIn, Instagram, Facebook, Youtube and Welcome to the Jungle

  • Read about us in the media: How to build a 2 million unicorn in under 3 years, Rewild Retail, Ankorstore is shaping the shopping of the future, Mary Portas & Ankorstore

  • Ankorstart

Ankorstore is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace dedicated to promoting diversity. We don‚Äôt discriminate based on race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.
column38:
Ankorstore is on a mission to rewild retail.

With decades of experience in retail and building marketplaces, in 2019 the Ankorstore founding team knew it was time to create a global wholesale solution ‚Äì one that swings the balance in favour of independents and restores retail to its natural order. They‚Äôve created a new ecosystem that harnesses the power of modern technology to create a mutually beneficial community that reinvents the way brands and retailers work together. As a result, wild independents can thrive.

üëã L‚Äô√©quipe data:

Faisant partie int√©grante du pass Culture, le p√¥le data comprend des data analysts, data scientists et data engineers, sous la coordination du responsable data. column38:
Le pass Culture est l‚Äôune des r√©formes prioritaires du gouvernement en mati√®re culturelle. Il s‚Äôappuie sur une application gratuite et g√©olocalis√©e destin√©e √† favoriser l‚Äôacc√®s des jeunes aux arts et √† la culture, encourager et diversifier leurs pratiques culturelles et artistiques.

Le dispositif permet aux jeunes de b√©n√©ficier d‚Äôun cr√©dit en fonction de leur √¢ge (20 ‚Ç¨ √† 15 ans, 30 ‚Ç¨ √† 16 et 17 ans, 300 ‚Ç¨ √† 18 ans), qu‚Äôils peuvent d√©penser dans une vari√©t√© d‚Äôoffres physiques ou num√©riques pour approfondir ou s‚Äôinitier √† une pratique artistique.

En parall√®le, un volet collectif, inscrit dans la politique d‚Äô√âducation Artistique et Culturelle (EAC) est directement attribu√© aux √©tablissements scolaires. Chaque classe, de la 6√®me √† la Terminale, se voit allouer un cr√©dit de 20, 25 ou 30 euros par √©l√®ve, destin√© √† financer des activit√©s effectu√©es en groupes et encadr√©es par les professeurs.

In concrete terms, you will be required to:¬†

  • Support the steering of the HRBP dashboard: Assist the HRBP manager in monitoring and analyzing KPIs, contributing to informed decision-making.
  • Participate in HR projects: Depending on your interests, skills and the needs of the company, you will have the opportunity to get involved in various challenging and rewarding HR projects.

column15:
¬†A propos de Technip Energies¬†:

Technip Energies est une entreprise d‚Äôing√©nierie et des technologies de premier plan au service de la transition √©nerg√©tique, avec des positions de leader dans le Gaz Naturel Liqu√©fi√© (GNL), l'hydrog√®ne et l'√©thyl√®ne et avec une pr√©sence forte sur les march√©s en croissance de l'hydrog√®ne bleu et vert, la chimie durable et la gestion du CO2. L‚Äôentreprise b√©n√©ficie de son solide mod√®le de livraison de projet, soutenu par une offre √©tendue de technologies, de produits et de services.

Avec une pr√©sence dans 34 pays, nos 15 000 collaborateurs sont pleinement engag√©s √† donner vie aux projets innovants de nos clients, en repoussant les limites du possible pour acc√©l√©rer la transition √©nerg√©tique vers un avenir meilleur.

Nous vous offrons non seulement une opportunit√©, mais aussi une exp√©rience inspirante dans un environnement v√©ritablement international o√π vous faites √©quipe pour repousser les fronti√®res gr√¢ce √† l'innovation, la cr√©ativit√© et l'esprit d'√©quipe exprim√©s par nos collaborateurs.

¬†

Votre √©quipe :

Au sein de la Division Ing√©nierie du bureau parisien de Technip Energies, vous serez rattach√©.e au service Digitalisation & Information Management.

Forte de 60 ans d'exp√©rience dans le design de projet √©nerg√©tique, la division est compos√©e de 600 personnes repr√©sentant toutes les disciplines pr√©sentes sur nos installations (>20).

Anim√©e par les valeurs d'inclusion du groupe TEN, la division s'appuie sur la diversit√© de ses membres pour progresser. Cela signifie que ce poste est ouvert √† tous et que votre candidature sera sp√©cifiquement revue.

¬†

A propos du poste :¬†

En tant que Vendor Data Coordinator H/F, vous participerez √† l'ing√©nierie et au design des projets r√©alis√©s par TEN France pour les diff√©rentes Business Lines du groupe, solutions d√©carbon√©es (CO2 capture, H2, Eolien), LNG ou biofuels. Sur ces projets le plus souvent √† l‚Äôexport, vous serez en interface avec les √©quipes des autres disciplines au sein de TEN (Proc√©d√©s, Equipements, Instrumentation, Electricit√©‚Ä¶ mais aussi management de projet, Achats, Construction, Mise en route) ainsi que nos partenaires majoritairement internationaux (Client, fournisseurs et sous-traitants, Value engineering partner‚Ä¶).

¬†

Vos principales missions :

¬†Participer avec l'Information Manager √† la r√©daction des proc√©dures, sp√©cifications et instructions de travail, en lien avec les exigences contractuelles et les demandes du Projet li√©es au data management

  • S'assurer de la bonne compr√©hension et prise en compte de ces documents par les diff√©rents acteurs du projet
  • Participer √† la mise en place de l‚ÄôEngineering data warehouse, en collaboration avec les √©quipes techniques¬†(base de donn√©es centralisant l‚Äôensemble des tags et donn√©es collect√©s)
  • Participer aux meetings de clarification puis de lancement de commande avec les fournisseurs et les sous-traitants, pour expliquer¬†les exigences li√©es √† la gestion des donn√©es et aux diff√©rents d√©livrables √† fournir
  • G√©n√©rer pour chaque commande les templates des diff√©rents registres, pr√©remplis avec les donn√©es d√©j√† existantes
  • S‚Äôassurer de la livraison des d√©livrables dans les d√©lais demand√©s
  • Une fois re√ßus, v√©rifier les donn√©es des diff√©rents registres (conformit√© √† la proc√©dure de num√©rotation des composants, int√©gralit√©, coh√©rence avec les d√©livrables‚Ä¶)

Vous √™tes le profil id√©al si, dot√©.e d'un dipl√¥me d'ing√©nieur (id√©alement M√©canique ou Instrumentation), vous √™tes passionn√©.e par les donn√©es et justifiez d‚Äôune exp√©rience dans ce domaine (collecte et v√©rification de donn√©es, manipulation de gros volumes de donn√©es, exp√©rience des bases de donn√©es).¬† ¬†

Vous appr√©ciez travailler au sein d'√©quipes multiculturelles mettant en avant vos qualit√©s de souplesse et d'ouverture d'esprit. Vous √™tes int√©ress√©.e par mieux connaitre les processus de travail des disciplines, les sources et les flux de donn√©es.

¬†Votre esprit d‚Äôanalyse, votre compr√©hension technique des donn√©es et un bon niveau d'anglais seront des cl√©s pour vous int√©grer rapidement et performer dans nos √©quipes.¬†

Technip Energies favorise la mobilit√© interne, intragroupe (expatriation ou contrat local √† l‚Äôinternational) et une √©volution vers d‚Äôautres d√©partements transverses est envisageable.

Op√©rant dans 34 pays, nos 15 000 collaborateurs et collaboratrices sont pleinement engag√©s √† donner vie aux projets innovants de nos clients.

column13: Data Integration Analyst - Hybrid or Remote from Europe
column15:
Who are we?

Wakam is a B2B2C insurance company that creates white-label insurance solutions via its Play&Plug¬Æ technology platform for more than 150 distribution partners. We provide most of our insurance products through API, and hosts white label insurance solutions via our Play&Plug technology platform.

With a footprint spanning 32 countries and revenue of more than ‚Ç¨900 million in 2023, mostly generated outside France, Wakam is the European leader in digital and embedded insurance.

Strongly committed to social responsibility, Wakam is a mission-driven company dedicated to ‚Äúenabling transparent and impactful insurance".

About the Team

Come and join our Data Office, which is at the heart of our information ecosystem. We turn raw data into actionable insights for strategic decisions and operational efficiency. Through close collaboration and cutting-edge technologies, we unlock the full potential of data to drive growth and innovation, while ensuring the highest standards of security and compliance.

We're looking for a Data Integration Analyst to join the Partnership Data Experience team, who works closely with our Partners to ensure they‚Äôre sharing data with completeness, timeliness, and quality.

The Partner Data Experience team works closely with our Partners to ensure they‚Äôre sharing data with completeness, timeliness, and quality. Our main focus is on optimizing data exchange and collaboration with Wakam's partners, ensuring seamless integration and efficient data flow for mutual benefit.

The Mission

At Wakam we work with our partners across Europe and for each partner we require an automated data exchange so that Wakam can operate effectively as an insurer. Given the growth of Wakam, we are actively adding new partners and new deals with existing partners every week! This data powers our operations including Finance, Actuarial, Underwriting and Reinsurance.

Your mission will involve working with our Partners to onboard them and set-up the data flows and then manage the Partners to ensure we receive data in a timely manner, that's accurate and meets the needs of the Business. Specifically, the role will include:

  • Ensuring that new partners implement the data flows to reach Wakam's expectations in terms of technical format and business constraints. Provide data advice and requirements to the Partners based on the product specificities and Wakam's data needs
  • Being a key contact for your portfolio of Partners and having full responsibility to build a relationship with your Partners so as to achieve the best data outcomes. This includes being responsible for managing all data related topics to resolution (incidents/problems, evolution requests, assistance) and handle them to the agreed service levels, quality and timeliness
  • Designing, specifying, developing and documenting the data flows that you set-up for each Partner: we use SQL and Python with Snowflake, DBT and Prefect
  • Contributing to our Git repo and will develop tools or scripts to automate and improve our processes as well was contribute to global initiative like automated quality controls with Great Expectations
  • Contributing to the Data Office's transversal topics, helping to coordinate the project by engaging with Data and Business teams and following the implementation

On top of this, we have an ambitious transformation plan to migrate our existing Partners to our new technology stack, so you'll help to maintain the legacy platform and contribute to the migration effort to help us build an efficient, state-of-the-art data platform.

Profile requirements

  • Master's degree in Engineering with 3-5 year's experience in data management, data consulting, data analytics, analytics engineering
  • Ability to manage multiple projects at the same time
  • Mandatory that you are comfortable to speak both in English and French
  • You are an expert in SQL for analytics, Python/GIT to automate and code data contract and are comfortable to use Excel to solve quick typos
  • Our tech stack includes Azure, Snowflake, DBT, Databricks, PowerBI and you are familiar with strong experience in at least 2 of these technologies
  • Insurance knowledge is a plus

Recruitment process

  • Interview with a recruiter
  • Technical interview with team members of Data
  • Interview with the hiring manager and the VP Data
  • Culture fit interview with our Head of Talent

Positive energy, agility, and team spirit are essential to support Wakam in its hyper-growth!

You have the Wakam mindset? Join us!

More about us

Our culture? Free to impact. A culture where everything is possible, where all ideas are taken into consideration, where everyone has an impact on the transformation of insurance! Hungry for freedom? Thirsty for autonomy? If you are adventurous and like challenges, then the Wakam adventure might be made for you!

Discover on our website who we really are with the 11 cultural markers that so well describe us!

Mindset compatibility with our ‚ÄòFree to Impact‚Äô culture:

  1. Think big
  2. Biased for action
  3. Curious and eager to learn
  4. Can say no and find solutions
  5. Aims for the moon (but please don‚Äôt stick on the moon)
  6. And above all: have fun working together ü§úü§õ !

  • Wakam is not based on a hierarchy but on a methodology where everyone finds their role and knows their objectives.
  • With a flat hierarchical system and a highly collaborative operating model, Wakam is an extremely agile and transparent company.
  • Every last Friday of the month, it's Free.day @Wakam, a day without meetings to take a step aside and dedicate ourselves to skills sponsorship or other activities (because we are curious, I remind you).
  • Full-remote is a reality at Wakam (there is even one Wakamee who works from his sailing boat ‚õµ) with our Wakam From Anywhere (WFA) program.
  • Last but not least : we are nice and we have fun! (you'll find out by yourself üòâ)

At Wakam, we are committed to fostering an inclusive environment where diversity is celebrated. If you require any reasonable adjustments during the recruitment process, please feel free to reach out to your recruiter.
column38:
Wakam is a European B2B2C insurer that designs white-label insurance products for its partners (e-retailers, brokers and fintech/insurtech, etc.). Our insurance products have the particularity of being embedded in the products or services offered to the end customer (for example, if you take a self-service e-scooter, you are automatically insured).

Wakam operates in 32 European countries with the majority of its turnover generated outside France.
The company provides most of its products through API, and hosts white-label insurance solutions via its Play&Plug technology platform.

At Wakam we believe in the formula ‚Äúfor-profit & for good‚Äù. Since March 2021, we are a Mission-driven company, which means that our mission statement ‚ÄòEnabling transparent and impactful insurance‚Äô is written in our bylaws. And we go further: by defining concrete commitments to illustrate this mission, such as writing our insurance contracts in plain language (no more confusing terms and conditions). We also create insurance products at cost for associations.

Our culture? Free to impact. A culture where everything is possible, where all ideas are taken into consideration, where everyone has an impact on the transformation of insurance! Hungry for freedom? Thirsty for autonomy? If you are adventurous and like challenges, then the Wakam adventure might be made for you!

Le syst√®me d‚Äôinformation sur l‚Äôeau (SIE), et plus largement les autres syst√®mes d‚Äôinformation de l‚ÄôEtat dont le syst√®me d‚Äôinformation sur la biodiversit√© (SIB) et le syst√®me d‚Äôinformation sur les milieux marins (SIMM), ont pour objectifs d‚Äôassurer la qualit√©, la coh√©rence, le partage, l‚Äôanalyse, la valorisation, la mise √† disposition et la diffusion des donn√©es relatives √† l‚Äôeau, la biodiversit√© et le milieu marin d√©fini √† l‚Äôarticle L. 110-1 du code de l‚Äôenvironnement. Pour garantir l‚Äôinterop√©rabilit√© des donn√©es, ces 3 syst√®mes d‚Äôinformation doivent reposer sur des r√©f√©rentiels techniques communs en particulier compos√©s de donn√©es de r√©f√©rence, de sp√©cifications techniques et de services en r√©seau au sens de l‚Äôarticle L. 321-4 du code des relations entre le public et l‚Äôadministration.

Joining the Dailymotion Data Product Craft team means joining a diverse and dynamic team of more than 20 passionate data analysts and data scientists, to help us grow and build the evolution of Dailymotion‚Äôs products.¬†

As a data analyst, you will be at the core of Dailymotion‚Äôs data-driven strategy. You will be part of a cross-verticals team of other analysts responsible to support the product, business, and engineering teams with insights. You will collaborate closely with Product Managers, Monetization, Machine Learning, and Engineering teams.¬†

Your main goal will be to provide insights, based on which product decisions will be made. You will leverage complex and rich datasets to help decision makers better understand users experience on our platforms, player performances, monetization, ...¬†

Key responsibilities¬†¬†

  • Explore: Conduct exploratory analyses and leverage data to identify opportunities to improve business and optimize our products. Develop a deep understanding of our product and ecosystem for that purpose.¬†¬†
  • Experiment: Advise on the experimentation strategy adapted to the need and context. Define, conduct, and analyze AB tests.¬†¬†
  • Empower: Evangelize on the use of data in the company, train colleagues on analytics tools, build automated dashboards and assets to enable stakeholders to be as autonomous as possible with data.¬†¬†¬†
  • Measure: Analyze the impact of product releases on business metrics, as well as their impacts on products performances. Monitor the evolutions in our audience and supply explain them.¬†¬†
  • Collaborate: Contribute to an iterative process of product improvement, collaborating with product managers, designers, developers, machine learning engineers and data engineers.¬†¬†
  • Communicate: Share findings through clear visualizations, engaging presentations and straight to the point recommendations.¬†¬†

Examples of analyses use cases: video recommendation models, search algorithms, supply optimization, player performances optimization, ...¬†

Our stack¬†¬†

  • Data Lake in Google Big Query: writing complex SQL queries is a daily practice (+ using R and Python for specific needs)¬†¬†
  • Tableau and Google Data Studio for data visualizations and dashboards¬†¬†
  • Internal A/B testing tool (Python based)¬†¬†

VOTRE FUTUR ENVIRONNEMENT :

AXA France accompagne ses clients, particuliers et entreprises, √† toutes les √©tapes de leur vie. Cette couverture dans les missions r√©alis√©es par la Direction de la s√ªret√© permet d‚Äôavoir une vision large des activit√©s et des processus m√©tiers d‚ÄôAXA France.

VOS MISSIONS PRINCIPALES :

Hager Group est l‚Äôun des principaux fournisseurs leaders en mati√®re de solutions et de services pour les installations √©lectriques dans les b√¢timents r√©sidentiels, tertiaires et industriels. column15:
We are currently looking for a¬†Business & Data analyst (m/f/d)¬†for our site in¬†Obernai or Blieskastel.The position is open with immediate effect and on a 18 month fixed-term contract.

Your mission

  • You conduct ad-hoc analyses to answer key business questions,
  • You analyze large, complex datasets related to HR, such as employee demographics, performance, attrition, diversity and engagement data to derive insights,
  • You create data visualizations to communicate findings and recommendations to business leaders in a clear and concise manner in order to inform strategic HR decisions,
  • You stay up-to-date on the latest developments in data science, HR analytics, workforce planning, and technology, and leverage this knowledge to drive innovation and continuous improvement,
  • You play an integral role in standing up a new global tool and process for Strategic Workforce Planning by supporting specifications definition, market solutions assessment towards the company‚Äôs requirements and solution implementation

column15:
WANT TO KNOW MORE ABOUT OUR BIG TECH TRANSFORMATION?

L‚ÄôOr√©al is present in 130 countries on five continents. For more than a century, L‚ÄôOr√©al has devoted itself solely to one business: beauty; it is now the industry world leader with ‚Ç¨42 billion consolidated sales.

Today, L‚ÄôOr√©al includes more than 2000 tech positions and it‚Äôs constantly growing. Especially with our ambition to become the #1 BeautyTech company, meaning inventing the beauty of the future while becoming the company of the future.

BeautyTech will equip the Group with the key assets it needs to conquer this new world, where Tech has become strategic.

To achieve this ambition, L‚ÄôOr√©al needs to continue recruiting diverse, innovative, skilled and passionate minds in different tech domains such as Data, Digital, Cloud, Cyber Security, IT Architecture, DevOps, Applications and Infrastructure.

LET US INTRODUCE YOU THE TEAM!

The candidate will join the Team in charge of the Responsiveness for Growth (R4G) program, one of the 3 top priorities at the Operations this year. The R4G aims at delivering sustainable growth while embracing volatility and improving the responsiveness and resilience of the value chain by developing new capabilities.

Collaboration, empathy, smart, influencer describe quite well our team (5 people).

Being part of the journey that improve the responsiveness and resilience of the whole end to end value chain is an outstanding opportunity as it covers many metiers as sourcing, manufacturing and supply chain.

INTERESTED?

THIS IS WHAT YOU WILL DO IN NUTSHELL!

We can summarize your missions in several missions:

  • Ensure the transition between the beta version of use case ‚ÄúX Ray tool‚Äù she/he will be in charge and the final version. Integrate the specificities into the tool met all along the roll out phase.
  • Leverage the experts (m√©tiers, data, system, ‚Ä¶) internal and external to define the best architecture for the R4G Cockpit
  • Make and upgrade of an home made tool by integrating additional needs of users quickly and efficiently


IF YOU WANT TO GO FURTHER IN DETAILS, THIS IS WHAT YOU COULD EXPECT TO DO

Be in charge of 2 key use cases of R4G program. The X Ray tool that aims at making a diagnostic of an end-to-end value chain, the other one is the R4G Cockpit that aims at measuring the impact of the program.

Specifically :
  • Analytics specifications with the ‚Äú m√©tiers ‚Äú.
  • Assessment and needs on data coordination between all the domains data domains
  • Connection with the Beauty Tech Data Platform to build the Consumer Data Set.
  • Dashboard building through Power BI.


Be in charge of the upgrade of an home-made tool used to simulate the responsiveness on production and size the production equipment needed.

Specifically :
  • Tool utilization diagnostic
  • Gather the additionnal needs
  • Tool upgrade
  • Quality data coordination
  • Coordination to enhance the data quality


STILL INTERESTED?

THIS IS WHAT YOU WILL NEED TO SUCCEED!

First and foremost, we love people that are curious, collaborative, eager to have an impact, proactive and who value innovation, autonomy, and team spirit.

Secondly, in this specific position, it will be important for you to have:
  • Ideally an engineering background but not compulsory
  • 3-5 years experience
  • 2-3 years experience at LOREAL would be a plus
  • Fluent in English


Mandatory skills:
  • Mastering perfectly Power BI (all dashboard to be built on Power BI)
  • Soft skills (being able to connect efficiently with the data community).


Nice to have skills:
  • Knowledge of the data ecosystem would be a plus


WAIT, THERE IS MORE! LET US GIVE YOU 4 OTHER REASONS TO JOIN US!

Joining L‚ÄôOr√©al means joining a company that:
  1. Invests in Tech and positions its Tech teams at the heart of its digital transformation strategy.
  2. Allows its employees to have a real impact, to test their ideas, to innovate and to build our future.
  3. Has a powerful and innovative HR policy: a very dynamic mobility policy, significant investment in employee training, regular re-evaluation of remuneration, numerous innovative HR measures: Time Savings Account, paternity leave, Citizen Day, etc.
  4. Has chosen to uphold strong values and to be particularly advanced from a social and environmental point of view (strong diversity and inclusion policy, L‚ÄôOr√©al for the Future program, commitment to numerous communities, etc.).

The L‚ÄôOr√©al Group is convinced that difference is a deep source of wealth, that allows everyone to grow, to challenge themselves and to go further.

We strongly encourage everyone to always dare and never censor themselves. Skills can always be learnt.

We will be delighted to exchange with you!

Ready to build the future of L‚ÄôOr√©al together? Apply now!
column38:
The desire for beauty has existed since the beginning of humanity. It‚Äôs a universal aspiration which crosses time, countries, and cultures.

Beauty is a powerful force that moves us.

We know that beauty is more than just looking good.
Beauty gives us confidence in who we are, in who we want to be, and in our relationships with others.

For over a century we have been dedicated to one sole vocation: creating beauty.
We remain true to the pioneering spirit of our founder and enjoy the unwavering support of his family, who have always accompanied our development.

Our goal is to offer each and every person around the world the best of beauty‚ÄØin terms of quality, efficacy, safety, sincerity and responsibility to satisfy all beauty needs and desires in their infinite diversity.

Because beauty is a permanent quest, we harness the power of our innovation to continually enhance the performance of our products and services.
Because we value diversity,‚ÄØwe leverage each of our brands to celebrate all expressions of beauty.

Because we strive to be exemplary with a long-term vision, we anchor our actions in our strong values and demanding ethical principles.

And because we are the global leader in beauty, we are aware that‚ÄØeverything we do can have a meaningful impact.
Therefore:

We act to shape the future of beauty‚ÄØby leveraging the best of science and technology, increasingly inspired by nature.

We act to drive social innovation‚ÄØby offering the best working conditions, training, and social protection for our employees.

We act to build a business with inclusivity at its heart‚ÄØby ensuring we are as diverse as the people we serve.

We act to nurture‚ÄØlasting partnerships‚ÄØwith our clients and suppliers‚ÄØbased on mutual trust and collaboration.

We act to create value for all our shareholders, by sustaining a robust business model.

We act to champion the cause of women‚ÄØand to strengthen the communities with which we engage.

We act to protect the beauty of the planet‚ÄØby fighting climate change, respecting biodiversity and preserving natural resources.

column13: Data Quality Lead - Professional Product Division
column15:
Unleash Your Potential at L‚ÄôOr√©al‚Äôs Beauty Tech!

For more than a century, L‚ÄôOr√©al has devoted itself solely to one business: Beauty. Present in 150 countries across five continents and with ‚Ç¨42 billion consolidated sales, L‚ÄôOr√©al is the global industry leader. With 37 global beauty brands across four divisions, L‚ÄôOr√©al offers beauty for each covering all beauty categories and catering to all beauty desires. With the acquisition of the Australian brand Aƒìsop in 2023, the Group continues to expand its portfolio through targeted acquisitions as part of its drive to create the future of beauty.

Today, L‚ÄôOr√©al includes more than 2,000 tech positions and is constantly growing. Beauty Tech is changing the game and leading the shift towards new consumer realities and a digital disruption. Championing Beauty Tech, we invent the beauty of the future while becoming the company of the future.

Beauty Tech is how we know our consumers intimately, augmenting their beauty journeys with unparalleled diverse and sustainable experiences. Beauty Tech equips the Group with the key assets it needs to conquer this new world, where Tech has become strategic. With this ambition, L‚ÄôOr√©al continues to recruit diverse, innovative, skilled and passionate minds in different tech domains such as Data, Digital, Cloud, Cyber Security, IT Architecture, DevOps, Applications and Infrastructure.

YOUR FUTURE TEAM

The Data, CRM and Analytics team is dedicated to support business transformation and growth for the Professional Product Division (PPD).

PPD has become a true digital division keeping our mission to bring professional beauty for each, with hairstylist at heart and data as our accelerator.

Through our digital transformation journey, we are building a powerful B2B and B2B2C eco-system leveraging e-commerce, Online Education, CRM, Business Reps, Customer Care apps to serve customer and consumer needs.

These data acquisition touchpoints allowed us to create a unique O+O stylists knowledge (data asset) to boost business growth through segmentation, marketing activation, personalization and call to action.

As we look to leverage these opportunities and AI in our go-to-market, it‚Äôs important that we continue to build upon our Data initiatives and strengthen our data quality.

What a day in the life of PPD Data Team looks like:

We have started our global PPD data journey, yet we need to continue make data ready for our business. To make it happen, we need a strong focus on data quality.

In this perspective, the candidate will need to:

  • Create awareness with pedagogy and proximity with all stakeholders on data quality.
  • Assess our current situation and provide clear guidelines and policies.
  • Monitor and lead remediation actions plan


Details of the mission:

Data management

  • Create proximity with stakeholders to understand, translate & qualify the data business requirement: scope, issues, objectives
  • Define critical objects & attributes
  • Audit the current situation and root cause main gaps
  • Define strategy to remediate existing issues and anticipate data quality standards for new sources
  • Lead, animate and orchestrate the implementation of remediation actions with support from the source app and data teams on the main gaps, from Division, Zones or Country entities
  • Animate PPD data teams and consult CDAO on quality best practices


Data-related policies

  • Ensure the respect of the product data group standards/policies
  • Document & communicate the new best practices/standards
  • Write new, policy-compliant processes where required


Quality monitoring and improvement

  • Implement KPIs to measure data quality and monitor deviation from acceptable quality levels
  • Define, communicate and follow-up remediation plans to increase data quality


THIS IS WHAT YOU WILL NEED TO SUCCEED!

First and foremost, we love people that are curious, collaborative, eager to have an impact, proactive and who value innovation, autonomy, and team spirit.

Secondly, in this specific position, it will be important for you to have:
  • Between 3 and 5 years of professional experience
  • At least 3 years in data field
  • Data management, modeling, quality
  • Project management
  • Business oriented
  • Problem solving
  • Communication (oral and written)
  • Leadership


LET US GIVE YOU 6 OTHER REASONS TO JOIN US!

Joining L‚ÄôOr√©al means joining a company that:
  1. Invests in Tech and positions its Tech teams at the heart of its digital transformation strategy.
  2. Allows its employees to have a real impact, to test their ideas, to innovate and to build our future.
  3. Offers a Hybrid Work Policy: 3 Days in Office, 2 Days Work from Home
  4. Provides many benefits: VIP staff shop offering our products at a preferential rate, a company restaurant & gym, 60% reimbursement of transportation subscription, a work council offering lots of employee discounts (social & cultural activities, holiday vouchers etc.) and much more!
  5. Provides a powerful and innovative HR policy : dynamic mobility policy, significant investment in employee training, regular re-evaluation of remuneration, numerous innovative HR measures: Time Savings Account, paternity leave, Citizen Day, etc.
  6. Delivers a n Equal Opportunity Employer and take pride in a diverse environment. We would love to find out more about you as a candidate and we do not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion, or other employment practices. The beauty we find in our differences gives us the freedom to go beyond. That‚Äôs the beauty of L‚ÄôOr√©al.


GOOD TO KNOW: THE RECRUITMENT PROCESS
  1. Interview with HR
  2. Interview with the hiring manager
  3. Interview with the business leader


We will be delighted to exchange with you!

Want to learn more about L‚ÄôOr√©al Beauty Tech? C lick here.

We act to shape the future of beauty‚ÄØby leveraging the best of science and technology, increasingly inspired by nature.

We act to drive social innovation‚ÄØby offering the best working conditions, training, and social protection for our employees.

We act to build a business with inclusivity at its heart‚ÄØby ensuring we are as diverse as the people we serve.

We act to nurture‚ÄØlasting partnerships‚ÄØwith our clients and suppliers‚ÄØbased on mutual trust and collaboration.

We act to create value for all our shareholders, by sustaining a robust business model.

We act to champion the cause of women‚ÄØand to strengthen the communities with which we engage.

We act to protect the beauty of the planet‚ÄØby fighting climate change, respecting biodiversity and preserving natural resources.
column54:
The desire for beauty has existed since the beginning of humanity. It‚Äôs a universal aspiration which crosses time, countries, and cultures.

Beauty is a powerful force that moves us.

We know that beauty is more than just looking good.
Beauty gives us confidence in who we are, in who we want to be, and in our relationships with others.

For over a century we have been dedicated to one sole vocation: creating beauty.
We remain true to the pioneering spirit of our founder and enjoy the unwavering support of his family, who have always accompanied our development.

Our goal is to offer each and every person around the world the best of beauty‚ÄØin terms of quality, efficacy, safety, sincerity and responsibility to satisfy all beauty needs and desires in their infinite diversity.

Because beauty is a permanent quest, we harness the power of our innovation to continually enhance the performance of our products and services.
Because we value diversity,‚ÄØwe leverage each of our brands to celebrate all expressions of beauty.

Because we strive to be exemplary with a long-term vision, we anchor our actions in our strong values and demanding ethical principles.

And because we are the global leader in beauty, we are aware that‚ÄØeverything we do can have a meaningful impact.
Therefore:

We act to shape the future of beauty‚ÄØby leveraging the best of science and technology, increasingly inspired by nature.

We act to drive social innovation‚ÄØby offering the best working conditions, training, and social protection for our employees.

We act to build a business with inclusivity at its heart‚ÄØby ensuring we are as diverse as the people we serve.

We act to nurture‚ÄØlasting partnerships‚ÄØwith our clients and suppliers‚ÄØbased on mutual trust and collaboration.

We act to create value for all our shareholders, by sustaining a robust business model.

We act to champion the cause of women‚ÄØand to strengthen the communities with which we engage.

We act to protect the beauty of the planet‚ÄØby fighting climate change, respecting biodiversity and preserving natural resources.

column4:
Our job everyday is to protect the data and critical assets of businesses world-wide by discovering hidden vulnerabilities‚Ä¶ before the bad guys do!

At CybelAngel, we see beyond perimeters to protect businesses from the most critical cybersecurity threats. Fortune 500 Global to mid-size companies world-wide, trust CybelAngel‚Äôs global team of approximately 140 team members to protect their businesses from digital threats. With a combination of advanced machine learning, cyber analysis expertise, and a powerful suite of software solutions, CybelAngel detects and resolves our clients potential threats, long before they can fall into the hands of cyber criminals.

Our capabilities expand every day to uncover new risks, detect more threats, protect more clients, and create new possibilities for our employees.

With offices in Boston, Paris, and London, CybelAngel‚Äôs global footprint allows for a thriving hybrid, office and remote-work environment. We are looking for exceptional ‚Äògo-getters‚Äô who share our ambitious vision, innovative culture, high commitment to ethics, and enthusiasm for being the best possible place to work!

Our values:

  • Be Bold

  • Be Curious

  • Stronger Together
column15:
This is a new opening within the Engineering department, based in Paris 9 and offering a flexible remote work policy.

Your main mission will be to detect and explain potential anomalies in the operation of our advanced cybersecurity threat detection engine. Your results will be communicated to¬† top management and influence the Product & Engineering roadmap.

You will explore gigantic amounts of data, including real-time data from the inner of our engine, historical and statistical data from our data warehouse, as well as detailed technical metrics and timelines of various events. Amongst this data, you will identify the main key metrics that are important to follow and set up adequate dashboarding and monitoring to detect potential anomalies. In the event of an anomaly, you will look for correlations with other events such as code and infrastructure changes, client-specific configuration updates, human interventions, external events, etc. and unravel the chain of causality. Your discoveries will be shared with top management and the Product & Engineering department.

To succeed in your mission, you will need to grow an in-depth understanding of our business, how our company operates, what our product does, how our technology works, etc. Your teammates will assist you in this learning process. Additionally, you will have access to senior engineers, product managers and cybersecurity analysts, who will share their expertise with you. This role will position you at a central position in the company.

For this position, we seek a senior data analyst, not only with strong analytical skills, but also an endless curiosity for topics ranging from technology to business and everything in between, as well as ability to bridge the gap between these areas and connect seemingly unrelated ideas.

Our stack

  • Google Looker Studio Pro (dashboard)

  • Google BigQuery (data warehouse)

  • Kibana / ElasticSearch (real-time data)

  • Datadog (technical metrics)

  • Python
column36: SaaS / Cloud Services, Big Data, Cyber Security
column38:
CybelAngel was founded in 2013 in Paris and we count more than 150 employees worldwide (in the US, France, and Europe). We have a culture of team spirit, ambition and a high commitment to ethics.
We are constantly looking to add new talents and expertise in order to help us solve the growing security threats over the Web.

Our values: Be Curious; Be Bold and Be Stronger Together!

CybelAngel‚Äôs mission is to create cutting-edge technologies to make the Internet a safer place. Thanks to our in-house developed solution we are able to detect data leaks over the Internet (e.g. Dark Web, Deep Web) as well as connected devices.

Using artificial intelligence, we identify sensitive data and provide a real-time alert service to our clients. We are therefore able to help major companies in securing and protecting their sensitive and confidential information and anticipating high risk security threats.

Do you know how many kilometers an order picker walks in a day? 15 kilometers. That‚Äôs 15 kilometers in a gigantic warehouse just to find the 2 items you ordered on the internet during your lunch break.

By applying the most advanced robotic technologies to logistics, Exotec has designed an ultra-innovative system to optimize order preparation.
With already several hundred 3D moving robots in operations, Exotec has revolutionized the way companies organize their warehouses and logistics flows.

Exotec‚Äôs agile solution allows them to keep up with business growth by simply adding robots. No more 20-year investments in heavy systems that are obsolete after 5 years.

Do you know how many kilometers an order picker walks in a day? 15 kilometers. That‚Äôs 15 kilometers in a gigantic warehouse just to find the 2 items you ordered on the internet during your lunch break.

Senior Claims Data Analyst (H/F)¬†

D√âCOUVREZ votre opportunit√©¬†L'√©quipe que vous rejoindrezVous rejoindrez notre √©quipe Sinistres au sein de la Business Unit APAC Europe chez AXA XL.¬†Le service au client est au c≈ìur de nos activit√©s. Le r√¥le des √©quipes Sinistres est de g√©rer les sinistres importants et complexes de nos entreprises clientes lorsqu'un sinistre survient, et nous conduisons le " moment de v√©rit√© " de l'assurance en tenant la promesse que nous avons faite lorsque nos clients ont sign√© leur contrat avec AXA XL. Ceci est reconnu par nos courtiers qui font r√©guli√®rement l'√©loge de la qualit√© de notre service sinistres, leader sur le march√© (par exemple, n¬∞2 en Europe dans l'enqu√™te Aon Voice for the Client H1 2022). Nous g√©rons un portefeuille d'environ 200 000 sinistres par le biais d'√©quipes locales, de deux centres de programmes mondiaux (Autriche et Hong Kong) et de deux centres de services partag√©s (Inde et Pologne). Nos polices couvrent plus de 30 branches d'activit√© et 14 pays, et elles sont souvent incluses dans des programmes couvrant plus de 200 pays.¬†Au sein de l'√©quipe Sinistres APAC Europe, notre objectif est de (i) piloter la strat√©gie et la transformation de nos activit√©s en mati√®re de sinistres dans l'ensemble de nos zones g√©ographiques, (ii) soutenir les responsables des sinistres et leurs ~500 sp√©cialistes des sinistres pour g√©rer les sinistres de nos entreprises clientes (en particulier sur les op√©rations, les donn√©es et les analyses et le service √† la client√®le), et (iii) surveiller les sinistres et les activit√©s de traitement des sinistres, ainsi que les risques et les contr√¥les qui y sont li√©s. Pour ce faire, nous travaillons en √©troite collaboration sur les projets avec les responsables locaux des sinistres et leurs talents, ainsi qu'avec les centres d'excellence mondiaux des sinistres et les autres d√©partements de la Business Unit APAC Europe (souscription, conseil en risques, op√©rations et technologie, finances, gestion des clients et des courtiers, strat√©gie, gestion des risques, RH...). Notre √©quipe internationale cr√©√©e il y a 2 ans fonctionne avec des membres bas√©s √† Paris, Dublin, Madrid et Londres, et interagit avec des √©quipes √† travers le monde notamment aux Etats-Unis (si√®ge d'AXA XL).

Ce que vous ferez

Nous renfor√ßons notre √©quipe avec un(e) Senior Claims Data Analysts exceptionnel(le). Vous serez rattach√©(e) au responsable du service et de la transformation des sinistres, et vous aurez deux responsabilit√©s principales :- S√©curiser l'analyse de nos donn√©es sur une base mensuelle, trimestrielle et annuelle (au niveau APAC Europe et au niveau pays).Nous pensons que nous devons am√©liorer de mani√®re significative la fa√ßon dont nous mesurons et analysons nos sinistres (pertes) et nos activit√©s de sinistres, notamment parce que la compr√©hension de notre portefeuille de sinistres et l'am√©lioration de nos op√©rations sont cruciales pour la rentabilit√© d'AXA XL.¬†Pour y parvenir, votre r√¥le sera crucial :¬†- vous devrez remettre en question et analyser un ensemble de donn√©es, comprendre les moteurs de changement et traduire votre analyse en commentaires pertinents pour nos parties prenantes senior.¬†- Vous devrez comprendre en profondeur les sp√©cificit√©s et les r√©serves des indicateurs (d√©finitions, port√©e, calcul, y compris les objectifs), des syst√®mes de gestion des sinistres et des outils d'information g√©ographique. Pour √™tre pertinente, votre analyse reposera sur des interactions structur√©es et fr√©quentes avec des experts de notre organisation, et vous serez responsable de la fiabilit√© des donn√©es.¬†Les m√©triques comprendront des indicateurs de performance cl√©s li√©s √† : (i) les activit√©s li√©es aux sinistres et les initiatives du plan d'action (productivit√©, d√©penses, √©conomies, personnel, recouvrement, fraude, service des sinistres, conformit√©...), (ii) les donn√©es sur les sinistres (grands sinistres (caus√©s par l'homme et Nat Cats) et sinistres attritionnels ; sinistres sensibles ; litiges ; crises (par ex. Covid19, conflit en Ukraine) et tendances (par ex. inflation)) et (iii) les op√©rations de sinistres (mesures li√©es aux processus de traitement des sinistres (par ex. d√©lai moyen de la premi√®re r√©serve) et aux flux de donn√©es sur les sinistres).¬†- Contribuer √† la conduite du changement et √† l'am√©lioration continue en mati√®re d'analyse des donn√©es.¬†Nous pensons que notre organisation des sinistres doit √©voluer pour mieux saisir et analyser les donn√©es, √©tant donn√© que dans le cadre de notre feuille de route de transformation, nous allons (devoir) avoir acc√®s √† de plus en plus de points de donn√©es. Par cons√©quent¬†- vous devrez √™tre un agent de changement au quotidien avec nos √©quipes Sinistres tout au long de leur parcours d'analyse des donn√©es : vous serez leur " source unique de v√©rit√© " pour les donn√©es dans le secteur Sinistres APAC Europe,¬†- vous les aiderez √† garantir la robustesse des donn√©es sur leur p√©rim√®tre et √† comprendre les moteurs d'analyse. En parall√®le, vous contribuerez activement √† notre parcours de donn√©es en travaillant en √©troite collaboration avec nos parties prenantes mondiales en mati√®re de sinistres et de donn√©es, par exemple en sugg√©rant comment am√©liorer l'efficacit√© de nos processus de reporting (par exemple en limitant les entr√©es manuelles, en optimisant les flux de donn√©es) et comment donner la priorit√© aux d√©veloppements informatiques et de donn√©es.¬†

Pour ces responsabilit√©s, vous vous engagerez avec les parties prenantes au sein de Claims (y compris le Head of Claims Finance, les Country Heads of Claims et leurs √©quipes) et au-del√† de Claims (par exemple, Finance, Underwriting, Risk management, si n√©cessaire).¬†

Pour les entreprises de taille interm√©diaire et les multinationales, AXA XL¬†propose plus de 30 familles d‚Äôassurance : dommages aux biens, responsabilit√© civile, cyber, construction, lignes financi√®res et risques professionnels, environnement et individuelle accident.

¬†

Nous sommes √©galement un acteur majeur de l‚Äôassurance de sp√©cialit√©s, notamment l‚Äôa√©ronautique, , l‚Äôassurance transport, l‚Äôassurance auto, le risque politique et de cr√©dit et la gestion de crise.

¬†

Chaque jour, ils agissent ensemble pour vous prot√©ger en donnant √† chacun les moyens de vivre une vie meilleure.
