column15:
Rejoignez les √©quipes de la Data Value Chain !

La Data Value Chain est compos√©e de 5 fili√®res qui g√®rent tous les aspects op√©rationnels de Decathlon :

  • Industry & Production
  • Supply Chain (Supply & Material Planning, Demand & Assortment Planning and Dispatch & Fulfillment)
  • Logistics & Transport

Cette √©quipe est le centre d'expertise qui couvre tous les d√©fis de transformation des op√©rations en utilisant une approche ax√©e sur les donn√©es.R√©parties en cinq domaines, les √©quipes pluridisciplinaires d√©veloppent et industrialisent des solutions analytiques et de machine learning pour l'ensemble des op√©rations de Decathlon. Les √©quipes data travaillent en √©troite collaboration avec les √©quipes business, product et engineering.

Dans le cadre d'une ouverture de poste en CDI, nous recrutons un-e Senior Data Analyst, bas√©-e, √† Lille ou Paris.

Vos responsabilit√©s

En tant que Data Analyst, vous aurez l‚Äôoccasion de :

  • Collaborer √©troitement avec les Product Managers, Data Scientists et Data Analysts afin d‚Äôidentifier les opportunit√©s d'am√©liorations des produits de visualisation
  • Concevoir des frameworks d‚Äôanalyse scalable pour extraire du sens des insights de l'√©cosyst√®me du pricing de Decathlon
  • Conduire des analyses pour am√©liorer notre compr√©hension et efficience des processus de changement de prix
  • Identifier et quantifier des opportunit√©s pour d√©velopper de nouveaux business ou produits
  • Transformer des probl√®mes business et produits en insights actionnables
  • Mentoring des analystes juniors et contribution √† l‚Äôam√©lioration continue de l‚Äô√©quipe
  • Coacher, mentorer et participer aux recrutements

Comp√©tences

  • La ma√Ætrise de Python et SQL comme langage de programmation est indispensable
  • Ma√Ætrise des librairies Python (numpy, pandas, scikit-learn)
  • Ma√Ætriser les m√©thodes statistiques de bases (analyses descriptives, ACP, classifications, √©chantillonnage, tests statistiques)
  • Exp√©rience avec les mod√®les pr√©dictifs et comment √©valuer leur efficacit√©
  • Ma√Ætrise des outils de d√©veloppement : Git, Github, CI/CD, VSCode/Pycharm, Terminal
  • Des fortes comp√©tences en visualisation de donn√©es (Tableau ou similaire)
  • Exp√©rience avec Databricks
  • Ma√Ætrise de l‚ÄôAnglais oral et √©crit indispensable

Ce dont vous aurez besoin pour r√©ussir

  • 2 ans d‚Äôexp√©rience comme Data Analyst ou similaire
  • Excellente capacit√© √† utiliser des donn√©es et visuels pour communiquer des informations bas√©es sur des donn√©es
  • Communication sur les r√©alisations
  • Curiosit√© et proactivit√© pour comprendre le besoin m√©tier
  • Rigueur, autonomie, sens de service et √©tat d‚Äôesprit positif
  • Une forte app√©tence pour la d√©couverte et la r√©solution de probl√®mes
  • Une volont√© d‚Äôapprendre et d‚Äôapporter de la valeur
  • Veille technologique constante du march√© du Data et des progr√®s de l'industrie

Environnement Technique

  • Execution Engine: Databricks, AWS EKS, Sagemaker
  • Payload: Python, Spark, Scikit-Learn, Tensorflow / Pytorch, Pyspark
  • CICD: Github Actions
  • Serving: Docker, Protobuf, gRPC
  • Model registry, Model Tracking: MLFlow
  • Orchestration: Airflow
  • Documentation / code: Git, Confluence
  • Data Visualisation: Tableau
  • Monitoring: Datadog, Giskard

Ce que nous offrons

  • Flexibilit√© dans l'organisation du travail (lieu, rythme)
  • Libert√© de choix de l'outil de travail (Mac, Windows)
  • √âquipe de projet locale et partage avec le r√©seau mondial (parcours international)
  • Mont√©e en comp√©tences (diversit√© des projets, des langues et des technologies)
  • Formations internes et externes
  • Actionnariat salari√©s
  • Primes mensuelles et trimestrielles

DECATHLON DIGITAL

Imaginez si la technologie nous permettait de repousser les fronti√®res et d'offrir des exp√©riences sportives in√©dites. C'est pr√©cis√©ment notre ambition chez Decathlon Digital ! Nous sommes une √©quipe de plus de 5 000 experts en ing√©nierie logicielle, gestion de produits, donn√©es, cloud et cybers√©curit√©, r√©partis √† Paris, Lille et Amsterdam. Ensemble, nous cr√©ons la plus vaste plateforme sportive num√©rique, en exploitant les innovations technologiques pour optimiser la cha√Æne de valeur, concevoir des exp√©riences connect√©es et donner une seconde vie √† nos produits.

Changeons la donne pour de bon. Notre passion du sport nous guide et nous voulons qu‚Äôelle perdure. C‚Äôest pourquoi nous nous engageons √† b√¢tir un mod√®le technologique plus durable, en r√©duisant notre impact direct sur l'environnement, et en cr√©ant un espace s√ªr et inclusif pour apprendre et nous √©panouir ensemble. Rejoins l‚Äô√©quipe et fa√ßonnons le futur du sport.

column15:
Rejoignez les √©quipes de la Data Value Chain !

La Data Value Chain est compos√©e de 5 fili√®res qui g√®rent tous les aspects op√©rationnels de Decathlon :

  • Industry & Production
  • Supply Chain (Supply & Material Planning, Demand & Assortment Planning and Dispatch & Fulfillment)
  • Logistics & Transport

Cette √©quipe est le centre d'expertise qui couvre tous les d√©fis de transformation des op√©rations en utilisant une approche ax√©e sur les donn√©es.R√©parties en cinq domaines, les √©quipes pluridisciplinaires d√©veloppent et industrialisent des solutions analytiques et de machine learning pour l'ensemble des op√©rations de Decathlon. Les √©quipes data travaillent en √©troite collaboration avec les √©quipes business, product et engineering.

Dans le cadre d'une ouverture de poste en CDI, nous recrutons un-e Senior Data Analyst, bas√©-e, √† Lille ou Paris.

Vos responsabilit√©s

En tant que Data Analyst, vous aurez l‚Äôoccasion de :

  • Collaborer √©troitement avec les Product Managers, Data Scientists et Data Analysts afin d‚Äôidentifier les opportunit√©s d'am√©liorations des produits de visualisation
  • Concevoir des frameworks d‚Äôanalyse scalable pour extraire du sens des insights de l'√©cosyst√®me du pricing de Decathlon
  • Conduire des analyses pour am√©liorer notre compr√©hension et efficience des processus de changement de prix
  • Identifier et quantifier des opportunit√©s pour d√©velopper de nouveaux business ou produits
  • Transformer des probl√®mes business et produits en insights actionnables
  • Mentoring des analystes juniors et contribution √† l‚Äôam√©lioration continue de l‚Äô√©quipe
  • Coacher, mentorer et participer aux recrutements

Comp√©tences

  • La ma√Ætrise de Python et SQL comme langage de programmation est indispensable
  • Ma√Ætrise des librairies Python (numpy, pandas, scikit-learn)
  • Ma√Ætriser les m√©thodes statistiques de bases (analyses descriptives, ACP, classifications, √©chantillonnage, tests statistiques)
  • Exp√©rience avec les mod√®les pr√©dictifs et comment √©valuer leur efficacit√©
  • Ma√Ætrise des outils de d√©veloppement : Git, Github, CI/CD, VSCode/Pycharm, Terminal
  • Des fortes comp√©tences en visualisation de donn√©es (Tableau ou similaire)
  • Exp√©rience avec Databricks
  • Ma√Ætrise de l‚ÄôAnglais oral et √©crit indispensable

Ce dont vous aurez besoin pour r√©ussir

  • 2 ans d‚Äôexp√©rience comme Data Analyst ou similaire
  • Excellente capacit√© √† utiliser des donn√©es et visuels pour communiquer des informations bas√©es sur des donn√©es
  • Communication sur les r√©alisations
  • Curiosit√© et proactivit√© pour comprendre le besoin m√©tier
  • Rigueur, autonomie, sens de service et √©tat d‚Äôesprit positif
  • Une forte app√©tence pour la d√©couverte et la r√©solution de probl√®mes
  • Une volont√© d‚Äôapprendre et d‚Äôapporter de la valeur
  • Veille technologique constante du march√© du Data et des progr√®s de l'industrie

Environnement Technique

  • Execution Engine: Databricks, AWS EKS, Sagemaker
  • Payload: Python, Spark, Scikit-Learn, Tensorflow / Pytorch, Pyspark
  • CICD: Github Actions
  • Serving: Docker, Protobuf, gRPC
  • Model registry, Model Tracking: MLFlow
  • Orchestration: Airflow
  • Documentation / code: Git, Confluence
  • Data Visualisation: Tableau
  • Monitoring: Datadog, Giskard

Ce que nous offrons

  • Flexibilit√© dans l'organisation du travail (lieu, rythme)
  • Libert√© de choix de l'outil de travail (Mac, Windows)
  • √âquipe de projet locale et partage avec le r√©seau mondial (parcours international)
  • Mont√©e en comp√©tences (diversit√© des projets, des langues et des technologies)
  • Formations internes et externes
  • Actionnariat salari√©s
  • Primes mensuelles et trimestrielles

DECATHLON DIGITAL

Imaginez si la technologie nous permettait de repousser les fronti√®res et d'offrir des exp√©riences sportives in√©dites. C'est pr√©cis√©ment notre ambition chez Decathlon Digital ! Nous sommes une √©quipe de plus de 5 000 experts en ing√©nierie logicielle, gestion de produits, donn√©es, cloud et cybers√©curit√©, r√©partis √† Paris, Lille et Amsterdam. Ensemble, nous cr√©ons la plus vaste plateforme sportive num√©rique, en exploitant les innovations technologiques pour optimiser la cha√Æne de valeur, concevoir des exp√©riences connect√©es et donner une seconde vie √† nos produits.

Changeons la donne pour de bon. Notre passion du sport nous guide et nous voulons qu‚Äôelle perdure. C‚Äôest pourquoi nous nous engageons √† b√¢tir un mod√®le technologique plus durable, en r√©duisant notre impact direct sur l'environnement, et en cr√©ant un espace s√ªr et inclusif pour apprendre et nous √©panouir ensemble. Rejoins l‚Äô√©quipe et fa√ßonnons le futur du sport.

With the expertise of over 4 000 teammates based in Lille, Paris, and Amsterdam, committed to creating the largest digital sports platform, leveraging tech innovation from design to value chain optimization, connected experiences, and product second life.

At DECATHLON DIGITAL, we‚Äôre transforming global digital sports experiences to elevate how customers and employees sustainably play, train, and connect in more than 70 countries.

La Big Data & AI Factory est constitu√©e d‚Äôune quarantaine d‚Äôexperts de la data aux profils compl√©mentaires, destin√©e √† mener des projets data et IA dans toutes les unit√©s Allianz France. column13: NEO - IT Master Data Management Expert
column15:
NEO is a major Group worldwide program decided by the Executive Committee - that will create common, simplified, and harmonized ways of working that will enable us to operate cross-m√©tier processes in our plants, Countries, Zones & Divisions.

By optimizing processes among divisions, NEO will allow us to support our goto-market initiatives in a more consumer centric and agile fashion, while improving the user experience and workloads for our teams. Laying the foundation for Beauty Tech, NEO will contribute to group performance, by leveraging our data, and helping transform L‚ÄôOr√©al into a ‚Äúsmart company‚Äù

Today NEO Program is at a turning point: shifting from a ‚Äúdesign & build & pilots mode‚Äù (phase 1) to a ‚Äúrollout mode‚Äù (phase 2) to deploy NEO in all L‚ÄôOr√©al entities.

To support this second phase of the project the Data Tribe is at the heart: ensure quality of Data, from conception to migration, integrated approach of data for any kind of Master Data

WOULD YOU LIKE TO BE A PART OF THIS ADVENTURE?

Join our Data Tribe in the capacity of Master Data Management Expert

The scope of this dedicated Data Tribe overviews the full scope of Data from Master Data Management (MDM) to Data Migration. We are also industrializing several tasks to create a more scalable model for roll-out with the Data Migration Factory.

HERE‚ÄôS HOW YOU WILL HAVE A ROLE TO PLAY IN IT:

In the NEO Data Tribe, you will join one of our MDM squads. You are interested about all aspect around the data: Data Design, Data flows, Data governance. You understand the S/4 Business Partner concept (in particular Supplier and Employee) and its business usage. You will design the S/4 Data Model, understand how the data is produced upfront in our MDM EBX Tibco system. You will connect all S/4 satellite applications consuming the data and following the modern architecture best practices (API first).

As an expert, you may latterly contribute to the maintenance of the applications.

On the NEO Program we are working with AGILE methodology

MAIN MISSIONS ON THE JOB

  • Support the Master data domain ‚ÄúProduct owners‚Äù in the definition of the business needs and translate them into specification for development/improvement of IT applications.
  • With our IT skills, Deliver the functional specifications of the applications.
  • Analyze the impact of proposed solutions on the domain processes
  • Customize/configure the S/4 Business Partner, prepare functional tests and endorse responsibility for validating developments before application roll out.
  • Manage ongoing relationships with internal clients giving regular updates on developments and improvements.
  • Participate and deploy the change management activities by accompanying end users and providing trainings.
  • Provide support on escalated maintenance issues to the Service Delivery teams.


THE SKILLS THAT YOU WILL NEED TO SUCCEED:
  • Act as a proactive Business Partner:
    • ‚ÄúBig picture‚Äù understanding of the L‚ÄôOr√©al business, operating model, processes and roles.
    • Ability to deal with complex IT / Business organizational structures, in multi-located and multi-cultural environment
  • Decode & influence:
    • Clarify and simplify technical concepts / solutions to facilitate action and decision making by product owner
    • Listen actively to his partners/clients to decode needs, qualify them properly and transform them in relevant technical solutions
  • Act with strong transversal management skills:
    • Bring an end-to-end vision of ecosystem of stakeholders
    • Manage efficient interactions with both internal and external contributors
    • Respect proposed methodology, and contribute to secure timing, budget and resource allocation on build activities
  • Facilitate knowledge management and expertise transmission:
    • Rapidly acquires new knowledge on delivered IT solutions and keeps constantly teams updated enhancements in his/her field
    • Organize at his/her level the relevant transmission of the technical and/or project management skills and ‚Äúknow how‚Äù


WHAT COULD BE THE NEXT STEPS AFTER THIS POSITION?

Since this position is quite transversal, we identified at least 3 different environments for a next step after these missions:
  • Business Intelligence
  • S/4 environments (run, roll-out)
  • Project Management (Data Migration for instance)
column38:
The desire for beauty has existed since the beginning of humanity. It‚Äôs a universal aspiration which crosses time, countries, and cultures.

Beauty is a powerful force that moves us.

We know that beauty is more than just looking good.
Beauty gives us confidence in who we are, in who we want to be, and in our relationships with others.

For over a century we have been dedicated to one sole vocation: creating beauty.
We remain true to the pioneering spirit of our founder and enjoy the unwavering support of his family, who have always accompanied our development.

Our goal is to offer each and every person around the world the best of beauty‚ÄØin terms of quality, efficacy, safety, sincerity and responsibility to satisfy all beauty needs and desires in their infinite diversity.

Because beauty is a permanent quest, we harness the power of our innovation to continually enhance the performance of our products and services.
Because we value diversity,‚ÄØwe leverage each of our brands to celebrate all expressions of beauty.

Because we strive to be exemplary with a long-term vision, we anchor our actions in our strong values and demanding ethical principles.

And because we are the global leader in beauty, we are aware that‚ÄØeverything we do can have a meaningful impact.
Therefore:

We act to shape the future of beauty‚ÄØby leveraging the best of science and technology, increasingly inspired by nature.

We act to drive social innovation‚ÄØby offering the best working conditions, training, and social protection for our employees.

We act to build a business with inclusivity at its heart‚ÄØby ensuring we are as diverse as the people we serve.

We act to nurture‚ÄØlasting partnerships‚ÄØwith our clients and suppliers‚ÄØbased on mutual trust and collaboration.

We act to create value for all our shareholders, by sustaining a robust business model.

We act to champion the cause of women‚ÄØand to strengthen the communities with which we engage.

We act to protect the beauty of the planet‚ÄØby fighting climate change, respecting biodiversity and preserving natural resources.

column38:
Founded in 2016 by two French entrepreneurs, Treezor quickly gained prominence in the financial sector before being acquired in 2019 by the Soci√©t√© G√©n√©rale group.

Treezor positions itself as an Electronic Money Institution, approved by the ACPR, allowing it to operate in no fewer than 25 countries while being a key player in the Mastercard network.

Treezor played a pioneering role in the development of the ‚ÄúBanking as a Service‚Äù model and has now achieved the status of the undisputed European leader, expanding its presence to five major countries: Germany, Belgium, Spain, Italy, and, of course, France.

Our mission is to support innovative projects by integrating a comprehensive range of payment services. This includes solutions such as identity verification (KYC), SEPA flow processing, issuance and processing of payment cards, as well as collection management on behalf of third parties, all in a comprehensive one-stop-shop approach.

It is worth noting that Treezor is the only French Electronic Money Institution to hold all eight necessary approvals to offer a complete range of payment services.

Today, Treezor is considered the FinTech of FinTechs.

column15:
Who we are

Artefact is a new generation of data service provider, specialised in data consulting and data-driven digital marketing.

Our purpose?

Every day we boost our clients‚Äô data transformation into business impact across the entire value chain of organisations.¬†

Our strength?

Our data services stand on double expertise: the combination of Artificial Intelligence and the business prowess acquired from our customers around the world, such as AccorHotels, Orange, Carrefour, Engie, Samsung, L'Or√©al, Nissan...¬†¬†

Artefact‚Äôs success comes from a unique mix of company assets: cutting-edge data technologies, agile methodologies for fast delivery, cohesive teams assembling the finest business consultants, data analysts, data scientists, data engineers, and digital marketing experts.

¬†

Artefact is :

  • 13 offices in Paris, London, Shanghai, Dubai...
  • 900 employees
  • 4 practices: Data Consulting, Data Marketing, Activation and Creation

¬†

What you will be doing: Key responsibilities

As a Senior Data Analyst, your role will encompass:

  • Conducting projects to accompany the transformation of your clients‚Äô businesses through the effective collection, processing, and visualisation of data
  • Extracting valuable insights from our clients‚Äô marketing-related data sources.
  • Designing dashboards for marketing decision-making while taking into account the business needs
  • Accompanying our clients in the conception and implementation of data architectures and data pipelines, from collection to monitoring.
  • Actively contributing to the expertise level and competencies of the Data & Analytics team
  • Closely collaborate with the other divisions (Media & Activation, Creation, Consulting, Data Science and Data Engineer) to provide comprehensive services to your clients

Being a great tech role model

  • Demonstrating the skill and credibility required to ensure the success of our clients‚Äô initiatives
  • Researching and developing new technical approaches to address problems efficiently
  • Staying up-to-date on developments within the industry, sharing best practices and actively contributing to Artefact‚Äôs institutional knowledge
  • Embodying Artefact‚Äôs values and inspiring others to do the same

¬†

Qualifications: Education & experience required

  • Having an academic level of education (Bachelor or Master), in a data-driven working environment, you have experience or have knowledge in :

    • A minimum of 3 year of work experience in a data-driven working environment
    • 1 or more data collection (Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, SQL database, CRM database, transactional data)
    • 1 or 2 programming languages among SQL, Python and/or R.
    • 1 or more Data visualisation tool (Tableau, Data Studio, Dataviz, R / Python dataviz libraries, ...)¬†

    In addition, you have the knowledge in one or more of the following technologies:

    • Google Cloud Platform resources (Big Query, Google Cloud Storage) or its equivalent in Azure or AWS
    • You know how to connect to an API through the knowledge of the different authentication method (OAuth, HTTP Basic, API key)
    • Advertising tool, linked to tracking and/or analytics in a marketing context (Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, DMP, DSP, Adservers, DV 360...)¬†¬†
    • ETL tool (Airflow, Dataiku, Dataflow, Dataprep...)¬†
    • Web application (R-Shiny, Python Flask) that you have industrialized

    Ideally you have:¬†

    • Knowledge of statistics¬†
    • Knowledge of machine learning and data engineering

What we are looking for

  • A Doer:¬†you get things done and inspire your team to do the same
  • An Analyst:¬†you LOVE data and think every company should take their decisions based on facts
  • A Pragmatist:¬†you have a no-nonsense mindset that seeks for practical and realistic solutions
  • A Mentor:¬†your clients and colleagues naturally seek you out for advice
  • An Adventurer:¬†you‚Äôre an entrepreneur constantly looking for business opportunities

Why you should join us

  • Artefact is the place to be:¬†come and build the future of marketing
  • Progress:¬†every day offers new challenges and new opportunities to learn
  • Culture:¬†join the best team you could ever imagine
  • Entrepreneurship:¬†you will be joining a team of driven entrepreneurs. We won‚Äôt give up until we make a huge dent in this industry!

¬†

Come join us!

The team

Come join us!

¬†

What you will be doing: Key responsibilities

As a Data Analyst, your role will encompass:

  • Conducting projects to accompany the transformation of your clients‚Äô businesses through the effective collection, processing, and visualisation of data
  • Extracting valuable insights from our clients‚Äô marketing-related data sources.
  • Designing dashboards for marketing decision-making while taking into account the business needs
  • Accompanying our clients in the conception and implementation of data architectures and data pipelines, from collection to monitoring.
  • Actively contributing to the expertise level and competencies of the Data & Analytics team
  • Closely collaborate with the other divisions (Media & Activation, Creation, Consulting, Data Science and Data Engineer) to provide comprehensive services to your clients

¬†

Qualifications: Education & experience required

Having an academic level of education (Bachelor or Master), in a data-driven working environment, you have experience or have knowledge in :

  • A minimum of 1 year of work experience in a data-driven working environment
  • 1 or more data collection (Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, SQL database, CRM database, transactional data)
  • 1 or 2 programming languages among SQL, Python and/or R.
  • 1 Data visualisation tool (Tableau, Data Studio, Dataviz, R / Python dataviz libraries, ...)

Ideally, you have the knowledge or take interested in one or more of the following technologies:

  • 1 Google Cloud Platform resource (Big Query, Google Cloud Storage) or its equivalence in Azure or AWS
  • You know how to connect to an API through the knowledge of the different authentication method (OAuth, HTTP Basic, API key)
  • 1 advertising tool, linked to tracking and/or analytics in a marketing context (Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, DMP, DSP, Adservers, DV 360...)
  • 1 ETL tool (Airflow, Dataiku, Dataflow, Dataprep...)
  • 1 web application (R-Shiny, Python Flask) that you have industrialized

As a bonus, you have:

  • Basic knowledge of statistics
  • Basic knowledge of machine learning and data engineering

¬†

What we are looking for

  • A Doer:¬†you get things done and inspire your colleagues to do the same
  • An Analyst:¬†you LOVE data and think every company should take their decisions based on facts
  • A Pragmatist:¬†you have a no-nonsense mindset that seeks for practical and realistic solutions
  • A Mentor:¬†your clients and teams naturally seek you out for advice
  • An Adventurer:¬†you‚Äôre an entrepreneur constantly looking for business opportunities

¬†

Why you should join us

  • Artefact is the place to be:¬†come and build the future of marketing
  • Progress:¬†every day offers new challenges and new opportunities to learn
  • Culture:¬†join the best team you could ever imagine
  • Entrepreneurship:¬†you will be joining a team of driven entrepreneurs. We won‚Äôt give up until we make a huge dent in this industry!

Come join us!

column15:
We are looking for an experienced Game Analyst -he/she/they- to join our Growth Team. You will be responsible for monitoring, analyzing, and optimizing key performance indicators across our products to help maximizing long term revenue and analyze and improve the effectiveness of the player life cycle.

You will do that by setting-up AB-tests of in-game features and create dashboards. You will regularly communicate your findings to Product, Management and Marketing teams to ensure your insights are used to inform decision making, to drive the growth of multiple games (focusing with the portfolio of Loop Games at first). You will work inside the Data Team (3 Data Analysts, 2 Data Engineers, 1 Analytics Engineer) and you will report to the VP of Growth.

This position is hybrid (3 days per week at the office) and located in Paris.

Team description

The Data team at 52 entertainment is full of talents working on Business & Financial, Product and Marketing KPIs. It is a cross-functional team that connects with all business units (US, Europe, Asia).

The Data team is operating remotely: we talk to each other on a daily basis and organize frequent virtual coffees ‚òïÔ∏è.

Some are geeks, some are not, apply as you are, we‚Äôre a diversity-friendly team üßï üëßüèΩ ü•∑ üë®üèø üë© ü¶æ. In our team everyone is to be treated equally regardless of sex, race, gender identification, disability, age, religion, ‚Ä¶

Missions

  • Support insight-driven decision making for several games

  • Collaborate with Product, Marketing, Customer Success, Live Ops on

  • - A/B testing initiatives

  • - Personalization strategies

  • - Launching new games on the market

  • Develop and define KPIs and models to assess game performance

  • Analyze large, complex data sets representing the behavior of millions of players

  • Design tests that investigate hypothesis and uncover customer insights

  • Create, own and manage an evolving AB test roadmap

  • Create and share actionable presentations and recommendations based on your findings to optimize the product roadmap and soft launch new games

We‚Äôre excited about you because‚Ä¶

  • Been working in the gaming industry for at least a couple of years, and know a few tricks to get players more engaged in game.

  • While most of your time will be spent working with other cross-functional leaders, you make sure to keep up to date with the latest trends in gaming and analytics.

  • Can easily communicate technical concepts to a wide variety of audiences - from engineers/scientists to business stakeholders - and navigate between big-picture and technical details.

  • Impressive ability to prioritize and weigh impact vs. effort and interest in how Analytics can help unlock faster growth and/or opportunities to increase margin and/or cut costs.

Benefits

  • Work in a start-up with exceptional growth

  • Highly interesting work environment with flat hierarchies, fast pace, and fun

  • If you have the potential, we will do everything to help you to achieve the highest level of personal and professional development.

  • High autonomy. No micro-managing here. When you‚Äôll be up to speed, you‚Äôll be given high-level directions, and you will often be free to solve problems in the way you feel is best.

  • Amazingly friendly Data team.

column38:
Smartway (Z√©ro-G√¢chis, or ‚ÄòZero Waste‚Äô) is a sincere human adventure involved in the fight against food waste.

A food store throws away as much as it earns! While more and more consumers are in need, combating waste should be a priority: stores can now remedy this, while also increasing their profitability.

As a committed company since 2012, originator of ‚ÄòZero Waste‚Äô shelves, Smartway has created the first Food Waste Management System platform to optimise the end-of-life pathway for food products.

Relying on unique artificial intelligence, Smartway solutions guide in-store teams to detect products approaching their expiry date and to decide the best way to repurpose them: labelling with a suitable discount or simplified donation to charitable organisations.

Smartway is convinced that today‚Äôs environmental challenges no longer have to be tomorrow‚Äôs and the technology to combat waste is the future!

Dans un environnement aux besoins en constante et rapide √©volution, vous √™tes force de proposition et vous aimez et savez concevoir des solutions adapt√©es, autour sp√©cifiquement de la gestion des bases de donn√©es produits et clients, et la gestion des param√©trages et des litiges prix.

column38:
Essity est un Groupe international su√©dois, leader mondial dans le secteur de l‚Äôhygi√®ne et de la sant√© avec 36.000 collaborateurs dans le monde.

column15:
üöÄ Founded in 2021, Echo's narrative is one of relentless growth, ambition, and promise. A cutting-edge startup at the forefront of Geospatial Data and Gen AI technologies, we have skyrocketed from 0 to 80+ employees in just three years!

Specialists in the location intelligence industry, we empower innovation by helping companies better understand the world around them.

In a world inundated with data, quality is crucial. We use data science, machine learning, and human feedback to build Europe's most comprehensive, high-quality datasets, enriched with differentiating attributes that outmaneuver the competition.

We aren‚Äôt just about reliable data (read: unmatched quality) though.

Life at Echo is about individual growth, collective ambition, and a culture that values and celebrates diversity; With a "people first" philosophy guiding everything we do.

You'll be at the heart of innovation, tackling projects that shape our future, with the best people possible!

We are seeking a highly motivated individual to join our team as a Technical Product Operations Specialist. This role sits at the intersection of technology, data acquisition, and product management. The ideal candidate is a tech-savvy individual who thrives on building partnerships, analyzing data, and driving product success through effective operations.

You will be joining the Product Team. A great team built around more than 7 people.

As such, your main responsibilities will be:

  • Collaborate with product managers to identify data needs and requirements.

  • Communicate with vendors and providers to acquire necessary data sets, understanding their offerings, and negotiating agreements within the parameters set by product management.

  • Utilize SQL skills to query, manipulate, and analyze data for various purposes, including quality checks and performance assessments.

  • Build internal tool, product solutions to manage our different data Product, such as External Data Acquisition (ERA) systems, ensuring data integrity and reliability.

  • Develop and implement automation processes to streamline data acquisition, analysis, and quality assurance.

  • Act as a liaison between technical teams, product managers, and external providers to ensure smooth operation and timely delivery of data.

  • Continuously monitor data quality and performance metrics, proactively identifying and addressing any issues that may arise.

  • Bonus : Ability to Identify available datasets in the market and inspire echo to build new products based on data availability and customer need.

What we‚Äôre looking for

  • Masters degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.

  • Strong proficiency in SQL with the ability to write complex queries and perform data analysis.

  • Experience in product management, data operations, or a related field is preferred.

  • Excellent communication and negotiation skills, with the ability to effectively interact with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

  • Proven track record of building and maintaining partnerships with external vendors and providers.

  • Ability to work independently, prioritize tasks, and manage multiple projects simultaneously.

  • Experience with automation tools and techniques is a plus.

Why us?

  • üåé A great diverse and international team based in Paris (33+ nationalities!)

  • üöÄ Impact and ownership mindset: at Echo we encourage everyone to take ownership of their projects

  • üéá People first company: without our people we have no business, we have dedicated a People Manifesto to them

  • üåÜ A contemporary office space in central Paris with a rooftop to admire the view

  • üíª Hybrid remote policy

  • ü•ò Free coffee, snacks on top of your lunch voucher card (Swile, 10‚Ç¨/ working day)

  • üè• Healthcare insurance

Still hesitating or feeling like you don‚Äôt check all the boxes? We encourage you to apply anyway! üôÇ

Best case scenario: we start an incredible collaboration. If not, you only invest a few minutes towards your application. We promise, you won‚Äôt regret it!

We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities regardless of gender, sexual orientation, origin, disabilities, or any other traits that make you who you are.

column38:
Safran Aircraft Engines con√ßoit, d√©veloppe, produit, commercialise et supporte, seul ou en coop√©ration, des moteurs a√©ronautiques civils et militaires aux meilleurs niveaux de performance. La soci√©t√© est notamment, √† travers CFM International, le leader mondial de la propulsion d‚Äôavions commerciaux courts et moyen-courriers avec les gammes de moteurs CFM56 et LEAP qui √©quipent les derni√®res g√©n√©rations d‚Äôavions de la famille Airbus A320neo, Boeing 737 MAX et COMAC C919.

Dans le domaine de la propulsion militaire, la soci√©t√© a int√©gralement con√ßu, d√©velopp√© et produit le M88 et le M53 qui √©quipent respectivement le Rafale et le Mirage 2000 et sera int√©grateur du moteur du futur avion de combat europ√©en (Next G√©n√©ration Fighter) du SCAF, dont l‚Äôentr√©e en service est pr√©vue d‚Äôici 2040.

En 2021, Safran a sign√© aux c√¥t√©s des leaders de l‚Äôindustrie a√©ronautique la d√©claration de l‚ÄôATAG qui vise √† garantir la neutralit√© carbone du secteur en 2050. column13: Senior Marketing Data Analyst for Business Information
column15:
Our Mission

As part of the ongoing development of Business Information Services, Coface is recruiting a Senior Marketing Data Analyst for Business Information. This key role will report directly to the Group Marketing Director: Business Information at Coface. In this role you will oversee various aspects of Marketing performance operations and reporting, including producing systematic reporting and actional analytics covering pricing, product performance and usage, inbound demand generation, outbound lead generation analysis, GTM and communication impact analysis and pricing projects.

High level remit:

  • Key member of the BI Marketing team, championing an insight led approach to inform marketing decisions and to evaluate the effectiveness of marketing activities across go-to-market, lead generation, product and pricing.
  • Collaborate with the Distribution Squad Leadership (Sales, Marketing and Customer Success) to formulate and execute on insight led approach to corridor planning, go-to-market and lead generation marketing activities.
  • Lead development of best practice in measurement and evaluation of marketing activities, working closely with group colleagues to facilitate demonstrating the contribution of BI marketing activities.

What you will be doing:

  • Goal Setting and Strategy: responsible for surfacing insights, building reports and supporting an insight led approach to decision making for planning and implementation of marketing strategies across GTM, lead generation, product and pricing.
  • Reporting and Process Analysis: responsible for defining and setting up best practice processes on all aspects of marketing reporting so that we can track the revenue impact of all marketing activities and identify areas for continuous improvement.
  • Delivering Actionable Insights: identify insights that can drive revenue growth and improvements.
  • Pricing Analysis: gather and collate competitive pricing insights from the regions, drive the development and implementation of advanced pricing analytics to inform strategic decisions, assess the impact of annual price changes on market performance and revenue growth by creating reports and dashboards to track the effectiveness of pricing initiatives,
  • Pricing projects: work with the BI Pricing Director to streamline the quote-to-cash sales process by implementing a CPQ and CLM proof of concept and subsequent roll out, ¬†to enhance sales efficiency and customer satisfaction.
  • Regularly update: Senior Marketing and Commercial Leadership, as well as other key stakeholders on progress, challenges, and results.
  • Conduct sophisticated, detailed analysis and clearly communicate results so that decisions can be made with confidence.

column4: AEW est la plateforme de gestion d'actifs immobiliers de Natixis Investment Managers (NIM).  NIM fait partie du p√¥le Global Financial Services du Groupe BPCE, 5√®me √©tablissement financier europ√©en et 2√®me acteur bancaire en France √† travers ses r√©seaux Banque Populaire et Caisse d'√âpargne. En Europe, plus de 450 collaborateurs mettent leur expertise au service des clients d'AEW pour d√©ployer avec succ√®s des strat√©gies d'investissement core, value-added et opportunist. AEW intervient sur les march√©s porteurs de l'immobilier, notamment la logistique, les bureaux, la sant√©, le r√©sidentiel, le commerce. En tant qu'employeur, nous offrons √† toutes et tous les m√™mes opportunit√©s d'acc√®s √† l'emploi sans distinction de genre, ethnicit√©, religion, orientation sexuelle, statut social, handicap et √¢ge. column13: Workday Data and Analytics Senior manager (x/f/m)
column15:
What you‚Äôll do

Doctolib is looking for a dedicated and experienced People Data and Analytics, Senior manager to join our People Systems and Performance team.¬†

As a company, we strongly believe in harnessing the power of data and analytics to drive strategic decision
-making and enhance the employee experience.¬†

Reporting directly to the Head of People Systems and Performance, you will be responsible for leading the development, implementation, and management of our people analytics strategy. This role will play a crucial part in leveraging data
-driven insights to optimize talent management and C&B strategies, drive employee engagement and support strategic People initiatives.¬†¬†

You will play a key role in building the HR data strategy and governance, ensuring a consistent reporting and analytics approach across functions (tools, processes, security and access) with a strong focus on user experience and business impact.¬†

The ideal candidate will have a strong background in HRIS solutions, particularly Workday, and a proven track record of translating data into actionable recommendations to support organizational objectives.¬†

Directly reporting to the Head of People Systems and Performance, you will work closely with the other product owners to make sure we are delivering a consistent solution.¬†

Your role will be to advise on the reporting system capabilities, new features and improvements as well as supporting the roadmap delivery.¬†

Your responsibilities include but are not limited to :¬†

Delivery¬†

  • In coordination with product owners, design, build and implement custom Workday reports and dashboards to provide real time insights to People teams and managers fostering a data
    -driven culture within the team.
  • Lead the configuration and maintenance of reporting with the objective to optimize and simplify our user experience (manager dashboard, HR dashboard, discovery board).
  • Lead efforts to analyze and optimize report performance
  • Collaborate with business stakeholders and People teams to understand their data needs and provide analytical support for decision
    -making processes.
  • Work closely with the PSP team to provide report and dashboarding solutions leveraging Workday capabilities (worksheet, discovery board, etc).¬†
  • Conduct regular system audits to ensure data accuracy, integrity, and compliance with company policies and regulations
  • Analyse and troubleshoot Workday issues related to reporting and provide timely resolutions.
  • Capacity to work with our Workday partners for reporting delivery on project/

Advisory and change management

  • Serve as a subject matter expert on Workday reporting and share best practices and knowledge with other team members.
  • Upskill the People team on reporting usage.
  • Maintain proper change management documentation to satisfy the company‚Äôs internal/external audit.
  • Connect with the Workday network, stay up to date with Workday updates, enhancements, and new features, and evaluate their applicability to Doctolib.¬†
  • Continuously seek opportunities to optimize and enhance Workday functionality to drive efficiency and improve the employee experience.

Who you are

If you don‚Äôt meet all the requirements below but believe this opportunity matches your expectations and experience, we still encourage you to apply!

You could be our next team mate if:¬†

  • You have at least 5 years of proven experience in Workday reporting : advanced, matrix, composite, BIRT, dashboard setup, calculated fields, reporting security, worksheet, discovery board..utilizing Workday Report Writer and Report Designer, as well as other organizational tools.
  • You have strong analytical skills and the ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions within the Workday environment
  • You have a strong sense of confidentiality
  • You have excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, to effectively collaborate with cross
    -functional teams
  • You speak fluent English;

It would be wonderful if :¬†

  • You have a multi
    -country experience and you desire to work with teams in multiple countries¬†
  • You have an entrepreneurial mindset with the ambition to transform the healthcare sector

What we offer¬†

  • Employee share plan for every Doctoliber (BSPCE)
  • Free Health Insurance for you & your family
  • Quarterly or monthly bonus (based on your position)
  • Up to 14 days of RTT¬†
  • A flexible workplace policy offering both hybrid and office
    -based mode
  • Flexibility days allowing to work in EU countries and the UK 10 days per year¬†
  • Lunch voucher with Swile card
  • Work Council subsidy to refund part of sport club membership or creative class
  • Bicycle subsidy
  • Reimbursement of public transportation
  • Relocation support for international mobilities
  • Slean voucher for home
    -office furniture

The interview process

  • Talent Acquisition Interview
  • Hiring Manager Interview
  • Case Study with two hiring managers¬†
  • Final Interview with People Director¬†
  • Reference check¬†
  • Offer¬†

Job Details

  • Permanent contract (CDI)
  • Full
    -time position
  • Workplace: Levallois HQ
  • Remuneration: fixed salary and variable based on objectives (to be defined according to profile)
  • This position is eligible for partial telecommuting

At Doctolib, we believe in improving access to healthcare for everyone
- regardless of where you come from, what you look like. This translates into our recruitment process: Doctolib is an equal opportunity employer. We don't just accept diversity at Doctolib, we respect and celebrate it!

The more diverse ideas are heard, the more our product will truly improve healthcare for all. You are welcome to apply to Doctolib, regardless of your gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, ethnicity, disability, or place of origin. If you have a disability, let us know if there's any way we can make the interview process smoother for you!¬†

All the information transmitted via this form is processed by Doctolib for the purpose of managing applications. For more information on how Doctolib processes your application data, click here.

If you wish to exercise your rights or if you have any questions about the processing of your data, you can write to us at hr.dataprivacy@doctolib.com.
column36: Mobile Apps, Software, SaaS / Cloud Services, Health
column38:
Doctolib is a purpose-led company that strives for a healthier world with more than 2,800 employees across France, Italy, and Germany. Since 2013, Doctolib has been improving the daily lives of more than 340,000 healthcare professionals by providing them with new-generation technology and services.

Doctolib also serves more than 70 million patients, offering a fast, frictionless and secure journey for all their care needs.

column15:
LE CONTEXTE

Depuis plus de 40 ans, gr√¢ce √† ses produits innovants et fort de sa culture reposant sur l‚Äôaccessibilit√©, Decathlon ne cesse de r√©inventer le march√© du sport.Notre mission : rendre durablement les plaisirs et les bienfaits du sport accessibles au plus grand nombre.

Au sein de cette Business Unit, le domaine Sport & Products est au c≈ìur de la transformation et de l‚Äôinnovation de D√©cathlon car il sert les √©quipes D√©cathlon en charge de la construction de notre offre globale de produits, de la conception des produits (conception, design, qualit√©, innovation, soutenabilit√©) et de leur commercialisation. En tant que Data & AI Product Manager, tu seras charg√©(e) du d√©veloppement de produits Data (Dashboards avanc√©s, mod√®les pr√©dictifs, outils d‚Äôaide √† la d√©cision).

Tu rejoindras une √©quipe charg√©e du d√©veloppement de solutions √† destination des √©quipes de Conception, Qualit√©, Innovation. Tu animeras une √©quipe compos√©e de Data Analysts, BI Engineers et Data Scientists.

Il s‚Äôagit d‚Äôun r√¥le cl√©, √† fortes responsabilit√©s dont l‚Äôobjectif est de contribuer concr√®tement √† l‚Äôapport de valeur par la Data: comprendre les points de douleur de nos utilisateurs, imaginer des solutions pour y r√©pondre, d√©velopper et d√©ployer ces solutions, puis les faire √©voluer et en assurer la maintenance.

TES RESPONSABILITES

  • Comprendre en profondeur le m√©tier de tes interlocuteurs, leurs enjeux, leurs process, les d√©cisions qu‚Äôils prennent, les informations dont ils ont besoin
  • Co-concevoir les solutions Data (Dashboard, mod√®les pr√©dictifs, ‚Ä¶) et d√©cliner leur roadmap en √©troite collaboration avec les utilisateurs.

  • Animer l‚Äô√©quipe de r√©alisation au cours des phases de Discovery, Delivery et Evolution et √™tre garant de la r√©ussite du projet et de la qualit√© du produit livr√© (tests, faible dette technique, qualit√© d‚Äôusage, ‚Ä¶)

ENVIRONNEMENT TECHNIQUE

CE DONT TU AURAS BESOIN POUR R√âUSSIR

  • Data centric, tu poss√®des une compr√©hension approfondie de la science des donn√©es, de la Business Intelligence/ Data Analyse et de l'IA, avec une exp√©rience professionnelle de plus de 2 ans dans l'un de ces domaines
  • Tu ma√Ætrises l‚Äôanglais √©crit et parl√©.

  • Tu es particuli√®rement sensible √† l‚Äôimpact de la pratique du sport pour les valeurs qu'elle t'a permise d‚Äôacqu√©rir dans ton style de leadership et l‚Äôanimation de tes √©quipes !

CE QUE NOUS OFFRONS

DECATHLON DIGITAL

Imaginez si la technologie nous permettait de repousser les fronti√®res et d'offrir des exp√©riences sportives in√©dites. C'est pr√©cis√©ment notre ambition chez Decathlon Digital ! Nous sommes une √©quipe de plus de 5 000 experts en ing√©nierie logicielle, gestion de produits, donn√©es, cloud et cybers√©curit√©, r√©partis √† Paris, Lille et Amsterdam. Ensemble, nous cr√©ons la plus vaste plateforme sportive num√©rique, en exploitant les innovations technologiques pour optimiser la cha√Æne de valeur, concevoir des exp√©riences connect√©es et donner une seconde vie √† nos produits.

Changeons la donne pour de bon. Notre passion du sport nous guide et nous voulons qu‚Äôelle perdure. C‚Äôest pourquoi nous nous engageons √† b√¢tir un mod√®le technologique plus durable, en r√©duisant notre impact direct sur l'environnement, et en cr√©ant un espace s√ªr et inclusif pour apprendre et nous √©panouir ensemble. Rejoins l‚Äô√©quipe et fa√ßonnons le futur du sport.

column13: Data & AI Product Manager - Sport & Products (f/m/d)
column15:
LE CONTEXTE

Depuis plus de 40 ans, gr√¢ce √† ses produits innovants et fort de sa culture reposant sur l‚Äôaccessibilit√©, Decathlon ne cesse de r√©inventer le march√© du sport.Notre mission : rendre durablement les plaisirs et les bienfaits du sport accessibles au plus grand nombre.

Aujourd‚Äôhui, nous tirons parti de cette culture de l‚Äôinnovation et de notre expertise digitale pour qu‚Äôun public plus large puisse b√©n√©ficier des plaisirs du sport et ce, √† l‚Äôaide de la technologie. Nous cr√©ons de nouvelles exp√©riences pour les sportives et sportifs ‚Äì coaching virtuel, programmes de fid√©lit√©, exp√©riences intelligentes en magasin, offres de produits neufs et d‚Äôoccasion, mais aussi services de location d‚Äôune large gamme de produits Decathlon et de partenaires. Notre objectif : cr√©er un √©cosyst√®me digital de produits et services.

Nos √©quipes tech fran√ßaises implant√©es √† Paris (Global Business Hub) et Lille (HQ) rassemblent plus de 2500 software engineers, product manager et expert¬∑e¬∑s de la data, uni¬∑e¬∑s pour apporter les meilleures solutions digitales √† nos utilisateurs m√©tiers et ainsi r√©pondre aux besoins de nos 500 millions de clients.

Au sein de cette Business Unit, le domaine Sport & Products est au c≈ìur de la transformation et de l‚Äôinnovation de D√©cathlon car il sert les √©quipes D√©cathlon en charge de la construction de notre offre globale de produits, de la conception des produits (conception, design, qualit√©, innovation, soutenabilit√©) et de leur commercialisation. Saviez-vous que 80% des produits vendus en magasins sont con√ßus et d√©velopp√©s par Decathlon ? Une belle responsabilit√© !

REJOINS L'√âQUIPE DATA SPORT & PRODUCTS

Dans le cadre d‚Äôun remplacement, nous recrutons un-e Data & AI Product Manager, bas√©-e, au choix √† Paris ou Lille.

En tant que Data & AI Product Manager, tu seras charg√©(e) du d√©veloppement de produits Data (Dashboards avanc√©s, mod√®les pr√©dictifs, outils d‚Äôaide √† la d√©cision).

Tu rejoindras une √©quipe charg√©e du d√©veloppement de solutions √† destination des √©quipes de Conception, Qualit√©, Innovation. Tu animeras une √©quipe compos√©e de Data Analysts, BI Engineers et Data Scientists.

Il s‚Äôagit d‚Äôun r√¥le cl√©, √† fortes responsabilit√©s dont l‚Äôobjectif est de contribuer concr√®tement √† l‚Äôapport de valeur par la Data: comprendre les points de douleur de nos utilisateurs, imaginer des solutions pour y r√©pondre, d√©velopper et d√©ployer ces solutions, puis les faire √©voluer et en assurer la maintenance.

TES RESPONSABILITES

  • Comprendre en profondeur le m√©tier de tes interlocuteurs, leurs enjeux, leurs process, les d√©cisions qu‚Äôils prennent, les informations dont ils ont besoin
  • Co-concevoir les solutions Data (Dashboard, mod√®les pr√©dictifs, ‚Ä¶) et d√©cliner leur roadmap en √©troite collaboration avec les utilisateurs.
  • R√©diger des Users Stories, d√©finir des crit√®res de succ√®s, Cr√©er, maintenir et prioriser le backlog produit.
  • D√©finir et prioriser les fonctionnalit√©s du produit en recueillant le feedback utilisateur et en menant des ateliers avec les d√©veloppeurs, le business et les m√©tiers.
  • Animer l‚Äô√©quipe de r√©alisation au cours des phases de Discovery, Delivery et Evolution et √™tre garant de la r√©ussite du projet et de la qualit√© du produit livr√© (tests, faible dette technique, qualit√© d‚Äôusage, ‚Ä¶)

ENVIRONNEMENT TECHNIQUE

  • AWS (S3, Athena...)
  • Databricks
  • Dataviz : Tableau
  • Technologies Back-End / Langages : Python, SQL, Spark / Scala, Airflow, DBT

CE DONT TU AURAS BESOIN POUR R√âUSSIR

  • Tu as plus de 4 ans d'exp√©rience professionnelle r√©ussie dans un r√¥le de gestion de produit dans un environnement "data"
  • Data centric, tu poss√®des une compr√©hension approfondie de la science des donn√©es, de la Business Intelligence/ Data Analyse et de l'IA, avec une exp√©rience professionnelle de plus de 2 ans dans l'un de ces domaines
  • Tu ma√Ætrises l‚Äôanglais √©crit et parl√©.
  • Tu as des capacit√©s d‚Äôanalyse, de synth√®se et fais preuve de pragmatisme dans la d√©finition et la priorisation de solutions.
  • Tu es familier(e) avec les d√©marches d‚ÄôUX, de Design Thinking et places l‚Äôutilisateur au coeur de tes d√©cisions.
  • Tu es particuli√®rement sensible √† l‚Äôimpact de la pratique du sport pour les valeurs qu'elle t'a permise d‚Äôacqu√©rir dans ton style de leadership et l‚Äôanimation de tes √©quipes !
  • Tu as envie de rejoindre une entreprise √† impact positif (#Tech4Good)

CE QUE NOUS OFFRONS

  • Flexibilit√© dans l'organisation du travail (lieu, rythme)
  • Libert√© de choix de l'outil de travail (Mac, Windows)
  • √âquipe de projet locale et partage avec le r√©seau mondial (parcours international)
  • Mont√©e en comp√©tences (diversit√© des projets, des langues et des technologies)
  • Formations internes et externes
  • Actionnariat salari√©s
  • Primes mensuelles et trimestrielles

DECATHLON DIGITAL

Imaginez si la technologie nous permettait de repousser les fronti√®res et d'offrir des exp√©riences sportives in√©dites. C'est pr√©cis√©ment notre ambition chez Decathlon Digital ! Nous sommes une √©quipe de plus de 5 000 experts en ing√©nierie logicielle, gestion de produits, donn√©es, cloud et cybers√©curit√©, r√©partis √† Paris, Lille et Amsterdam. Ensemble, nous cr√©ons la plus vaste plateforme sportive num√©rique, en exploitant les innovations technologiques pour optimiser la cha√Æne de valeur, concevoir des exp√©riences connect√©es et donner une seconde vie √† nos produits.

Changeons la donne pour de bon. Notre passion du sport nous guide et nous voulons qu‚Äôelle perdure. C‚Äôest pourquoi nous nous engageons √† b√¢tir un mod√®le technologique plus durable, en r√©duisant notre impact direct sur l'environnement, et en cr√©ant un espace s√ªr et inclusif pour apprendre et nous √©panouir ensemble. Rejoins l‚Äô√©quipe et fa√ßonnons le futur du sport.

column15:
La BU D√©mant√®lement et Services d‚ÄôOrano (BU DS) a lanc√© un ambitieux Programme de Transformation (SHIFT DS) int√©grant 3 axes de travail :

¬∑ La transformation manag√©riale et la mise en place des outils de l‚ÄôExcellence Op√©rationnelle (LEAN)

¬∑ L‚Äôindustrialisation des m√©tiers et la standardisation des pratiques

¬∑ Le d√©veloppement et le d√©ploiement de solutions digitales

Afin de contribuer √† la Roadmap Data de la BU, qui pr√©voit d‚Äôexploiter et valoriser les donn√©es issues des solutions digitales en cours de d√©ploiement, la BU DS souhaite recruter un Data Manager dont les missions sont :

¬∑ Contribuer √† la mise en ≈ìuvre de la gouvernance des donn√©es et du dispositif de qualit√© des donn√©es dans la BU en coordonnant les diff√©rents acteurs du dispositif, en lien avec le Chief Data Officer de la BU ;

¬∑ Accompagner les op√©rationnels m√©tier et les Data Analyst dans la conception et d√©veloppement des cas d'usage de la BU

¬∑ Contribuer √† la valorisation des donn√©es en accompagnant le m√©tier dans l‚Äôidentification de nouveaux cas d‚Äôusages √† valeur ajout√©e ;

¬∑ Contribuer au respect des exigences de Data Compliance (ex : RGPD) et de normalisation des entrep√¥ts de donn√©es √† concevoir

column15:
What you‚Äôll do

Doctolib is looking for a Data excellence senior associate to strengthen the newly created HCP (Healthcare Practitioners) Data Platform team.

Your main missions will be to :

  1. Maximize our Prospects Target addressable market to enable Sales & Marketing growth
  2. Improve our database quality
  3. Join forces with our product and ops teams to scale our processes

As a Data excellence senior associate, you will be the main point of contact of our local sales & marketing teams based in France, Germany and Italy.¬†

Your responsibilities include but are not limited to:

Be the main point of contact regarding prospect data :

  • Work with all business teams to propose the right governance & business processes to ensure our data standards (eg. Sales, Marketing, Finance, Legal, Products‚Ä¶)
  • Propose ambitious roadmaps to achieve our goals

Lead complex data excellence projects:

  • Lead, scope, drive & deliver data excellence projects (data analysis, data strategy, quality, data sourcing, Sales processes & change management, etc.)
  • Build scalable & lasting solutions by yourself or via our internal partners (Data Analytics, Data Operations, Product teams)
  • Ensure our database is efficient, complete & accurate and provide market knowledge on our prospect & competitors (Salesforces, MDM)

Who you are

If you don‚Äôt meet all the requirements below but believe this opportunity matches your expectations and experience, we still encourage you to apply!

You could be our next team mate if you:

  • You graduated from a Business School or Engineering School;
  • You have at least 3 to 5 years of experience as a consultant, business or data analyst with strong business & data sense. You also have a fast and successful track record in a B2B SaaS company or consulting firm;
  • You‚Äôre highly proficient in writing SQL queries, including complex joins, and have extensive experience working with large databases.;
  • You have experience in leading projects
  • English is mandatory, French / German / Italian are a plus.

column15:
üåé¬†Who we are

AXA Climate is a Committed Climate Insurer. We accompany our clients in their sustainability transition journey, we feed our entire offer with best-in-class climate expertise, and we fully leverage satellite in our products. We are reinventing the insurance business to support actors engaged in sustainable transition.

ü¶ã¬†Working at AXA Climate

AXA Climate‚Äôs desire is to innovate in terms of corporate culture so that everyone can flourish and develop all its potential.¬†Our culture is therefore ‚Äúorganic‚Äù organization, without a fixed hierarchy, to continuously adapt to the market, aligned with our aspirations.

We are a team of 150+ collaborators (underwriters, climate & agri experts, and tech & data experts), spread over the 5 continents and we are all driven by the same focus on impact, leveraging the full AXA ecosystem.

‚ú®¬†Your job as Operations & Data Analyst

1. Data management and analysis for quarterly financial reports on closings and monitoring of profitability.

2. Underwriting operations liaising with our partners in France and abroad for:

- the booking of insurance and reinsurance structures,

- the brokers accreditation,

- the collection of premiums,

- the management of parametric insurance claims.
column38:
AXA Climate‚Äôs purpose is to make regenerative business universal.

Reducing our negative impact on the planet is not enough. Our collective challenge is to switch from extractive companies to regenerative companies. To that end, we are transforming our business models, our organizations and our collective missions. And this transformation movement drives us.

We are changing the paradigm: our companies are living beings, nested in the living world. To serve this mission we have four lines of business:¬†

  • Training: digital and scientific content that gets all employees engaged by giving them skills and tools
  • Consulting: having an impact at the local level through concrete adaptation actions
  • Insurance and financing: securing those who adapt and have an impact

column15:
Vos challenges

Rattach√© √† notre branche conseil, vous ferez partie d'une √©quipe de consultants hybrides (conseil aux entreprises & data) dont la vocation est d'accompagner les organisations (TPE/PME/ETI) sur des enjeux de transformation ax√©s principalement dans la r√©flexion et l'impl√©mentation de dashboards/reportings via l'outil Power BI.

Le Procurement Data Owner occupe un r√¥le strat√©gique au sein de l'entreprise en tant que sp√©cialiste des fonctionnalit√©s et des processus li√©s aux solutions achats. En tant que Key User, il est le point de r√©f√©rence pour les utilisateurs et les parties prenantes internes en ce qui concerne leur utilisation optimale. Sous la responsabilit√© du Directeur Excellence Achat groupe, il/elle assurera en propre les activit√©s li√©es √† l‚Äôoptimisation de l‚Äôoutils S2C achats groupe et √† l‚Äôutilisation de la donn√©e pour la Direction Achats Groupe et l‚Äôensemble des 54 BU Veolia dans le monde (Ivalua principalement ainsi que d‚Äôautres outils achat sp√©cifiques).¬†

Description du poste

¬†

1¬∞) Gestionnaire de donn√©es achat / Procurement Data Owner :

¬†

Le groupe Veolia a mis r√©cemment en place un Master Data Hub Groupe qui recense tous les axes d‚Äôanalyse qui constituent le cadre commun de pilotage de notre Groupe avec la liste de valeurs associ√©es. Ce socle commun permet de partager une vision commune et consolid√©e de nos indicateurs financiers et op√©rationnels. Il doit √™tre connu de tous, et mis en ≈ìuvre localement par toutes les fonctions, les activit√©s et les g√©ographies.

Le gestionnaire de donn√©es achat groupe devra :

  • Identifier et cartographier les donn√©es achats disponibles et/ou n√©cessaires √† la fonction achat (savings, d√©pense, contrats, fournisseurs, organisations‚Ä¶), √† la production des indicateurs de performance (KPIs) et √† la communication avec les autres fili√®res.
  • Proposer et d√©ployer en lien avec l‚ÄôIS&T une strat√©gie ‚Äúdata‚Äù, de collecte, stockage et gestion de la donn√©e √† l‚Äô√©chelle du groupe, en particulier li√© √† la collecte et gestion de la d√©pense achat. Participer au cadrage de l‚Äôarchitecture des donn√©es pour les achats.
  • Organiser et piloter la collecte des donn√©es aupr√®s des BUs, v√©rifier la coh√©rence et leur bonne int√©gration.
  • D√©finir pour chaque jeu de donn√©es le formalisme applicable √† chaque champs de donn√©e.
  • V√©rifier que l‚Äôutilisation des bases des donn√©es est bien homog√®ne aux diff√©rents lieux d‚Äôutilisation.
  • Assurer la qualit√©, le formalisme et l'int√©grit√© des donn√©es dans les outils et les sites de stockage.¬†
  • √ätre en lien avec l‚ÄôIS&T pour formaliser les besoins li√©s √† la strat√©gie, formaliser les objets fonctionnels et autres attributs.
  • Identifier et cartographier les donn√©es disponibles dans le Master Data Hub pour leur utilisation dans la sph√®re achat.
  • Identifier les synergies et les passerelles entre les BUs pour un meilleur partage de la collecte et du stockage des donn√©es.

Le gestionnaire des donn√©es achat devra aussi assurer le lien avec les √©quipes m√©tiers et IT pour d√©finir et coordonner la mise en production des outils graphiques pour la visualisation des KPIs et donn√©es m√©tiers (dashboard).

2¬∞)¬†Expert fonctionnel de la suite achat groupe (S2C-SRM) / Key User S2C global procurement tool :

Veolia ma√Ætrise une partie de la cha√Æne S2C avec l‚Äôoutil Ivalua (SAVE) √† travers certains modules d√©ploy√©s : Suppliers, Contrats, Action Plans, eSourcing, Spend Analysis, Reporting, Contract Search. +600 utilisateurs.¬†¬†

L‚Äôexpert fonctionnel doit :¬†

  • Analyse des usages m√©tiers (volumes, transactions, qualit√©, satisfaction-RETEX‚Ä¶), param√©trage m√©tier :¬† workflow, hi√©rarchie organisationnelle, classification, contrats, etc.
  • Former et sensibiliser : Organiser des sessions de formation pour les nouveaux utilisateurs et les √©quipes impliqu√©es dans les processus achats. Sensibiliser les collaborateurs aux avantages et aux bonnes pratiques des outils. Conduire le changement pour d√©ployer les outils et am√©liorer leur usage (taux d'usage et qualit√© d'usage).
  • Animer un r√©seau de correspondants, contr√¥ler / faire √©voluer / formaliser les profils utilisateurs et d√©finir / formaliser les processus de cr√©ation et revues de profils.
  • Personnalisation et configuration: Animer √† travers un r√©seau de correspondants (construction et mise √† jour du r√©seau) l‚Äô√©volution de l‚Äôoutil (recensement des demandes, accompagnement √† la formalisation du besoin, priorisation et s√©lection des projets √† lancer (avec un comit√© de validation √† d√©finir), transmission des besoins √† l‚ÄôIS&T (en charge du pilotage des √©volutions), tester et valider les √©volutions avant mise en production).
  • Collaborer avec les √©quipes IS&T (technique) et achats (fonctionnel) pour personnaliser la solution Ivalua en fonction des besoins sp√©cifiques de l'entreprise.
  • En focalisant sur les besoins m√©tiers achat, ma√Ætriser les fonctionnalit√©s et les capacit√©s de la solution Ivalua. Assurer une veille r√©guli√®re sur les √©volutions du logiciel et les bonnes pratiques du domaine.

3¬∞) Autres missions

  • Coordination avec les √©quipes : Collaborer avec les √©quipes internes, telles que les Achats, la Finance, et les Op√©rations pour aligner les processus m√©tier avec les fonctionnalit√©s outils.
  • Participation aux projets : Participer activement aux projets de mise √† jour, d'√©volution et de d√©ploiement des outils au sein de l'entreprise.
Informations suppl√©mentaires

Nous vous proposons de rejoindre une entreprise dont l‚Äôobjectif est de devenir le leader de la transformation √©cologique !

Ce que nous vous proposons :

  • Faire partie d‚Äôun collectif qui se pr√©occupera de votre future carri√®re et de votre d√©veloppement
  • Des opportunit√©s d‚Äô√©volution au sein du Si√®ge de Veolia et plus largement au sein du Groupe Veolia, en France et √† l‚Äôinternational
  • Possibilit√© de faire partie de projets enrichissants en dehors de votre travail quotidien

Mais aussi :

  • 100% de l‚Äôabonnement aux transports urbains rembours√©s

  • RIE et tickets restaurants pour les jours t√©l√©travaill√©s

Chez Veolia Environnement SA, nous savons que certain-e-s candidat-e-s ne postulent que s‚Äôils pensent avoir coch√© toutes les cases. Mais nous pr√©f√©rons de loin voir votre candidature plut√¥t que de risquer de passer √† c√¥t√© de votre potentiel !

column36: Environment / Sustainable Development, Public and Local Agencies, Building / Public Works, Energy
column38:
• Would you like to give meaning to your professional activity?
  • Do you feel the need to be useful?
  • Would you like to help the planet and work towards a better and more sustainable future?
  • Do you have a ‚ÄúResourcer‚Äù spirit?

‚Ä¶. At Veolia, 84% of employees and 92% of managers feel invested in their job*. Teams find meaning and purpose in their work in the water, energy or waste management.

At Veolia, we recruit several hundred young graduates every year, from engineering or business schools and universities. They join us for either an internship, a work-study contract or their first job. We also offer them V.I.E. contracts (international voluntary programs in companies) through our dedicated Pangeo program.

Through our Campus network, we also take on trainees, supporting them from CAP-level (certificate of professional aptitude) to a master‚Äôs degree.

At Veolia, our 178,894 employees share a mission: resourcing the world. This is why we call them ‚ÄúResourcers‚Äù.

We all work together towards Veolia‚Äôs ambition: to be the benchmark company for ecological transformation.

Operating in 51 countries on five continents, with more than 178,894 employees, Veolia designs and implements solutions that contribute to sustainable development in cities and industries, in the fields of water, waste and energy management. Specialized in environmental services, Veolia is committed every day, on every continent, to improving access to resources, while preserving and replenish them.

The Group ensures that international laws and treaties guaranteeing the human and social rights of all people are strictly observed, both within the company and by its stakeholders. These values and rules of conduct take the cultural diversity of the Group into account.

In 2020, Veolia supplied 95 million people with drinking water and 62 million people with wastewater services, produced almost 43 million megawatt hours of energy and recovered 47 million metric tons of waste.

column15:
Are you looking to have an impact on the daily life of millions of entrepreneurs in France and Europe?

Do you thrive in a trustful, fast-paced environment?

Do you feel like our Engineering principles are aligned with your vision?

Then Pennylane might be the right place for you ‚Äî¬†and you, might be the perfect fit for this role üôÇ

Our vision

We aim to become the most beloved financial Operating System of European SMEs.

We help business owners get rid of the time consuming hassle of handling accounting and finance, while giving them access to key information that they can use to make better decisions.

Meanwhile, we‚Äôre helping accountants. By using Pennylane, rather than doing manual and repetitive tasks, they can spend more time advising and guiding their clients.

About us

Pennylane is one of the fastest growing Fintechs in France (and soon to be in Europe!)

In 4 years of existence, we‚Äôve managed to:

üíª Make ourselves known as a groundbreaking accounting and financial software for small businesses and their accountants

üí∞ Raise a total of ‚Ç¨84 millions, including from Sequoia üå≤, the famous fund from the Silicon Valley who invested early in companies like Google, Facebook, Airbnb, Stripe, Paypal and much more...

üë®‚Äçüë©‚Äçüëß‚Äçüë¶ Grow from 7 cofounders to 350+ happy Pennylaners: we‚Äôre now recognized as one of the greatest places to work in France (but also remotely), with a 5/5 rating on Glassdoor and an e-NPS of 94

üåç Build an international environment with more than 30 nationalities, with a strong remote-friendly culture, where 40% of the employees are already working from all parts of Europe

ü§ù Earn the trust of thousands of customers and accounting firms and obtain outstanding ratings

WHY this position is of utmost importance to reach our mission

At Pennylane, every decision that is not backed by data is likely to be challenged (when data is available of course). This culture is embraced by the leadership team, and actively promoted everywhere. The role of the data team is to make this possible by treating data like a production asset, making it available company-wide, and using it proactively to improve Pennylane‚Äôs user experience.

By joining us as a Senior Data Analyst, you will have a pivotal role in large projects, bringing your business sense and analytical thinking to help us meet our high delivery standards.

HOW you will contribute to the company

As a Senior Data Analyst, you will be part of the Science & Analytics team (7+ people), inside the Data department (18+ people).

- You will proactively use data to identify opportunities to grow our business or improve our processes.

- You will be a real sparring partner for Product & Operation leaders, feed their strategy by anticipating the most important product and business questions, and leverage your data & statistical skills to answer them.

- You will drive our self-service approach to analytics, by understanding our colleague‚Äôs needs in their use of data, and promoting a data driven culture. The Science & Analytics team is also fully in charge of creating data models in the Data Warehouse (using dbt).

- You will contribute to shaping the Data Engineering roadmap to deliver the best experience for your colleagues on the data platform.

WHAT you can expect from your life at Pennylane

Within one month:

- You will learn everything about our company, our teams, and our vision during the first onboarding week.

- You will get familiar with our stack, and have delivered a few small projects which will give you a concrete taste of our tools & processes.

- You will be given time to meet your future stakeholders, and gain a deep knowledge of our product and operations.

Within 3 months:

- You will be fully in charge of supporting some area of the business (product or operations), prioritizing your tasks with decision makers from this area.

- You will be confortable with our technical stack (Python, Redshift, dbt, PySpark).

- You will contribute to larger cross-company projects.

Within 6 months:

- You will proactively contribute to the team‚Äôs roadmap.

- You will work with engineers and data practitioners on improving our stack and data platform.

- You will share your learnings and best practices within the team.

And beyond: the data team will continue growing with the company

Which means:

- Opportunities to recruit and mentor new team members,

- Increased accountability in project leadership,

- Responsibilities to design and implement new processes, tools and best practices to make sure that your team works even more efficiently.

What do we do to make your work life easier

üè¢ You'll be able to work remotely from anywhere in Europe, as long as your contract allows you to, however, we would prefer for you to be based in Paris most of the time, as this is a Hybrid role.

üíµ You‚Äôll have a compensation package

üìà You'll get company shares to enjoy a piece of the success story you're building with us

üè° You‚Äôll have a budget to turn your home into a more comfortable workspace, as well as a monthly allowance to work from a coworking space whenever you feel like it

‚õπÔ∏èThrough our partner Gymlib, you‚Äôll have access to 8000 fitness spaces in Europe and more than 300 activities related to wellness

üá¨üáß You‚Äôll have access to Busuu to perfect your english or your french

üíª You‚Äôll get the latest Apple equipment

üéâ You‚Äôll be part of a vibrant social community : we do lots of sports together (Foot, running, climbing...), we love to hang out and have a drink together (thursday afterwork drinks on our rooftop is a usual thing. Twice-a-year we do company seminars, last time we went on a trip to the French Alps and it was fabulous !)

And.. If you're based in France :

üè¢ You‚Äôll be able to work fully from your home or any co-working space in France, or from our wonderful office in the center of Paris

üèùYou‚Äôll get 10 additional days off (to the 25 standard ones) to rest and do what you love each year

üçú You‚Äôll have lunch credits (Swile card) to buy your favorite food every day

üè• You‚Äôll have a great healthcare cover (Alan Blue) to take care of yourself and your family

We're working on providing those last advantages to our people based outside of France as well, but it can be quite more complex depending on different countries.

What does the recruitment process look like?

- A first interview with R√©mi, Tech Recruiter (30 min)

- A case study interview to discuss a topic closely related to one of our priorities (75 min)

- A past project interview to hear about your experience (60 min)

- An interview with our Tech & Product leaders to discuss our company culture (30 mn)

Who are we looking for ?

You may have noticed that there was no section listing the skills or qualities required to apply for this specific job. Researches have shown that some people are less likely to apply than others, if they don‚Äôt feel like they meet the full list of criteria. So we have decided to take it down entirely.

We have tried to give you as much details as we could about the purpose, missions and environment of this role; it is now up to you to tell us if you think this is a position in which you could a) have fun and b) bring value to our company.

If you‚Äôre hesitating, we encourage you to apply anyway: worst case scenario, you might lose a few minutes, and in the best case, it will be the start of a meaningful and long-lasting collaboration.

We also want to emphasize that we fully embrace diversity and that we‚Äôre doing our best to create a safe and inclusive environment. We are committed to providing an equal employment opportunity regardless of gender, sexual orientation, origin, disabilities, or any other traits that make you who you are. If anything, diversity makes us a more fun place to work at.

To end with a humble illustration of our commitment, we‚Äôve recently signed the Pacte Parit√© to set concrete goals in building a better and more inclusive workplace in the years to come.

#LI-Remote

#LI-AG1

column38:
Pennylane‚Äôs mission is to enable business owners to make the right financial decisions and accountants to focus on their advisory role.

What does it mean? Pennylane provides a platform that allows business owners and their accountants to collaborate efficiently and grow their businesses.

With Pennylane, executives make better decisions and simplify their financial management. Without leaving the platform, they can access all of their reliable, up-to-date, actionable data; pay for purchases; and manage their invoicing. Accountants can focus on their advisory role by saving time on data entry and retrieval of documents, thanks to Pennylane‚Äôs numerous automations.

Launched in 2020, Pennylane team has already achieved great things : üöÄüíö

  • Thousands of SMEs
  • Recognized as one of the hottest startup in Paris in 2021 The Wired.
  • ‚Ç¨84 millions raised so far though Partech, Sequoia investors, Global - Founders Capital and Kima Ventures
  • Hundreds of French accounting firms use Pennylane every day
  • And 220+ Pennylaners from 15 different countries building the best platform for european SMEs and their accountants

Our Values :

  • SUPPORTING SMES : We solve real issues for real people and never lose touch with the reality of our users

  • COMMUNITY OF BUILDERS : We focus on impact and take pride in being a hands-on team.

  • RADICAL TRUST : At Pennylane, trust is not earned, it‚Äôs given.

    Ces expertises sont notamment r√©unies au sein du Sustainability Lab EY, v√©ritable laboratoire d‚Äôinnovation.
