column15:
Tech and Digital Consulting Company, VO2 Group is an independent international enterprise that unleashes the transformative power of technologies to propel major brands into an era of endless possibilities.

As the leading independent French group, established on equal terms, we operate from Paris, Lille, Montreal, Toronto, Shanghai, Casablanca, Jerusalem, and New York with over 700 consultants¬† ¬†¬†

As a global player in customer experience, we engage in everything from business and digital strategy, IT, and data to the design of web and mobile products, as well as the creation of tailor-made digital experiences.

We are the Growth Champion according to LES ECHOS for ESNs in 2023.

We have won the ESG WeImpact Happy at Work 2023 award.

VO2 GROUP, The Bright Side Of Tech.

Job Responsibilities

As a Data Analysis Dataiku Consultant within our data-specialized team your responsibilities will include:

Collaborating with clients to understand their business objectives and data analysis requirements.

Designing and developing data pipelines and workflows in Dataiku to ingest, transform, and prepare data for analysis.

Conducting exploratory data analysis to identify patterns, trends, and anomalies in the data.

Building and deploying machine learning models using Dataiku's automated machine learning capabilities.

Developing and maintaining Dataiku dashboards and visualizations to present data insights to stakeholders.

Integrating external data sources and APIs into Dataiku projects for comprehensive analysis.

Providing technical support and guidance to clients on Dataiku-related issues and best practices.

Collaborating with data engineers and other team members to optimize Dataiku workflows and processes.

Staying updated on industry trends and advancements in data analysis and machine learning techniques.

Contributing to the development and improvement of data analysis methodologies and tools within the company.

Profile Desired

We are seeking a candidate with the following qualifications and attributes:

Strong proficiency in Dataiku, including data preparation, modeling, and deployment functionalities.

Experience in data analysis, machine learning, and statistical analysis techniques.

Knowledge of programming languages such as Python or R for data manipulation and analysis.

Familiarity with SQL for querying and manipulating databases.

Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

Strong communication skills, with the ability to effectively convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively within a team environment.

A proactive approach to learning and staying updated on new technologies and methodologies in the data analysis field.

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, or a related field. A master's degree is preferred but not required.

Relevant certifications in Dataiku or related data analysis tools would be advantageous.

column15:
Tech and Digital Consulting Company, VO2 Group is an independent international enterprise that unleashes the transformative power of technologies to propel major brands into an era of endless possibilities.

As the leading independent French group, established on equal terms, we operate from Paris, Lille, Montreal, Toronto, Shanghai, Casablanca, Jerusalem, and New York with over 700 consultants¬† ¬†¬†

As a global player in customer experience, we engage in everything from business and digital strategy, IT, and data to the design of web and mobile products, as well as the creation of tailor-made digital experiences.

We are the Growth Champion according to LES ECHOS for ESNs in 2023.

We have won the ESG WeImpact Happy at Work 2023 award.

VO2 GROUP, The Bright Side Of Tech.

Job Responsibilities

As a Data Project Manager Consultant within our data-specialized team, your responsibilities will include:

Leading end-to-end data projects from initiation to completion, ensuring deliverables are met on time and within budget.

Collaborating with clients to define project scope, objectives, and requirements, and managing stakeholder expectations throughout the project lifecycle.

Developing project plans, timelines, and resource allocations, and effectively communicating project status updates to all stakeholders.

Managing project risks and issues, and implementing mitigation strategies to minimize project disruptions.

Overseeing data project teams, including data engineers, data analysts, and other stakeholders, and facilitating collaboration and knowledge sharing among team members.

Ensuring adherence to project management best practices and methodologies, and driving continuous improvement initiatives to optimize project delivery processes.

Conducting quality assurance reviews and assessments to ensure project deliverables meet quality standards and client expectations.

Providing technical expertise and guidance on data-related issues and challenges, and facilitating resolution of technical issues as needed.

Experience in managing TMA (Third-Party Maintenance Agreement) projects, ensuring SLA compliance and effective resolution of incidents and service requests.

Staying updated on industry trends and advancements in data management and project management methodologies.

Profile Desired

We are looking for a candidate with the following qualifications and attributes:

Proven experience in project management, preferably in data-related projects.

Strong leadership and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively lead and motivate project teams.

Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to interact with clients and internal stakeholders at all levels.

Solid understanding of project management methodologies, such as Agile, Scrum, or Waterfall, and experience in applying them to deliver successful projects.

Experience in managing Third-Party Maintenance Agreement (TMA) projects, ensuring SLA compliance and effective resolution of incidents and service requests.

Strong problem-solving and decision-making abilities, with a proactive approach to identifying and addressing project risks and issues.

Ability to work under pressure and manage multiple priorities simultaneously, while maintaining attention to detail and quality.

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Administration, or a related field. A Project Management Professional (PMP) certification is a plus.

Experience in the data industry or familiarity with data management concepts and technologies is preferred but not required.

Flexibility to adapt to changing project requirements and business needs, and a willingness to learn and grow in a dynamic environment.
column38:
VO2 Group is a global Tech & digital consulting Company.

We harness the power of technologies to propel iconic brands and industry leaders into an era of endless possibilities.

Our clients are international brands in retail, luxury, banking, insurance and industry ‚Ä¶ We work with half of the CAC40 (in particular LVMH, Clarins, Chanel, Renault, Orange, BNP ‚Ä¶ ) and startups like Mirakl.

We are : GPTW, Happy At Work, 1st on impact ESG rewarded by Choose My Company, Growth Champion - Les Echos, and we received the Syntec / KPMG customer relationship award. Our ambition is to become the leading independent French technology group.

We are The Bright Side Of Tech.

column15:
At Sorare, we bet on passionate and innovative people! Are you looking for an empowering environment to grow professionally and personally? Join us in this tremendous adventure!

Our Mission

Sorare is a fantasy sports gaming experience and marketplace featuring officially licensed digital player cards. With Sorare you build legacy teams ‚Äì¬† buying, selling, collecting and trading player cards -- and compete with them in free-to-play fantasy games to win rewards week over week and season over season, just like a professional sports owner.

Sorare is revolutionizing digital sports fandom, and now has over 3,5 million users across 180 countries. More than 300 iconic teams, clubs, and organizations including the Premier League, La Liga, Bundesliga, Serie A, MLS, NBA, NBPA, MLB, MLBPA, and many others have partnered with Sorare to build the next sports entertainment giant.

Our Journey

Sorare was founded by Nicolas Julia and Adrien Montfort in 2018 in Paris to bring sports fans across the globe closer to the players, teams, and leagues they love.

With 130-plus employees across France and US, Sorare is one of Europe‚Äôs fastest-growing startups and recently raised a $680 million Series B funding round from world-class investors including SoftBank, Accel, and Benchmark. Sorare also has athletes Serena Williams, Zinedine Zidane, Rio Ferdinand, Antoine Griezmann, Gerard Piqu√©, Blake Griffin, and Rudy Gobert among its investors, ambassadors, and advisors.

Our Values

  • Own your game: Think and act like an owner, and expect your teammates to do the same. You are an ‚Äúentrepreneur‚Äù empowered to make decisions and own the outcomes.

  • Build with the fans, and for the fans: Have an obsession for high-quality user experiences. Engage our community with transparency to build trust and learn from the fans to deliver effective changes.

  • Run fast: Take bold risks and outpace the competition in an ever changing environment. Have a bias for action (connected to team goals) and strive to ship and iterate.

  • Have fun and bring joy: Sports have the power to unite people around the world, and as fans ourselves, we believe it is a privilege to work in this industry.

  • Win as a team: We are all in this together as one team, win or lose. Inspire your teammates to always be better.

As a Product Data Analyst within our Analytics org at Sorare, you will play a pivotal role in supporting our product teams through in-depth analysis, reporting, metric design, and testing and experimentation. You will work closely with cross-functional product teams to derive actionable insights from data, enabling data-driven decision-making to enhance user experience and drive business growth.

As a Product Data Analyst at Sorare, you will :

  • Conduct thorough analysis of user behavior, engagement, and performance metrics.

  • Generate regular reports and dashboards to communicate key insights to product teams.

  • Collaborate with product teams to define and implement relevant KPIs

  • Design and analyze A/B tests and experiments to optimize product features and user flows.

  • Provide recommendations based on experiment results to drive product improvements.

  • Work closely with product managers, engineers, and UX/UI designers to align data insights with product development goals. You will need to communicate findings in a clear and accessible manner to non-technical stakeholders.

  • Collaborate with the data engineering team to optimize data infrastructure.

The ideal candidate:

  • 4+ years of data analysis experience in a product-focused environment

  • BA/BS in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or related discipline.

  • Strong proficiency in data analysis tools and languages (e.g., SQL, Python).

  • Experience with A/B test design, implementation, and measurement

  • Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau) is a plus.

  • Excellent spoken and written communication skills and the ability to convey complex findings in a clear and understandable way.

  • You are a team player who collaborates with empathy and respect

  • You have an entrepreneurial spirit, demonstrating a proactive approach to problem-solving and decision-making.

The position is located in Paris, France¬†

If you‚Äôre passionate about technology, enjoy problem-solving, and thrive in a dynamic environment, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity!

Perks:¬†

  • Health Care: Great medical, dental, and vision insurance coverage fully covered by Sorare

  • Wellness Benefit: Sorare contributes to employees wellness (gym membership and sports classes in our office)

  • Commuter Benefits: Sorare contributes to the cost of your commute with 100% of Navigo pass reimbursed¬†

  • Latest Tech: Sorare provides equipment such as laptop, monitor, etc.

  • Lunch: Sorare will contribute to their employees lunch vouchers¬†

  • Time Off: we offer 5 weeks of paid holidays per year in addition to the national holidays and attached RTT.

Our Hiring Process

  • Step 1: Recruiter Screen (30 min)

  • Step 2: Hiring Manager Screen

  • Step 3: Case Study + Panel interviews

  • Step 4: Reference Check & Offer

Sorare is an equal opportunity employer committed to an inclusive and diverse workplace. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to: race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

As we are an international company, please note we speak English in the workplace. Please apply for the role with an English CV so we can process your application.

column38:
Sorare is at the intersection of sports, gaming and NFTs. Through tradable digital cards, Sorare is designing a collective fantasy sport experience where you can manage your favorite Football, Baseball and Basketball players, hone your passion to earn prizes and be part of a community. Anyone, anywhere, can connect with the game on Sorare. The company‚Äôs mission is to build ‚Äúthe game within the game‚Äù and to give fans, players and clubs the platform to celebrate, share and own the game.

Founded in 2018, Sorare has seen tremendous growth. The platform had a card sales volume of over $300M (‚Ç¨270M) since January 2021 across 160 countries. Sorare is backed by a world-class team of investors including Softbank, Benchmark, Accel Partners, footballers such as Gerard Piqu√©, Antoine Griezmann and Rio Ferdinand, and key tech investors such as Alexis Ohanian.

column13: Global Data & Tech Lead | WAVEMAKER F/H
column15:
Data & Technology ‚Äì Global Data & Tech Lead

About Wavemaker

We believe there always is a better way to grow. We positively provoke growth for our clients by reshaping consumer decision-making and experiences through media, content and technology. The Wavemaker way is globally consistent. Fueled by the world‚Äôs most powerful consumer data, we understand where and how marketing can intervene decisively to help brands win more sales.

Our name is our mission and our method. To make waves, you need to be provocative, even fearless. We do our best work for brave brands and people who want to be challenged to go further and faster. We know it‚Äôs not easy, but if it‚Äôs in you, we will get it out of you.

Our 7,600 people across 90 markets provoke growth for some of the world‚Äôs leading brands and businesses. Our attitude of Positive Provocation is enabled by:

  • deep knowledge we have of our clients‚Äô business
  • confidence to challenge what‚Äôs gone before
  • the support to go further than we thought possible

We are a part of GroupM, WPP‚Äôs global media investment management company. Discover more on wavemakerglobal.com, Twitter and LinkedIn

Role Purpose:

The purpose of this role is to provide advanced thought-leadership and help drive a strategic vision across our top Agency clients in the realm of data and technology. The Global Data & Tech Lead will have a consultative role across clients to help set 1st, 2nd, 3rd party data strategies, drive and implement technology solutions across media planning, reporting, and optimizing.

The Global Data & Tech Lead will have a sophisticated understanding of both internal and external providers and tools in order to offer consultative advice, roadmaps and solutions.

Working directly with the General Manager and Global Client Leads, this role is responsible for driving our Data & Technology vision across clients, demonstrating best-in-class thought leadership and advancing WPP products and solutions.

Key accountabilities:

  • Work with Agency Leadership to set strategic vision and roadmaps across top clients regarding data, technology, and analytics
  • Partner with Client Leads to drive data strategy, technology solutions, and WPP growth opportunities across top clients
  • Be seen as an expert and leader with top clients to help inform and consult on data and technology solutions (media planning, data-driving marketing strategies, media reporting, analytics, data automatization etc. )
  • Leverage and understand the WPP network‚Äôs solutions and offerings in order to provide best-in-class service and strategies to clients
  • Drive internal stakeholders and product leads to ensure that that our client needs are being met
  • Inspire and lead, fostering a culture of collaboration and innovation to deliver best-in-class data and technology solutions to clients
  • Stay abreast of emerging trends and technologies, evaluating their potential impact and opportunity, and make recommendations for adoption.
  • Strong knowledge and expertise on European Privacy Regulations and their implications on data driven marketing solutions

Key experiences:

  • Broad technical expertise that will inspire and encourage creative, collaborative problem solving.
  • Demonstrated experience in managing senior level clients across media, data, and technology roles
  • Able to navigate seamlessly between setting a strategy and executing/implementing.
  • Strong interpersonal, presentation and negotiating skills.
  • Ability to quickly establish rapport and credibility at all levels including the VP and C-level
  • Ability to understand cultural nuances and adapts own style to fit. Respects differences in culture, approach and skillset
  • Fluent in French and English (written and spoken)
  • Minimum of 10 years of experience in data and technology management

column15:
We‚Äôre one of the world's leading carsharing platform, with millions of users around the world, sharing thousands of cars in over 950 cities across 8 countries.

Our mission is simple: Make our cities better places to live through carsharing.

Carsharing empowers people to move in a smarter and more sustainable way: studies show that one shared car replaces between 4 and 10 privately owned cars, which frees up space in our cities while giving communities 24/7 access to cars when they need them.

With our connected car technology, users can quickly and easily book and unlock a wide variety of vehicles directly from our app, without ever having to meet anyone in person, carry an access card, wait in line, or coordinate picking up keys.

To reach our vision of a world where all cars are shared, we need a strong team to help us disrupt car ownership. We look for people who are curious, positive, and engaged; who can adapt and learn quickly; who have the skills and smarts to reach their goals autonomously, while having the generosity and mindset to work collaboratively. No matter your role, background, or level of experience, we believe that every member of the team can have an impact.

We‚Äôre extremely proud to be certified in the ‚ÄúBest Workplaces‚Äù in 2023 !

The opportunity:

  • You'll belong to an international data team composed of 20 members, and will report to Isaure, our Head of Data Analytics for Demand & Marketing.
  • You‚Äôll be a key member of our Demand tribe (focusing on our drivers), partnering closely with pricing, growth and product managers to steer the demand side of our business. You‚Äôll take part in understanding the dynamics in our marketplace to actively contribute to its optimization.¬†
  • As a data analyst, you‚Äôll help build a comprehensive view of our users‚Äô experience to understand the current challenges and solve complex problems through data. Your analyses will fuel the Demand team with data-backed insights that can have a direct impact on our users and market. You‚Äôll also be in charge of designing and maintaining data tools to support and empower multiple stakeholders across the company.
  • We invite you to listen to our VP of Data & BI‚Äôs podcast with DataGen to better understand how our data organization works.

    • What you'll do:

  • You'll work on cross-functional analytics initiatives end to end:
  • Collaborate with engineers to make sure we structure, collect and process data in an accurate and timely manner.¬†You'll own your processing pipelines (SQL) and be responsible for tests and documentation.
  • Conduct exploratory analysis: partner with relevant stakeholders to frame the business problem, deep dive into data to uncover insights, and discuss how to action themShare your recommendations to cross-functional stakeholders, using meaningful reports and visualizations.
  • Design KPIs and monitor their performance towards our objectives.
  • Empower the team by building ground truth data sets and evangelizing data tools to your stakeholders.

    • Example of projects you will work on :

  • Be the analyst for strategic initiatives : monitor the performance of new business lines¬†Provide advanced monitoring and data tools to support our revenue optimization business teams.
  • Help shape the roadmap to evolve our pricing algorithms through exploratory data analysis, data modeling and backtesting.
  • Build tracking specifications and features monitoring plans to monitor the performance of our Product releases.

    • Our stack:

  • Snowflake data warehouse, ELT managed with Airflow and dbt, our own Segment-like integrations, BI/visualization tools such as Tableau and Metabase, Python notebooks in Hex.

    • What you'll bring:

  • 3 to 5 years experience in Data/BI roles in a tech environment.
  • Background in quantitative fields eg Maths, Statistics, Engineering or Business with very strong analytical skills and a willingness to learn more technical skills.
  • A strong interest in product: you think about possible product improvements in your day-to-day interactions with any app
  • Strong ability to turn complex data into actionable insights in a fast-paced environment
  • Strong experience with writing SQL queries, joining large datasets from multiple sources.
  • Experience with Python or other data-oriented programming languages is a strong plus.
  • Attention to detail: you like to understand the fine technicalities of things, and build reliable and resilient data models.
  • Communication: you‚Äôre excellent at summarizing any problem and explaining the big picture, both in written and verbal form. You share information proactively.
  • Fluency in English: you can work in English on a daily basis.

    • Would be a strong plus:

  • A prior experience with marketplaces or marketing analytics.
  • Environmental awareness/interest in mobility: interest in car ownership environmental impact and/or mobility is a strong plus.

    • üëâ If your profile doesn't check all of the above yet, you can still apply, and we‚Äôll let you know if we think this position can be a good fit for you

    Why join us:

  • üåé Getaround Europe is a fast-growing startup located in the center of Paris, with global headquarters in San Francisco and an office in Oslo. We offer one of the most dynamic and diverse company cultures in town, and give every employee the opportunity to grow and the power to define their impact at Getaround.
  • üå± The opportunity to have a positive impact on climate change. Cars are responsible for 17% of carbon emissions. In France, an independent study has shown that each connected car shared on Getaround replaces more than 5 self-owned cars.
  • üß† A place to learn and grow with weekly 1 on 1 meetings with your manager, frequent 360¬∞ feedback from your teammates, personal objectives to develop your potential, optional annual training, plus a team wiki that you‚Äôll contribute to improve
  • üåê An international team and company: our product is live in the US, France, Norway, Germany, Spain, Belgium and Austria.
  • üè° A remote friendly policy: this position is based in our Paris office with up to 3 days of remote work per week.
  • üìù A monthly subsidy to cover part of your work-related expenses at home
  • ü§ù Getaround is committed to equal opportunity. We value and embrace diversity, equity and inclusion of all our Getarounders
  • üóì Unlimited 30% vouchers for your Getaround bookings
  • üí´ Health insurance
  • üçΩ A Swile lunch card
  • üíª Apple equipment

    • Come join us!
column38:
Getaround is the world‚Äôs leading carsharing platform with a community of over 5 million users sharing thousands of cars in over 300 cities in the United States and Europe.

The Getaround app allows city dwellers who don‚Äôt own a car to instantly reserve a vehicle, whether for a few hours or a few days, directly from their smartphone.

Founded in 2009, the startup has experienced very strong growth: it is now present in 8 countries and recently expanded into Europe with the acquisition of car-sharing startups Drivy and Nabobil.

The headquarters are in San Francisco and the team has offices in Paris, London, Berlin, Barcelona, and Oslo.

Getaround has been certified Great place to work in France and Norway, for the year 2022.

Introduction

Decathlon acc√©l√®re sa transformation digitale avec pour mission de devenir LA plateforme num√©rique sportive qui permettra aux clients de d√©couvrir notre univers √† travers de nombreuses exp√©riences locales centr√©es sur le sport.

Decathlon Digital, c‚Äôest aujourd‚Äôhui plus de 5000 profils techniques : software engineers, product managers, expert¬∑e¬∑s de la data, du Cloud et de la cybers√©curit√©, en France et √† l‚Äô√©tranger, implant√©es √† Paris, Lille, Nantes, Lyon, et Amsterdam.

Plus de 20 profils qui travaillent √† d√©livrer les meilleurs produits, analyses ou solutions novatrices pour d√©velopper le People Analytics chez Decathlon.

REJOINS L'√âQUIPE PEOPLE DATA DE DECATHLON

  • ‚Ä¶

Dans le cadre de l‚Äôouverture d‚Äôun poste en interne, nous recrutons un-e Data Analyst, bas√©-e, au choix √† Lille o√π √† Paris.

Vos responsabilit√©s

Au sein de l'√©quipe People Data, votre mission principale consiste √† :

  • Concevoir des frameworks d‚Äôanalyse scalable pour extraire du sens des insights de l‚Äô√©cosyst√®me RH de Decathlon.
  • Travailler avec les principaux acteurs comme les √©quipes m√©tiers, Products Managers et Data Managers pour qualifier leurs besoins et les traduire en probl√®me analytique.
  • Conduire des analyses pour am√©liorer notre compr√©hension et efficience des processus RH.
  • Identifier et quantifier des opportunit√©s pour d√©velopper de nouveaux business ou produits.
  • Transformer des probl√®mes business et produits en insights actionnables.
  • Mentorer les analystes juniors et contribuer √† l‚Äôam√©lioration continue de l‚Äô√©quipe.

Le p√©rim√®tre technique

  • Environnement AWS (S3, Athena...)
  • Databricks
  • Outils de dataviz : Tableau
  • Technos Back/ langages : Python, SQL, Spark / Scala, Airflow, DBT

Ce dont vous aurez besoin pour r√©ussir

  • Vous avez une exp√©rience d'au moins 4 ans en data analyse o√π vous avez d√©velopp√© vos comp√©tences en compr√©hension des enjeux business associ√©s √† vos analyses, en extraction de data, en code (SQL / Python) ainsi qu'en DataViz (Tableau ou un outil similaire). Une exp√©rience dans le domaine des RH est un plus.
  • Vous comprenez les enjeux business et adaptez vos analyses √† ces probl√©matiques avec efficience.
  • Vous maitrisez les m√©thodes statistiques de bases (analyses descriptives, ACP, classifications, √©chantillonnage, tests statistiques).
  • Vous aimez travailler dans un environnement agile et collaboratif (GIT, Normes de d√©veloppement, Code Review, Pair Programming).
  • Vous parlez couramment fran√ßais et √™tes √† l'aise avec l'anglais.
  • Capacit√©s de projection, bon esprit de synth√®se et communicant.e.
  • Vous √™tes particuli√®rement sensible √† l‚Äôimpact de la pratique du sport pour les valeurs qu'elle vous a permis d‚Äôacqu√©rir dans votre style de leadership et la vie en √©quipes !
  • Vous avez envie de rejoindre une entreprise √† impact positif (#Tech4Good).

Ce que nous offrons

  • Flexibilit√© dans l'organisation du travail (lieu, rythme)
  • Libert√© de choix de l'outil de travail (Mac, Windows)
  • √âquipe de projet locale et partage avec le r√©seau mondial (parcours international)
  • Mont√©e en comp√©tences (diversit√© des projets, des langues et des technologies)
  • Formations internes et externes
  • Actionnariat salari√©s
  • Primes mensuelles et trimestrielles

DECATHLON DIGITAL

Imaginez si la technologie nous permettait de repousser les fronti√®res et d'offrir des exp√©riences sportives in√©dites. C'est pr√©cis√©ment notre ambition chez Decathlon Digital ! Nous sommes une √©quipe de plus de 5 000 experts en ing√©nierie logicielle, gestion de produits, donn√©es, cloud et cybers√©curit√©, r√©partis √† Paris, Lille et Amsterdam. Ensemble, nous cr√©ons la plus vaste plateforme sportive num√©rique, en exploitant les innovations technologiques pour optimiser la cha√Æne de valeur, concevoir des exp√©riences connect√©es et donner une seconde vie √† nos produits.

Changeons la donne pour de bon. Notre passion du sport nous guide et nous voulons qu‚Äôelle perdure. C‚Äôest pourquoi nous nous engageons √† b√¢tir un mod√®le technologique plus durable, en r√©duisant notre impact direct sur l'environnement, et en cr√©ant un espace s√ªr et inclusif pour apprendre et nous √©panouir ensemble. Rejoins l‚Äô√©quipe et fa√ßonnons le futur du sport.

column15:
Introduction

Decathlon acc√©l√®re sa transformation digitale avec pour mission de devenir LA plateforme num√©rique sportive qui permettra aux clients de d√©couvrir notre univers √† travers de nombreuses exp√©riences locales centr√©es sur le sport.

Notre but est de cr√©er un √©cosyst√®me ouvert afin de connecter de nombreux acteurs et services tiers, de mani√®re s√ªre et performante.

Nos √©quipes digitales bas√©es √† Lille, Paris et Amsterdam regroupent plus de 1500 collaborateurs qui sont unis pour construire et faire grandir des produits num√©riques dans le but de toujours offrir la meilleure valeur √† nos utilisateurs.

Decathlon Digital

Et si la Tech nous permettait de r√©inventer le sport de demain et de devenir la plus grande plateforme num√©rique sportive ? c‚Äôest l‚Äôobjectif que nous nous fixons chez Decathlon.

‚ÄúTo Move People Through the Wonders of Sport‚Äù est notre mission. Une vocation qui atteint aujourd‚Äôhui son paroxysme en augmentant l‚Äôexp√©rience du sport par les technologies et r√©pondant aux besoins de nos 500 millions d‚Äôutilisateurs √† travers le monde.

Nous cr√©ons ainsi de nouvelles exp√©riences pour les sportives et sportifs ‚Äì coaching virtuel, programmes de fid√©lit√©, exp√©riences intelligentes en magasin, offres de produits neufs et d'occasion, mais aussi services de r√©paration et de location d'une large gamme de produits Decathlon et de partenaires.

Decathlon Digital, c‚Äôest aujourd‚Äôhui plus de 5000 profils techniques : software engineers, product managers, expert¬∑e¬∑s de la data, du Cloud et de la cybers√©curit√©, en France et √† l‚Äô√©tranger, implant√©es √† Paris, Lille, Nantes, Lyon, et Amsterdam.

L‚Äô√©quipe People Data au sein de Decathlon

Au c≈ìur de la r√©ussite de Decathlon se trouve notre engagement envers nos collaborateurs. Nous sommes convaincus que chaque collaborateur a le potentiel de s‚Äô√©panouir et de contribuer de mani√®re significative √† notre succ√®s collectif.

Le p√©rim√®tre People, au sein duquel s'inscrit notre √©quipe, est charg√© de veiller au d√©veloppement, au bien-√™tre et √† l'√©panouissement de nos talents. Notre mission est d'accompagner chacun de nos 100 000 collaborateurs dans son parcours professionnel, en lui offrant le soutien, les outils et les ressources n√©cessaires pour atteindre ses objectifs et d√©velopper son plein potentiel.

Dans ce contexte, l‚Äô√©quipe People Data joue un r√¥le essentiel dans la transformation et le d√©veloppement de notre entreprise. En lien √©troit avec les √©quipes RH, Engineering et Product, nous d√©finissons une strat√©gie commune port√©e par des objectifs et initiatives clairs et partag√©s.

Rejoindre l‚Äô√©quipe People Data, c‚Äôest int√©grer une √©quipe multi-comp√©tente de Data Product Managers, Data Analysts, BI engineers, Analytics Engineers, Data Engineers et d‚Äôexperts en Gouvernance de donn√©es. Plus de 20 profils qui travaillent √† d√©livrer les meilleurs produits, analyses ou solutions novatrices pour d√©velopper le People Analytics chez Decathlon.

REJOINS L'√âQUIPE PEOPLE DATA DE DECATHLON

En rejoignant l‚Äô√©quipe People Data vous serez int√©gr√©¬∑e dans une √©quipe data pluridisciplinaire et aurez l‚Äôoccasion de travailler sur l‚Äôensemble des processus RH :

  • Workforce management
  • Talent development
  • Compensation & benefits
  • Talent acquisition
  • Diversity, equity & inclusion
  • ‚Ä¶

Dans le cadre de l‚Äôouverture d‚Äôun poste en interne, nous recrutons un-e Data Analyst, bas√©-e, au choix √† Lille o√π √† Paris.

Vos responsabilit√©s

Au sein de l'√©quipe People Data, votre mission principale consiste √† :

  • Concevoir des frameworks d‚Äôanalyse scalable pour extraire du sens des insights de l‚Äô√©cosyst√®me RH de Decathlon.
  • Travailler avec les principaux acteurs comme les √©quipes m√©tiers, Products Managers et Data Managers pour qualifier leurs besoins et les traduire en probl√®me analytique.
  • Conduire des analyses pour am√©liorer notre compr√©hension et efficience des processus RH.
  • Identifier et quantifier des opportunit√©s pour d√©velopper de nouveaux business ou produits.
  • Transformer des probl√®mes business et produits en insights actionnables.
  • Mentorer les analystes juniors et contribuer √† l‚Äôam√©lioration continue de l‚Äô√©quipe.

Le p√©rim√®tre technique

  • Environnement AWS (S3, Athena...)
  • Databricks
  • Outils de dataviz : Tableau
  • Technos Back/ langages : Python, SQL, Spark / Scala, Airflow, DBT

Ce dont vous aurez besoin pour r√©ussir

  • Vous avez une exp√©rience d'au moins 4 ans en data analyse o√π vous avez d√©velopp√© vos comp√©tences en compr√©hension des enjeux business associ√©s √† vos analyses, en extraction de data, en code (SQL / Python) ainsi qu'en DataViz (Tableau ou un outil similaire). Une exp√©rience dans le domaine des RH est un plus.
  • Vous comprenez les enjeux business et adaptez vos analyses √† ces probl√©matiques avec efficience.
  • Vous maitrisez les m√©thodes statistiques de bases (analyses descriptives, ACP, classifications, √©chantillonnage, tests statistiques).
  • Vous aimez travailler dans un environnement agile et collaboratif (GIT, Normes de d√©veloppement, Code Review, Pair Programming).
  • Vous parlez couramment fran√ßais et √™tes √† l'aise avec l'anglais.
  • Capacit√©s de projection, bon esprit de synth√®se et communicant.e.
  • Vous √™tes particuli√®rement sensible √† l‚Äôimpact de la pratique du sport pour les valeurs qu'elle vous a permis d‚Äôacqu√©rir dans votre style de leadership et la vie en √©quipes !
  • Vous avez envie de rejoindre une entreprise √† impact positif (#Tech4Good).

Ce que nous offrons

  • Flexibilit√© dans l'organisation du travail (lieu, rythme)
  • Libert√© de choix de l'outil de travail (Mac, Windows)
  • √âquipe de projet locale et partage avec le r√©seau mondial (parcours international)
  • Mont√©e en comp√©tences (diversit√© des projets, des langues et des technologies)
  • Formations internes et externes
  • Actionnariat salari√©s
  • Primes mensuelles et trimestrielles

DECATHLON DIGITAL

Imaginez si la technologie nous permettait de repousser les fronti√®res et d'offrir des exp√©riences sportives in√©dites. C'est pr√©cis√©ment notre ambition chez Decathlon Digital ! Nous sommes une √©quipe de plus de 5 000 experts en ing√©nierie logicielle, gestion de produits, donn√©es, cloud et cybers√©curit√©, r√©partis √† Paris, Lille et Amsterdam. Ensemble, nous cr√©ons la plus vaste plateforme sportive num√©rique, en exploitant les innovations technologiques pour optimiser la cha√Æne de valeur, concevoir des exp√©riences connect√©es et donner une seconde vie √† nos produits.

Changeons la donne pour de bon. Notre passion du sport nous guide et nous voulons qu‚Äôelle perdure. C‚Äôest pourquoi nous nous engageons √† b√¢tir un mod√®le technologique plus durable, en r√©duisant notre impact direct sur l'environnement, et en cr√©ant un espace s√ªr et inclusif pour apprendre et nous √©panouir ensemble. Rejoins l‚Äô√©quipe et fa√ßonnons le futur du sport.

column15:
Introduction

Decathlon acc√©l√®re sa transformation digitale avec pour mission de devenir LA plateforme num√©rique sportive qui permettra aux clients de d√©couvrir notre univers √† travers de nombreuses exp√©riences locales centr√©es sur le sport.

Notre but est de cr√©er un √©cosyst√®me ouvert afin de connecter de nombreux acteurs et services tiers, de mani√®re s√ªre et performante.

Nos √©quipes digitales bas√©es √† Lille, Paris et Amsterdam regroupent plus de 1500 collaborateurs qui sont unis pour construire et faire grandir des produits num√©riques dans le but de toujours offrir la meilleure valeur √† nos utilisateurs.

Decathlon Digital

Et si la Tech nous permettait de r√©inventer le sport de demain et de devenir la plus grande plateforme num√©rique sportive ? c‚Äôest l‚Äôobjectif que nous nous fixons chez Decathlon.

‚ÄúTo Move People Through the Wonders of Sport‚Äù est notre mission. Une vocation qui atteint aujourd‚Äôhui son paroxysme en augmentant l‚Äôexp√©rience du sport par les technologies et r√©pondant aux besoins de nos 500 millions d‚Äôutilisateurs √† travers le monde.

Nous cr√©ons ainsi de nouvelles exp√©riences pour les sportives et sportifs ‚Äì coaching virtuel, programmes de fid√©lit√©, exp√©riences intelligentes en magasin, offres de produits neufs et d'occasion, mais aussi services de r√©paration et de location d'une large gamme de produits Decathlon et de partenaires.

Decathlon Digital, c‚Äôest aujourd‚Äôhui plus de 5000 profils techniques : software engineers, product managers, expert¬∑e¬∑s de la data, du Cloud et de la cybers√©curit√©, en France et √† l‚Äô√©tranger, implant√©es √† Paris, Lille, Nantes, Lyon, et Amsterdam.

L‚Äô√©quipe People Data au sein de Decathlon

Au c≈ìur de la r√©ussite de Decathlon se trouve notre engagement envers nos collaborateurs. Nous sommes convaincus que chaque collaborateur a le potentiel de s‚Äô√©panouir et de contribuer de mani√®re significative √† notre succ√®s collectif.

Le p√©rim√®tre People, au sein duquel s'inscrit notre √©quipe, est charg√© de veiller au d√©veloppement, au bien-√™tre et √† l'√©panouissement de nos talents. Notre mission est d'accompagner chacun de nos 100 000 collaborateurs dans son parcours professionnel, en lui offrant le soutien, les outils et les ressources n√©cessaires pour atteindre ses objectifs et d√©velopper son plein potentiel.

Dans ce contexte, l‚Äô√©quipe People Data joue un r√¥le essentiel dans la transformation et le d√©veloppement de notre entreprise. En lien √©troit avec les √©quipes RH, Engineering et Product, nous d√©finissons une strat√©gie commune port√©e par des objectifs et initiatives clairs et partag√©s.

Rejoindre l‚Äô√©quipe People Data, c‚Äôest int√©grer une √©quipe multi-comp√©tente de Data Product Managers, Data Analysts, BI engineers, Analytics Engineers, Data Engineers et d‚Äôexperts en Gouvernance de donn√©es. Plus de 20 profils qui travaillent √† d√©livrer les meilleurs produits, analyses ou solutions novatrices pour d√©velopper le People Analytics chez Decathlon.

REJOINS L'√âQUIPE PEOPLE DATA DE DECATHLON

En rejoignant l‚Äô√©quipe People Data vous serez int√©gr√©¬∑e dans une √©quipe data pluridisciplinaire et aurez l‚Äôoccasion de travailler sur l‚Äôensemble des processus RH :

  • Workforce management
  • Talent development
  • Compensation & benefits
  • Talent acquisition
  • Diversity, equity & inclusion
  • ‚Ä¶

Dans le cadre de l‚Äôouverture d‚Äôun poste en interne, nous recrutons un-e Data Product Manager, bas√©-e, au choix √† Lille o√π √† Paris.

Vos responsabilit√©s

En tant que Data Product Manager, vous aurez l‚Äôoccasion de :

  • Mener l'exploration continue et la product discovery en contact avec le m√©tier
  • Contribuer √† l‚Äô√©laboration de la roadmap et la planification de futures versions des produits avec une strat√©gie user-centric
  • Cr√©er l‚Äôensemble des cockpits m√©tiers et d√©finir leurs cycles de vie
  • Mener des travaux de recherche sur de nouveaux produits d‚Äôadvanced analytic, d‚Äôintelligence artificielle ou d‚Äôautres solutions novatrices
  • Ecrire la vision et la roadmap de tes produits et veiller au bon d√©veloppement de ceux-ci
  • D√©finir les KPIs sur lesquels s‚Äôanimer et estimer la cr√©ation de valeur
  • Cr√©er, maintenir, prioriser et communiquer sur le backlog produit
  • Responsabiliser l‚Äô√©quipe sur les r√©alisations: respect des principes structurants inh√©rents aux donn√©es de ton produit, prise en compte de la qualit√©
  • Comprendre l'architecture technique de votre produit

Le p√©rim√®tre technique

  • Environnement AWS (S3, Athena...)
  • Databricks
  • Outils de dataviz : Tableau
  • Technos Back/ langages : Python, SQL, Spark / Scala, Airflow, DBT

Ce dont vous aurez besoin pour r√©ussir

  • Vous avez d√©j√† plusieurs exp√©riences r√©ussies en tant que Product Manager sur des projets data ou digitaux.
  • Vous avez un √©tat d'esprit agile tourn√© vers l'am√©lioration continue et l'intelligence collective. Vous √™tes passionn√©-e de projet et aimez partager et contribuer.
  • Vous avez de bonnes capacit√©s de communication et de collaborations, sp√©cialement dans un environnement international (niveau d‚Äôanglais B2 minimum).
  • Les projets challengeant vous motivent et vous souhaitez prendre des responsabilit√©s rapidement.
  • Id√©alement, vous connaissez les m√©tiers des ressources humaines.
  • Vous √™tes particuli√®rement sensible √† l‚Äôimpact de la pratique du sport pour les valeurs qu'elle vous a permis d‚Äôacqu√©rir dans votre style de leadership et la vie en √©quipes !
  • Vous avez envie de rejoindre une entreprise √† impact positif (#Tech4Good).

Ce que nous offrons

  • Flexibilit√© dans l'organisation du travail (lieu, rythme)
  • Libert√© de choix de l'outil de travail (Mac, Windows)
  • √âquipe de projet locale et partage avec le r√©seau mondial (parcours international)
  • Mont√©e en comp√©tences (diversit√© des projets, des langues et des technologies)
  • Formations internes et externes
  • Actionnariat salari√©s
  • Primes mensuelles et trimestrielles

DECATHLON DIGITAL

Imaginez si la technologie nous permettait de repousser les fronti√®res et d'offrir des exp√©riences sportives in√©dites. C'est pr√©cis√©ment notre ambition chez Decathlon Digital ! Nous sommes une √©quipe de plus de 5 000 experts en ing√©nierie logicielle, gestion de produits, donn√©es, cloud et cybers√©curit√©, r√©partis √† Paris, Lille et Amsterdam. Ensemble, nous cr√©ons la plus vaste plateforme sportive num√©rique, en exploitant les innovations technologiques pour optimiser la cha√Æne de valeur, concevoir des exp√©riences connect√©es et donner une seconde vie √† nos produits.

Changeons la donne pour de bon. Notre passion du sport nous guide et nous voulons qu‚Äôelle perdure. C‚Äôest pourquoi nous nous engageons √† b√¢tir un mod√®le technologique plus durable, en r√©duisant notre impact direct sur l'environnement, et en cr√©ant un espace s√ªr et inclusif pour apprendre et nous √©panouir ensemble. Rejoins l‚Äô√©quipe et fa√ßonnons le futur du sport.

Introduction

Decathlon acc√©l√®re sa transformation digitale avec pour mission de devenir LA plateforme num√©rique sportive qui permettra aux clients de d√©couvrir notre univers √† travers de nombreuses exp√©riences locales centr√©es sur le sport.

Notre but est de cr√©er un √©cosyst√®me ouvert afin de connecter de nombreux acteurs et services tiers, de mani√®re s√ªre et performante.

Nos √©quipes digitales bas√©es √† Lille, Paris et Amsterdam regroupent plus de 1500 collaborateurs qui sont unis pour construire et faire grandir des produits num√©riques dans le but de toujours offrir la meilleure valeur √† nos utilisateurs.

Decathlon Digital

Et si la Tech nous permettait de r√©inventer le sport de demain et de devenir la plus grande plateforme num√©rique sportive ? c‚Äôest l‚Äôobjectif que nous nous fixons chez Decathlon.

‚ÄúTo Move People Through the Wonders of Sport‚Äù est notre mission. Une vocation qui atteint aujourd‚Äôhui son paroxysme en augmentant l‚Äôexp√©rience du sport par les technologies et r√©pondant aux besoins de nos 500 millions d‚Äôutilisateurs √† travers le monde.

Nous cr√©ons ainsi de nouvelles exp√©riences pour les sportives et sportifs ‚Äì coaching virtuel, programmes de fid√©lit√©, exp√©riences intelligentes en magasin, offres de produits neufs et d'occasion, mais aussi services de r√©paration et de location d'une large gamme de produits Decathlon et de partenaires.

Decathlon Digital, c‚Äôest aujourd‚Äôhui plus de 5000 profils techniques : software engineers, product managers, expert¬∑e¬∑s de la data, du Cloud et de la cybers√©curit√©, en France et √† l‚Äô√©tranger, implant√©es √† Paris, Lille, Nantes, Lyon, et Amsterdam.

L‚Äô√©quipe People Data au sein de Decathlon

Au c≈ìur de la r√©ussite de Decathlon se trouve notre engagement envers nos collaborateurs. Nous sommes convaincus que chaque collaborateur a le potentiel de s‚Äô√©panouir et de contribuer de mani√®re significative √† notre succ√®s collectif.

Le p√©rim√®tre People, au sein duquel s'inscrit notre √©quipe, est charg√© de veiller au d√©veloppement, au bien-√™tre et √† l'√©panouissement de nos talents. Notre mission est d'accompagner chacun de nos 100 000 collaborateurs dans son parcours professionnel, en lui offrant le soutien, les outils et les ressources n√©cessaires pour atteindre ses objectifs et d√©velopper son plein potentiel.

Dans ce contexte, l‚Äô√©quipe People Data joue un r√¥le essentiel dans la transformation et le d√©veloppement de notre entreprise. En lien √©troit avec les √©quipes RH, Engineering et Product, nous d√©finissons une strat√©gie commune port√©e par des objectifs et initiatives clairs et partag√©s.

Rejoindre l‚Äô√©quipe People Data, c‚Äôest int√©grer une √©quipe multi-comp√©tente de Data Product Managers, Data Analysts, BI engineers, Analytics Engineers, Data Engineers et d‚Äôexperts en Gouvernance de donn√©es. Plus de 20 profils qui travaillent √† d√©livrer les meilleurs produits, analyses ou solutions novatrices pour d√©velopper le People Analytics chez Decathlon.

REJOINS L'√âQUIPE PEOPLE DATA DE DECATHLON

En rejoignant l‚Äô√©quipe People Data vous serez int√©gr√©¬∑e dans une √©quipe data pluridisciplinaire et aurez l‚Äôoccasion de travailler sur l‚Äôensemble des processus RH :

  • Workforce management
  • Talent development
  • Compensation & benefits
  • Talent acquisition
  • Diversity, equity & inclusion
  • ‚Ä¶

Dans le cadre de l‚Äôouverture d‚Äôun poste en interne, nous recrutons un-e Data Product Manager, bas√©-e, au choix √† Lille o√π √† Paris.

Vos responsabilit√©s

En tant que Data Project Manager, vous aurez l‚Äôoccasion de :

  • Mener l'exploration continue et la product discovery en contact avec le m√©tier
  • Contribuer √† l‚Äô√©laboration de la roadmap et la planification de futures versions des produits avec une strat√©gie user-centric
  • Cr√©er l‚Äôensemble des cockpits m√©tiers et d√©finir leurs cycles de vie
  • Mener des travaux de recherche sur de nouveaux produits d‚Äôadvanced analytic, d‚Äôintelligence artificielle ou d‚Äôautres solutions novatrices
  • Ecrire la vision et la roadmap de tes produits et veiller au bon d√©veloppement de ceux-ci
  • D√©finir les KPIs sur lesquels s‚Äôanimer et estimer la cr√©ation de valeur
  • Cr√©er, maintenir, prioriser et communiquer sur le backlog produit
  • Responsabiliser l‚Äô√©quipe sur les r√©alisations: respect des principes structurants inh√©rents aux donn√©es de ton produit, prise en compte de la qualit√©
  • Comprendre l'architecture technique de votre produit

Le p√©rim√®tre technique

  • Environnement AWS (S3, Athena...)
  • Databricks
  • Outils de dataviz : Tableau
  • Technos Back/ langages : Python, SQL, Spark / Scala, Airflow, DBT

Ce dont vous aurez besoin pour r√©ussir

  • Vous avez d√©j√† plusieurs exp√©riences r√©ussies en tant que Product Manager sur des projets data ou digitaux.
  • Vous avez un √©tat d'esprit agile tourn√© vers l'am√©lioration continue et l'intelligence collective. Vous √™tes passionn√©-e de projet et aimez partager et contribuer.
  • Vous avez de bonnes capacit√©s de communication et de collaborations, sp√©cialement dans un environnement international (niveau d‚Äôanglais B2 minimum).
  • Les projets challengeant vous motivent et vous souhaitez prendre des responsabilit√©s rapidement.
  • Id√©alement, vous connaissez les m√©tiers des ressources humaines.
  • Vous √™tes particuli√®rement sensible √† l‚Äôimpact de la pratique du sport pour les valeurs qu'elle vous a permis d‚Äôacqu√©rir dans votre style de leadership et la vie en √©quipes !
  • Vous avez envie de rejoindre une entreprise √† impact positif (#Tech4Good).

Ce que nous offrons

  • Libert√© de choix de l'outil de travail (Mac, Windows)

  • Primes mensuelles et trimestrielles

DECATHLON DIGITAL

Imaginez si la technologie nous permettait de repousser les fronti√®res et d'offrir des exp√©riences sportives in√©dites. C'est pr√©cis√©ment notre ambition chez Decathlon Digital ! Nous sommes une √©quipe de plus de 5 000 experts en ing√©nierie logicielle, gestion de produits, donn√©es, cloud et cybers√©curit√©, r√©partis √† Paris, Lille et Amsterdam. Ensemble, nous cr√©ons la plus vaste plateforme sportive num√©rique, en exploitant les innovations technologiques pour optimiser la cha√Æne de valeur, concevoir des exp√©riences connect√©es et donner une seconde vie √† nos produits.

Changeons la donne pour de bon. Notre passion du sport nous guide et nous voulons qu‚Äôelle perdure. C‚Äôest pourquoi nous nous engageons √† b√¢tir un mod√®le technologique plus durable, en r√©duisant notre impact direct sur l'environnement, et en cr√©ant un espace s√ªr et inclusif pour apprendre et nous √©panouir ensemble. Rejoins l‚Äô√©quipe et fa√ßonnons le futur du sport.

column38:
We are a financial software development company focusing on banking, asset management and insurance. We have over 500 employees in ten different countries across four continents.

The R&D department of our company is essential and at the core of our activity: totaling 250 people mainly from our Paris and Tunis locations.

Our team of over 200 consultants work on implementing our software with our clients.

In Paris, our teams are all located in the center of the city, opposite the Brongniart palace, a historic and symbolic site of the stock exchange. This is an important symbol for illustrating our specialization in the world of finance.

Our field of activity encompasses finance, more specifically, investment management and data management. Our clients are therefore management companies, fund administrators, banks, stock exchanges, and insurance companies.

If you have a financial investment today, it is very likely that NeoXam software will be able to help manage it!

column38:
WHO ARE THEY ? üëÄ
Partoo is a B2B SaaS scale-up who is committed to helping local businesses, large companies or SMEs to get closer to their customers. To do this, they have developed an all-in-one platform and different solutions that revolve around 3 value propositions: Get Found, Get Chosen and Get Clients.

Through these 3 propositions, they have developed several products that adapt to changes in the customer purchasing journey:

üîé Get Found

  • Presence: Synchronize store information on main platforms (Google, Facebook, Waze, etc.), directories and GPS.
  • Store Locator: Help customers find the store that‚Äôs right for them with up-to-date local data and dedicated filters on retailer websites.
  • Social Media: Manage posts on Facebook, Google, Instagram, etc.

üéØ Get Chosen

  • Review: Centralize, reply to and analyze customer reviews received on Google and Facebook.
  • Booster: Get additional positive reviews on Google through SMS and QR codes.
  • Messages: Centralize and reply to all chat messages received via Google Business Messages, Messenger and soon also via Instagram, whatsapp, etc.

Acteur financier d'envergure internationale, Natixis Corporate & Investment Banking met √† disposition des entreprises, institutions financi√®res, sponsors financiers, souverains et supranationaux une palette de services en conseil, investment banking, financements, banque commerciale et sur les march√©s de capitaux.

Ses √©quipes d'experts, pr√©sentes dans 30 pays, conseillent les clients sur leur d√©veloppement strat√©gique en les accompagnant dans la croissance et la transformation de leurs activit√©s tout en maximisant leur impact positif. Si vous √™tes enthousiaste √† l'id√©e de relever des d√©fis passionnants, d'avoir un impact et de contribuer √† la construction du monde de demain, rejoignez-nous et faites bien plus qu'un simple job.

Au sein de CIO CIB (Corporate and Investment Banking), vous rejoignez l'√©quipe Client Data Architecture & Services en tant que Business Analyst. Cette √©quipe est responsable des projets en business inteligence (BI) li√©s √† Indixis, tels que le Datalake, le commercial de la CIB, ainsi que le support et la maintenance qui y sont associ√©s. Indixis permet de collecter des donn√©es depuis les syst√®mes front de tous les produits, de les normaliser, de les enrichir √† partir de r√©f√©rentiels, et de cr√©er/g√©n√©rer des analyses de l'activit√© commerciale de la CIB √† l'aide de diff√©rents outils d√©cisionnels.

Les principales th√©matiques du Datalake sont :

  • La performance commerciale : d√©compos√©e en une partie client (Client Contribution) et une partie vendeur (Sales Cr√©dit),
  • Le Hit Ratio : des demandes de prix √©lectroniques, r√©cup√©r√©es des plateformes,
  • Le suivi de la tr√©sorerie : calcul√©e en fonction des op√©rations effectu√©es par Global Market,
  • L'exploitation des donn√©es CRM : meeting, contacts, etc.. fournies par le CRM NAT1,
  • Les CPN1 (r√©glementaire) : contr√¥les r√©alis√©s en post Trade, afin de lever des alertes au Front,
  • Le pilotage commercial : suivi du NBI, RWA, ‚Ä¶ par les √©quipes coverage et indutry Bankers.

L'√©quipe est divis√©e en deux squads principales : la squad Client et la squad Global Market, bas√©es entre Paris et Porto.

Au quotidien, vous avez pour missions de :

  • Cadrer le recueil des besoins, des sp√©cifications et des tests ;
  • Planifier les sujets prioritaires en collaboration avec le squad lead et assurer le reporting de l'activit√© et des projets aupr√®s de ce dernier ;
  • Coordonner les √©quipes IT impliqu√©es et analyser des cas de support sur les IHM, les Dashboards BI et en base de donn√©es via des requ√™tes SQL ;
  • √ätre en charge de la conduite du changement aupr√®s des utilisateurs (communications, formations, d√©monstrations) ;
  • Contribuer √† la m√©thodologie Agile-Kanban (r√©unions quotidiennes, plannings poker, r√©trospectives).

Notre m√©thodologie de travail est agile et vous √™tes int√©gr√© √† notre communaut√© de business analyst.

#TransformativeFinance

Le poste est bas√© √† Paris et chez nous c'est 10 jours de t√©l√©travail par mois, 15 √† 17 jours de RTT par an, des services sur site comme la restauration, la salle de sport ou la conciergerie d'entreprise. Nos r√©mun√©rations sont compos√©es d'un fixe, d'un bonus annuel, d'un dispositif d'√©pargne entreprise incluant l'int√©ressement, la participation et l'abondement.
En tant que Top Employer, nous pla√ßons nos collaborateurs au centre de nos attentions. Des dispositifs de mobilit√© interne, d√©veloppement de carri√®re et de formation vous permettent de grandir et de vous √©panouir tout au long de votre parcours.
Vous √©voluez dans un environnement de travail hybride, inclusif et favorisant le collaboratif.
Vous avez √©galement la possibilit√© de vous engager en faveur de la soci√©t√© et de causes qui vous tiennent √† c≈ìur via notre fondation d'entreprise.

column15:
Whatever their stage of life, we provide over 108 million customers with the products and services they need to progress. From insurance to personal protection, and savings to wealth management, no matter the need we‚Äôre always there for them. And we‚Äôre always there for our employees. In 50 countries, we work hard to inspire pride and a sense of belonging in our people. To provide opportunities that challenge them, inspire them, and reward them. And to create a culture that‚Äôs open, supportive, and empowering. Because we know that‚Äôs the real secret to success ‚Äì and the best way for us to keep building a better world for both our customers and the talented people who put them first.

Your work environment:

The headquarters of the AXA Group (GIE AXA) brings together our corporate activities. It provides guidance and support to subsidiaries around the world, to ensure the coordination and monitoring of the Group's global strategy, the application of its standards, the consistency of commercial approaches and the sharing of best practices. The headquarters gathers approximately 1000 employees and is distinguished by its strong international culture (45 nationalities), which makes it a rich and stimulating place to work.

Within the Group, you will join the Group Investment Department

Within this Department, you will be part of the PI2 team.

The PI2 team collaborate with various suppliers (PBRC, RM, asset managers, rating agencies, Group IT, etc.) and clients (Group and local, finance, investment, risk, compliance, etc.).

The main challenges are:

  • To manage the complexity of huge numbers of complex investments, with new type of investments coming frequently, o to keep up to date with latest IT developments (cloud-based tools, AI, etc.)
  • To manage the multiple stakeholders which interests may not be aligned
  • To have the solidity of a robust process under the scrutiny of various internal controls and the agility to adapt rapidly to market crisis or other circumstances.

Detailed missions and responsibilities:

Provide the Group Investment professionals and other stakeholders with cutting-edge information systems fed by quality data to monitor the investments.

Main Clients:

  • Group Monitoring team
  • Group Investment Committee
  • GIA Senior Management
  • Center of Expertise
  • Investor Relations
  • Local Operating Units (Investment / Allocation Teams)

Key accountabilities :

  1. PI2 Technical Platform management
  • Contribute to the PI2 Infrastructure evolution o Include new functionalities for business needs (full entity onboarding, data market place‚Ä¶)
  • Collaborate with all IT experts within the Group (AXA GO, GIE DSI, Legal, Security)
  • Ensure that the documentation is up to date and reliable
  • Participate on the trainning on PI2 Community (Local Operating Units)

2. Monthly production¬†

  • Produce reliable, structured and timely monthly reports (including quantitative, qualitative et commented analyses)¬†
  • Ensure the review of the overall data quality and implement necessary controls for their review
  • Regular update of the report instructions and specifications
  • Interact and support other department teams e.g. Group Credit Team (GCT), Asset Liability Management Team (ALM), Group Investment Solutions (GIS), Group Risk Management (GRM), Investor Relations, Accounting (PBRC) and local entities
  • Manage daily data flows from various providers

Vous rejoignez une entreprise :

-¬†¬† ¬†Responsable, vis-√†-vis des personnes, y compris ses employ√©s et ses clients, et de la plan√®te.¬†-¬†¬† ¬†Aux valeurs fortes-¬†¬† ¬†Qui encourage la mobilit√© interne, et la formation de ses employ√©s-¬†¬† ¬†Qui vous offre de nombreux avantages (en savoir plus ici : Reward & Benefits - french | AXA Group)-¬†¬† ¬†Flexible, qui permet le travail hybride, au bureau et √† la maison.

Les informations fournies par les candidat(e)s seront trait√©es de mani√®re strictement confidentielle et utilis√©es uniquement √† des fins de recrutement.

column13: Business Analyst/Product Owner for Data Product Factory
column15:
Data Analyst for Data Product Factory

La Defense, Paris ‚Äì Hybrid¬†

Permanent¬†

At AXA IM our purpose, to act for human progress by investing for what matters, is central to every action we take as a business. As a responsible asset manager, we actively invest for the long-term to help our clients, our people and the world to prosper.¬†

As a future Business Analyst/Product Owner for Data Product Factory, you will report to Head of Data Products, and you will be part of AXA IM Technology.¬†

DISCOVER your opportunity ¬†

¬†As part of its Data strategy, AXA IM has built a very successful/state of the heart Data Product Factory. About 10+ various Data Product squads from different domains (Data Referential, Responsible Investment, Quant & Research, Finance, Digital, Front office, Operations, Trading, etc.) are building their own data product suite and leveraging the data families produced and maintained by others. The platform offers Data Pipeline industrialization, Data Science, Exploration, Visualization for our internal customers and other AXA Entities.

¬†As a Business Analyst for Data Product Factory, you will be responsible for providing a functional and technical analysis to the developers, liaising with the Data & Analytics Management team. With the tech leads, you will leverage those projects to transform strategically our Master Data Management (MDM) for AXA IM, i.e. modernizing, simplifying our processes and tech components, enhance the Data Referential Families (Instruments, Products and Portfolios, Indices, Forex, Third Parties‚Ä¶). You will participate to the definition and delivery of our product vision and features deliveries. You will interact closely with Data Management Evolution Team to deliver value to our customers. Your squad will be composed of a Product Owner, 4 Data Analysts, 11 Data Engineers and 2 Dev Ops Engineers.

¬†The Business¬†Analyst might also assist the Product Owner in building the entire product life cycle, including user needs gathering, market trend analysis, product trajectory, build, transition to support, operations, continual improvement, and decommissioning.

Your role and responsibilities¬†

As a Business Analyst for Data Referential, you will:

  • Analyse business context and problem statement, agree on acceptance criteria for strategic and BAU projects.
  • Write data referential requirements.
  • Define the path to deliver the best business outcome via POCs and MVPs
  • Guide developers in implementing data referential features for our internal customers.¬†
  • Test the solution implemented by the developers.
  • Transform and simplify our current architecture.
  • Collaborate with the end client and other technical teams on its implementation.
  • Interact with the support teams to exchange on new implementations or production issues.

You will also work alongside our Business and your squad to:

  • Influence and implement the 3-year plan product vision, strategy, and features.
  • Participate to the Data Model & Data Quality definition.
  • Agree on solution and impact on their usage of the data.
  • Influence, prioritisation and high-level delivery strategy.
  • Leverage our Data Platform Core team and partner with our Neoxam vendor to develop our MDM.
  • Highlight optimisation through constant feedback loops involving all actors of the value chain.
  • Influence towards tackling technical depth, testing automation, software industrialisation.

Engage with various representatives, demonstrate the ability to understand the business concepts and Operational Data Management, Operational security. Translate these into your feature designs and business outcomes.

As part of the AXA IM family, you are expected to:

  • Participate to our culture program, adopt/improve the squad purpose and values.
  • Keep team‚Äôs morale up.
  • Be ready to work with an international setting.
  • Value diversity and difference of opinion.
  • Transform AXA IM to simplify our value chain, increase our velocity, build a great working environment.¬†

Nous nous engageons √† vous offrir un environnement o√π vous pourrez :

D√©veloppez votre potentiel‚ÄØ: Int√©grer une entreprise engag√©e sur le d√©veloppement de ses collaborateurs via une mobilit√© interne dynamique et une large offre de parcours de formation personnalis√©s.

Personnalisez votre mani√®re de travailler‚ÄØ: Travailler pour une entreprise qui s'engage √† garantir flexibilit√© et √©quilibre √† ses employ√©s, en vous offrant une large gamme d'avantages (int√©ressement, t√©l√©travail, avantages sociaux comp√©titifs, etc.).

Epanouissez-vous par la diversit√© de notre communaut√©‚ÄØ: Jouer un r√¥le au sein d'une entreprise inclusive qui reconna√Æt et valorise activement les diff√©rences individuelles dans un environnement de travail diversifi√© et inclusif.

Faites avancer le monde‚ÄØ: Rejoindre un employeur responsable qui agit en faveur des causes soci√©tales et environnementales en tant qu'investisseur, assureur et entreprise, notamment au travers de l'association AXA Atout C≈ìur. Dans le cadre de notre engagement en faveur de la durabilit√© et de la responsabilit√© environnemental, nous c√©l√®brerons votre arriv√©e en plantant un arbre.

column4:
Chez PwC, nous croisons les approches et multiplions les possibles pour inventer un monde de solutions durables. Nous associons les meilleurs talents aux derni√®res technologies pour aider nos clients √† d√©cupler la confiance. C'est la strat√©gie mondiale du r√©seau PwC, The New Equation.

Faites partie des 8 000 nouveaux talents qui rejoindront nos √©quipes France et Maghreb d'ici 2025.

Rejoignez vous aussi La Nouvelle √âquation.

L'audit financier, c'est notre m√©tier historique. Mais cela ne nous emp√™che pas de le faire √©voluer ! Automatisation, digitalisation, intelligence artificielle‚Ä¶ cela change tout dans le traitement et l'analyse des √©tats financiers.

Ce qui rend l'audit des syst√®mes d'information et processus strat√©gique ?

La digitalisation croissante des transactions, la r√©silience et la s√©curit√© des syst√®mes d'information sont des enjeux cl√©s pour l'ensemble des parties prenantes. Pour cr√©er de la confiance, l'√©valuation des risques et la fiabilisation des syst√®mes d'information sont au c≈ìur de la strat√©gie pour fiabiliser la production des √©tats financiers, , en √©troite collaboration avec nos √©quipes d'audit financier.

C'est le r√¥le de nos collaborateurs. Et ils y arrivent d'autant plus facilement avec la collaboration de la communaut√© d'experts PwC en France et √† l'international.

Bienvenue dans l'audit du futur !

column13: Data Analysis & Engineering / Automations / Builder (Product & Operations) - Sustainability
column15:
Context: üçÉ

Greenly is on its way to becoming the #1 carbon management platform. We are a fast-growing company where new opportunities & challenges are commonplace. Joining us, you will be part of our Internal Operations team (8 people), which plays an important transversal role in helping Greenly scale by managing data flows, building great low/no code tools & products, and automating processes!

Your main tasks and responsibilities: ‚ö°Ô∏è

Your exact activities will depend on the projects ongoing when joining us, but they will most likely contribute to one or more of the following:

  • Participate in ensuring scalability, time efficiency, ease, satisfaction, and quality of the other teams‚Äô operations, mainly through building automation and internal tooling using low code tools such as Retool and Make.

  • More specifically, you will have a focus on what we call ‚ÄúDelivery Ops‚Äù: helping our Climate Experts carry out our client‚Äôs GHG Assessments in the most standardized and efficient way possible (internal tool to manage a portfolio of clients and their progress, know when to do what through an internal task management system, provide tools to help them carry out their tasks, give a better overview of each Climate Expert‚Äôs workload and each mission‚Äôs progress, help them report on what takes the most time,..)

  • Technical support to other teams regarding tools, bugs, and spontaneous data requests (data exploration/manipulation, SQL queries, low/no code tools).
column38:
Greenly is a B-corp certified software company founded in 2019 by Alexis, Matthieu and Arnaud. It allows each company to easily track its carbon footprint, to take part in the fight against climate change. üå±

More than 2000 companies have already trusted Greenly to effectively reduce their greenhouse gas emissions. Because with Greenly, companies measure accurately, reduce sustainably, contribute intelligently and report on their progress.

Greenly‚Äôs platform combines smart data collection with advanced features to create the world‚Äôs most intuitive carbon accounting solution.

Greenly also offers support of a climate expert throughout the client‚Äôs journey.

  • Take Home Assignment + restitution during a 2nd call

  • Optional additional calls

column15:
WANT TO KNOW MORE ABOUT OUR BIG TECH TRANSFORMATION?

L‚ÄôOr√©al is present in 130 countries on five continents. For more than a century, L‚ÄôOr√©al has devoted itself solely to one business: beauty; it is now the industry world leader with ‚Ç¨42 billion consolidated sales.

Today, L‚ÄôOr√©al includes more than 2000 tech positions and it‚Äôs constantly growing. Especially with our ambition to become the #1 BeautyTech company, meaning inventing the beauty of the future while becoming the company of the future.

BeautyTech will equip the Group with the key assets it needs to conquer this new world, where Tech has become strategic.

To achieve this ambition, L‚ÄôOr√©al needs to continue recruiting diverse, innovative, skilled and passionate minds in different tech domains such as Data, Digital, Cloud, Cyber Security, IT Architecture, DevOps, Applications and Infrastructure.

LET US INTRODUCE YOU THE CONTEXT AND MISSIONS!

The Data Integration Solutions Architect is responsible to design data integration solutions within the domain integration to meet the needs of the business. The responsibilities of the Solution Architect include gathering requirements and functional specifications, evaluating existing solution systems to identify areas for improvement.

Ma in missions

  • Collaborate with stakeholders (EA, Project, Integration Ambassador) to understand business requirements and data integration needs.
  • Evaluate and select appropriate pattern and services for data integration.
  • Ensure compliance with L‚ÄôOr√©al Enterprise Architecture Strategy.
  • Work closely with Integration Solution Ambassador and Integration Platform to ensure that user needs, and feedback are incorporated into solution design and improvements.
  • Analyze Data Integration performances and design improvement
  • Provide technical guidance and mentorship to data integration teams.
  • Support integration project delivery
  • Stay updated on industry trends and emerging technologies in data integration .


Subsidiary missions
  • Contributes to healthcare application integration strategy and implementation in the community.
  • Facilitate training on integration techniques and methods, including creation of documentation for such training


INTERESTED?

THIS IS WHAT YOU WILL NEED TO SUCCEED!

First and foremost, we love people that are curious, collaborative, eager to have an impact, proactive and who value innovation, autonomy, and team spirit.

Secondly, in this specific position, it will be important for you to have :

Pre-requisites:
  • Ex perience in API Concept, programming concepts and Data Integration design patterns.
  • Experience Designing API or Webservices (REST & SOAP)
  • Experience with Event Driven Architecture
  • Experience with architecting complex frameworks.
  • Current understanding of best practices regarding system security measures.
  • Strong Experience on at last one Integration tools of the market (Azure Integration Stack, Mulesoft, Boomi, Kafka‚Ä¶.).
  • Strong knowledge on Cloud, SAAS Integration concept (IPaas).
  • Experience with Data Ecosystem (GCP Bigquery, Power BI).
  • Experience in leading technical deliveries (CI/CD) .


Competencies:
  • Demonstrated ability to communicate complex technical information in a condensed manner to various stakeholders verbally and in writing
  • Ability to understand the business and assimilates the overall business strategy of the company, the long-term needs of users/customers.
  • Efficient communication skills.
  • Strong organizational and leadership skills
  • Ability to convert business requirements to business processes and technical designs.
  • Ability to work in a team-based setting and alone in a worldwide environment.
  • Adaptability and willingness to learn new skills, technologies, and frameworks.
  • Leadership experience


Experience:
  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in information technology, software engineering, computer science, or related field.
  • Proven experience in engineering and integration API architecture design.
  • Proven experience in global environment with multicultural stakeholders
  • Proven experience in project management
  • Background in retail, luxe industry is preferred.
  • 7 -10 years in IT function


WAIT, THERE IS MORE! LET US GIVE YOU 4 OTHER REASONS TO JOIN US!

Joining L‚ÄôOr√©al means joining a company that:

  1. Invests in Tech and positions its Tech teams at the heart of its digital transformation strategy.
  2. Allows its employees to have a real impact, to test their ideas, to innovate and to build our future.
  3. Has a powerful and innovative HR policy: a very dynamic mobility policy, significant investment in employee training, regular re-evaluation of remuneration, numerous innovative HR measures: Time Savings Account, paternity leave, Citizen Day, etc.
  4. Has chosen to uphold strong values and to be particularly advanced from a social and environmental point of view (strong diversity and inclusion policy, L‚ÄôOr√©al for the Future program, commitment to numerous communities, etc.).

The L‚ÄôOr√©al Group is convinced that difference is a deep source of wealth, that allows everyone to grow, to challenge themselves and to go further.

We strongly encourage everyone to always dare and never censor themselves. Skills can always be learnt.

We will be delighted to exchange with you!

Ready to build the future of L‚ÄôOr√©al together? Apply now!
column38:
The desire for beauty has existed since the beginning of humanity. It‚Äôs a universal aspiration which crosses time, countries, and cultures.

Beauty is a powerful force that moves us.

We know that beauty is more than just looking good.
Beauty gives us confidence in who we are, in who we want to be, and in our relationships with others.

For over a century we have been dedicated to one sole vocation: creating beauty.
We remain true to the pioneering spirit of our founder and enjoy the unwavering support of his family, who have always accompanied our development.

Our goal is to offer each and every person around the world the best of beauty‚ÄØin terms of quality, efficacy, safety, sincerity and responsibility to satisfy all beauty needs and desires in their infinite diversity.

Because beauty is a permanent quest, we harness the power of our innovation to continually enhance the performance of our products and services.
Because we value diversity,‚ÄØwe leverage each of our brands to celebrate all expressions of beauty.

Because we strive to be exemplary with a long-term vision, we anchor our actions in our strong values and demanding ethical principles.

And because we are the global leader in beauty, we are aware that‚ÄØeverything we do can have a meaningful impact.
Therefore:

We act to shape the future of beauty‚ÄØby leveraging the best of science and technology, increasingly inspired by nature.

We act to drive social innovation‚ÄØby offering the best working conditions, training, and social protection for our employees.

We act to build a business with inclusivity at its heart‚ÄØby ensuring we are as diverse as the people we serve.

We act to nurture‚ÄØlasting partnerships‚ÄØwith our clients and suppliers‚ÄØbased on mutual trust and collaboration.

We act to create value for all our shareholders, by sustaining a robust business model.

We act to champion the cause of women‚ÄØand to strengthen the communities with which we engage.

We act to protect the beauty of the planet‚ÄØby fighting climate change, respecting biodiversity and preserving natural resources.
